676836649.name: Closed - until resolved
676836649.author: a TripAdvisor user
676836649.reviewBody: Entrance to actual park closed until resolved. Make sure you check status before a long trip to see. \n\nVisitor center was very nice with trails out onto lava flats. Able to see wildlife. Saw a  falcon and a few chuckwallas!

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

675304525.name: BEAUTIFUL place!
675304525.author: a TripAdvisor user
675304525.reviewBody: Beautiful place! Drive through carefully, make sure your tank is full and radiator is operating properly!!!!

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

660449174.name: What an AWESOME place!
660449174.author: a TripAdvisor user
660449174.reviewBody: One of the world\'s most biodiverse deserts. FANTASTIC cacti -- saguaro, cholla, barrels, ocotillo and many others. Beautiful cinder cones and craters. Giant sand dunes. A beautiful visitor\'s center. A long 50-mile dirt road, which was no problem for our Jeep. We stayed in nearby Puerto Penasco, very do-able from there. Highly recommended!

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

660042790.name: Stunning vistas and comforting silence
660042790.author: a TripAdvisor user
660042790.reviewBody:
We visited here twice over ten years. The options in this park are truly inspiring. After viewing the exhibits at the Visitor Center you can choose between 4 trails-3 have placards about the flora and fauna. You can also hike out to the dunes-a good 2 hour excursion that will reward you with silence and the beauty of the desert. The silence of this park, the variety of colors and geology is very impressive. 

There is another loop road down the road a bit. That road is dusty and lonely and really worth it if you are in the mood for a longer trip to the remote desert.

We stayed at Puerto Penasco and love that town for the beach and seafood. But the noise inspired us to see this amazing quiet place. As always-the friendliness of the people in Mexico added a ingredient to it all.

It is worth seeking out. And very affordable. Like a lot of parks-the gate is locked at 5. So head out early and enjoy this incomparable place.

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

644941998.name: Its an ADVENTURE! Yes ...and No.
644941998.author: a TripAdvisor user
644941998.reviewBody:
If you have a passion or preference for the desert as well as a love for rugged rides along dirt roads... well this could be the best choice for you. Minimum time needed is 2.5 hours and that's pushing it. 
I strongly suggest packing a lunch and afternoon snack along with a good supply of water... 2 to 3 litters per person if you like. Dress in layers and wear comfortable shoes and clothes. 
The desert views are some of the best I've seen. We had lush green brush and a forest of cacti surrounding us at times. There are several pullouts along the drive, but this is not a place for off reading fun. At these pullouts you'll find information about the Flora and Fauna, the weather of the area, the geology and volcanic activity.
It's mostly a single direction, one lane road. The first major stop is the giant crater left from a collapsed lava bubble. It's interesting, but nicer if you are into hiking.... It's not a long hike, less than two kilometers round trip. The day we were there the wind was very gusty and cold so we just wanted to get back in the car. The second big stop is similar to the unknowing eye though the surrounding terrain is completely different ...I imagine the geological aspects are also different, but we were more interested in trying to exit the park before the gates were closed and locked... so we did very little exploring. 
We should have come early, but we thought we'd do a late picnic lunch and just do a bit of driving. We didn't know that the road was a one-way loop and would take so long just to drive. We were under prepared for our day to this park. The visitor center that is just off hwy about 10 miles outside of Puerto Penasco was closed this day, it was our original destination, but we opted to drive the distance. We checked in at the gate around 12:30 and we exited at 4:40... We didn't hike, we did have our lunch at the first pullout but stayed in the car because it was so cold and windy that day. The road was rugged at times, I'm a country boy so no big deal... my wife's a city girl and let's just say it was not a pleasant ride for her. It's fun for the first 30 minutes, but then the drive can be very tiring. Washboard roads, many rutts and dips, soft sand and the occasional puddle are expected. If you choose this day long adventure... go with an open mind and your favorite supplies.

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

635699213.name: Sonora, Mexico
635699213.author: a TripAdvisor user
635699213.reviewBody: Now an international protected site, this is a must see if you are anywhere near the border. You are three hours from Phoenix or Yuma to see an amazing area. Bring your own water as it is warm and there are no tourist facilities, it is very much a natural site.

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

604679200.name: Amazing biosphere.
604679200.author: a TripAdvisor user
604679200.reviewBody: Stop here several times in the past, what an amazing biosphere, with lot\'s to see and do, go in the cooler months as summer can be extremely hot. Great visitor center with a very friendly staff.

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

585875453.name: Lovely visitor center
585875453.author: a TripAdvisor user
585875453.reviewBody: Glad I wasn\'t driving my corolla!  So enjoyed the day but exhausted by the time I returned to Palm Springs.  Definitely should have stayed over somewhere.

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

581681075.name: Worth the trip
581681075.author: a TripAdvisor user
581681075.reviewBody: They have a very nice visitor center.  Drive is down a dirt road that passes several craters and lava flows that are just stunning.

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

574991583.name: Amazing place. Better if you have a SUV or truck but you can do it in a sedan, just very bumpy dirt road.
574991583.author: a TripAdvisor user
574991583.reviewBody: The craters were amazing! We didn\'t see wildlife but that\'s to be expected. The visitor center is top notch!

itemReviewed.name: El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar Biosphere Reserve

675920686.name: A Beach For The Adventurous
675920686.author: a TripAdvisor user
675920686.reviewBody:
Long long stretch of soft warm sand with aqua blue waters.  This is a beach straight out of the past before  development overruns its wide open swath jutting into the sea.

It's wild, mostly deserted and without facilities for daytrippers.

Some folks will find it too far out from the center of town.

But if you're lucky enough to be renting a home in the dunes of this gem of a beach, you are BEYOND lucky enough!

The tide rolls up to your cottage steps and is mesmerizing.  You can walk for miles and never come across another person at this time of year.  Solitude mixed with the beauty of nature - it's nirvana.

There can be pesky flies and the wind can chop up the waves.  But the sound of lapping waves hitting the shoreline will put you soundly to sleep at night.

It's a bit rustic so not for everyone.  There is no one taking your drink order for instance.

But if you truly love the ocean and want to experience this beach before towers, condos, and throngs of people make this their newest beachhead, then come on down!

675746836.name: RELAXING, BEAUTIFUL, CANNOT WAIT TO RETURN
675746836.author: a TripAdvisor user
675746836.reviewBody: We spent a few days in Playa Encanto.  Had a great rental, steps from the beach.  Well equipped condo at Paradise Villas, 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths.  Had a few small inconveniences, but they were addressed and everything was fine.  Will definitely return to the same condo the next time it is available.

649997270.name: Beautiful area but a little far from town
649997270.author: a TripAdvisor user
649997270.reviewBody: This is where you want to go for finding sand dollars. Go the morning after the full moon and you\'ll be scooping up tons of them. The beach is beautiful and clean. The homes out there are spectacular but they have to get their water shipped in. That and the distance from central Rocky Point are the only reason I gave it 4 stars.

643650848.name: Beautiful Beach
643650848.author: a TripAdvisor user
643650848.reviewBody: Rented a house on Playa Encanto over the Christmas holiday. Beach was practically deserted. It is beautiful though. Many many shells, mostly gentle surf and during this time of the year a remarkable ability to provide sunrise and sunset over the water.

618916988.name: Beautiful, Relaxing Beach Home
618916988.author: a TripAdvisor user
618916988.reviewBody: A beautiful lazy beach!. . .  within 30 minute beach walk to Mayan with all the Mayan privileges. Great condo rental on third floor. Go into town to get a Flavio\u2019s Margarita. . Much happiness\ud83d\ude0e

618274982.name: Serenity
618274982.author: a TripAdvisor user
618274982.reviewBody: I absolutely loved this stay!!! The kids enjoyed the beach we enjoyed the kids enjoying the beach. Kites, food and drinks next to a beautiful ocean! Great family time! We will be back!

586521146.name: Mellow Beach and Community
586521146.author: a TripAdvisor user
586521146.reviewBody: Playa Encanto rates high for mellow days and excellent beach access. The gated community sports cool beach architecture influenced by regions from throughout the world--Mediterranean, Persian, and, of course, Mexican. The beach is never crowded--at all. Lots of shells and space and the rising and setting of the sun is an explosion of colors flaring and subsiding across the sea-sky and water. Those with vacation rentals charge a range of prices, so price shop for the best deal. Bring some smoke, bring some brew, and bring your friends. The beach vibe is hello mellow.

581670486.name: One of the best beaches anywhere!  Just little waves so it\'s great for kids and paddle boarding.
581670486.author: a TripAdvisor user
581670486.reviewBody: Just little waves so it\'s great for kids and paddle boarding.  It\'s never crowded and just a great place for a family vacation

576065230.name: hung out on beach and swam in ocean - beautiful
576065230.author: a TripAdvisor user
576065230.reviewBody: ocean is excellent and perfect for distance swimming.  beach is soft sand with great views and space to move around

567585393.name: Shells galore
567585393.author: a TripAdvisor user
567585393.reviewBody: Love this beach!!  There are soooo many shells!!  We even saw octopus, starfish and sand dollars.  It is a perfect beach for kids because the sand is so soft, very low waves and very shallow for hundreds of feet.  The best part is that it is not very populated so you feel like you have the whole place to yourself.

507598088.name: Pretty Beach
507598088.author: a TripAdvisor user
507598088.reviewBody: Pretty beach. A lot cleaner than the one with the vendors. There they just use anything as their trash can. Here you can beach comb a little, and get into the warm water.

500500447.name: Best Shelling Beach
500500447.author: a TripAdvisor user
500500447.reviewBody: Take you shade and chairs, ice chest, and grab your bags to fill with the best sea shells and sand dollars.  Worth the drive.

491555869.name: Great beach
491555869.author: a TripAdvisor user
491555869.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful and has lots of shells.  It is very sandy on the bottom a long way out.  Fun for the kids! No facilities

472795694.name: Gorgeous, clean, quiet beach
472795694.author: a TripAdvisor user
472795694.reviewBody: Will visit again. Keep In mind, there are no facilities on the beach so don\'t venture too far from your rental property. We did t find this to be a problem, but it bears mentioning. Easy drive from Tucson.

449534767.name: Beach is Great!
449534767.author: a TripAdvisor user
449534767.reviewBody: Love the Beach, Its Mexico so don\'t expect a pristine area there is garbage in the area, but otherwise its a wonderful place! \nWe enjoy, The tide that rolls back in the morning & searching for those perfect seashells; Also we enjoy our hermit crab hunt, the kids love them and they are everywhere!; We love the vendors that come by, we have done woven bracelets; rides on the beach on donkey and horse; and shopped for hats and glasses right on the beach!\nYou can: ( rent w/ the vendors) jet ski\'s; fly kites; PinaColadas; shopping (by the beach w/ vendors)

448143363.name: Endless sand lined with private homes.
448143363.author: a TripAdvisor user
448143363.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with no vendors. Fabulous for beach combing. Quiet. Good place to bring a picnic. Parking signage isn\'t the greatest. Didn\'t see any restrooms on the beach.

447490581.name: Beach goes on forever
447490581.author: a TripAdvisor user
447490581.reviewBody: The beach is a shell lovers paradise, with miles of clean sand spotted with sea shells.  Every morning we walked the beach and found new treasures.  We rented a house on this beach and woke up to the beautiful sunrise.

414316399.name: longest smoothest beach you\'re going to find RP area
414316399.author: a TripAdvisor user
414316399.reviewBody: south of town, maybe a 15 minute drive and half of it on a dirt road, but wow, what a great beach. be advised this is in an enclosed community and you will have stop at the guard gate for access. there\'s lots of breaks in the houses to get to the beach. bring everything because there\'s nothing on the beach except people\'s homes. but it\'s flat, beautiful smooth beach. even when the tide goes WAY out like it does in the gulf, the beach is just bigger, no rocks. good sand dollar hunting too.

410519684.name: Deserted beach
410519684.author: a TripAdvisor user
410519684.reviewBody: Granted we went on a Wednesday afternoon, but there was nobody else on the beach. No vendors,  but no facilities either. Beautiful soft sand beach, lots of shells.  Water was warm and pretty clear. Well worth the 30 min drive from town

408974454.name: Very nice condo
408974454.author: a TripAdvisor user
408974454.reviewBody: We rented Encanto 303 from a very nice Phoenix gentleman through Homeaway. Had option of paying through Homeaway or lower cost direct with owner.  Was nice to save a little paying direct to owner. Condo was immaculate and had everything you would need. Beautiful views   Only gave it 4 stars due to location. It is about 25 minutes outside of Puerto Penasco and although that does not seem too far, it really got old driving to grocery store, restaurants etc. if you stay at Encanto, you can use facilities at nearby Mayan Resort- restaurants, golf which was a plus. The Encanto does not have any restaurant snack bar, drinks etc. it is quiet and relaxing with a beautiful swimming pool. We will return to Puerto Penasco as it is so convenient for us to drive but know now to stay in Sandy Beach area where all the amenities are close by. Otherwise, the condo itself is great, perhaps there will be a build up in the area in future years.  You are really quite isolated

400217309.name: Playa Encanto is truly an enchanted beach.
400217309.author: a TripAdvisor user
400217309.reviewBody: Way better than Sandy Beach.   Everyone should go see this magnificent beach.  Loved it,  loved it! ! It is outside of town,  but its worth going there.  Also, it\'s super clean.   Make sure you take all your food and beverages. Kids loved this place and had lots of fun.   Stayed there the whole day.

395078453.name: Great beach
395078453.author: a TripAdvisor user
395078453.reviewBody: If you don\'t mind being out of the way this area is fantastic.  We have watched it grow over the past 25 years to a great community.  It is gorgeous virgin beach that is the best in Penasco

394664583.name: Show friends Rocky Point
394664583.author: a TripAdvisor user
394664583.reviewBody: We had friends from Canada that wanted to see Rocky Point so we got a house  on the beach at Playa Encanto.  This area is a gated community.   Nice sandy beach, a little distance from all the activity\'s of town and stores.   Great outdoor (toes in sand) Oyster bar at the back of the houses.  (take your own drinks)  Be very careful when renting some of these houses we had the bad luck of renting a place and the owner had all the closets locked with there own stuff inside, we could not pack any of our stuff out!!

386721670.name: Beach vacation
386721670.author: a TripAdvisor user
386721670.reviewBody: Plant in Kanto is very nice secluded beach area just east of Puerto Penasco it\'s a gated community it\'s 24 hour security very well maintained very clean beaches for down there in Mexico the staff that was working there was very friendly and very informative about things make sure that you knew how to find things around the area there\'s also a great oyster bar it\'s a little ways past the housing area most of the houses there are very close to the beach so and the rent on each of these places very reasonable okay you will enjoy that area

356458270.name: Beautiful quiet beach just outside of Rocky Point
356458270.author: a TripAdvisor user
356458270.reviewBody: We brought the kids down to the beach during the chaos of Spring Break with no worries.  This area is about 10 minutes outside of town and far away from the crowds with sugar sand beach.  We rented a nearby beach house with great views and plenty of room.  The area is behind a manned security gate.  While it is a trip back into town for nightlife, shopping, or restaurants, with planning this is a great get away to relax and be away from the crowds.  Some vendors still get in so it is not completely isolated and you can get your trinkets. Find yourself a beach house rental and come enjoy the beach and sun.

660889553.name: Ecofun sol chaser
660889553.author: a TripAdvisor user
660889553.reviewBody: If you\'re ready to chill and leave behind your expectations of a perfect American tour company, this is a great choice.  Don\'t bother to register through their website, you need to call their Arizona phone number or message them on facebook.  Be aware that on some days they stop at a secondary location to pick up guests, and it\'s going to prolong your day.  \nOur tour left promptly at nine on a Saturday morning, we were served bags of chips, a burrito, and cookies along the route. It was a 90 minute trip to the island and I think we were there about 2 hours. The sea lions were fascinating and we had a great time kayaking and swimming. The crew was terrific, warm, and helpful. I felt safe and welcomed the whole time. \nWear your sunblock and bring a jacket/dry change of clothes as well as your sense of humor and flexibility. You\'ll have a great day.

643872639.name: Weather was rough but crew was great
643872639.author: a TripAdvisor user
643872639.reviewBody: Unfortunately we did not get the full experience of Isla San Jorge, because the wind kicked up and the sea was really rough.  We could not get near the islands, or go out in kayaks.  On the trip back, the boat ended up taking on water after a HUGE wave washed over the top, resulting in many wet, scared children (Including mine!).  However, the crew handled it all very professionally.  Food and drinks were great.  We would probably try again if we go back to Rocky Point.  I would just suggest checking the weather first!

640778866.name: Best day
640778866.author: a TripAdvisor user
640778866.reviewBody: Read previous review!! Best day, great trip. Well worth the time, and money. Baby seals were the star attraction, so cute and curious.

626616927.name: Cool
626616927.author: a TripAdvisor user
626616927.reviewBody: Isla San Jorge or Bird Island is a protected area with a full community of Sea lions. If Sea lions are you thing this should will be in your bucket list when visiting Puerto Pe\u00f1asco a.k.a. Rocky Point. \nI visited through a Ecofun rental services.\nI will come to Bird Island on my next visit to Rocky Point.

610976192.name: Not to be Missed!
610976192.author: a TripAdvisor user
610976192.reviewBody: Please don\'t go all the way to Rocky Point and then miss this opportunity to go out on a boat to "Bird Island" as the gringos say.\nThis is what the Sea of Cortez is all about. On the way to or from the island you have good chances of spotting dolphins and/or whales!!! When you get to the island you will be met by a huge colony of sea lions. It is fantastic!

594514037.name: A.K.A. Bird Island
594514037.author: a TripAdvisor user
594514037.reviewBody: Long cruise to the island (3 hours). Take a cooler with lots of water (and or snacks). The island is off-limits to humans and covered with bird waste, making it appear to be white in color. Good for observing birds and nesting sea lions in the wild. Snorkeling is fun, but the water is somewhat murky. Observing sealife (fish) is not the goal, however, getting close enough to the island to observe the sea lions in the water with you is exciting. They will swim up close to you when you are 15-20 yards from the island and check you out. Kinda freaky, but exhillerating. The boat crew are not lifesavers. Snorkeling is not recommended for young or inexperienced swimmers. Life preservers were provided by the crew.  It was a good time, just a long cruise.

577425361.name: fun booze cruise
577425361.author: a TripAdvisor user
577425361.reviewBody: went with a friend who had never snorkeled - snorkeling was nice with the sea lions - but don\'t go if you think you\'re going to see any fish

576967111.name: Fun day
576967111.author: a TripAdvisor user
576967111.reviewBody: We left from Mayan Palace aboard a party catamaran. Staff were efficient and friendly with the tender transfer. The trip out ,14 miles, luckily was calm. Offered unlimited drinks, too early for me, and a tasty burrito brunch. \nIslam San Jorge was a line of barren islands loaded with birds and sea lions. We had the opportunity to snorkel, kayak or tour the shoreline by boat. Snorkeling was a treat with the curiou sea lions diving and circling around. Saw very few fish and thankfully no sharks.\nEnjoyed the day.

574063919.name: swimming with the sea lions
574063919.author: a TripAdvisor user
574063919.reviewBody: this was a great experience. they swim up close to you and look right into your eyes.. also lots of birds blue footed boobies

563634317.name: Wonderful Excursion!!!
563634317.author: a TripAdvisor user
563634317.reviewBody: We took the kids on this excursion and we all had a marvelous time. The sea lion was a great experience for them and kayaking by sea lions was a once in a lifetime treat. Kids were also able to snorkle and it was all in all a great day! Definitely recommend it.

555296702.name: If this is "Bird Island" it is a MUST SEE.
555296702.author: a TripAdvisor user
555296702.reviewBody:
I am assuming this is "Bird Island".  If so it is incredible.  I have gone with birding groups and with friends and with family.  It is a full day trip and about 3-4 hours from Rocky Point.  Most boats have food and unlimited drinks as part of the trip.  it is inhabited only by birds and birders can't believe the "life birds" that they see up close.  
    You can snorkel here or swim with the dolphins and sea lions. 
 Almost everyone that does ends up crying because of the thrill and wonder of being with these incredible, friendly creatures.  Even those that stay on board get goose bumps.  
   I have a couple of friends that have paid several thousand to go on nature trips to "swim with dolphins", and then come here and can't believe how wonderful and spiritual and private it is compared with the commercial trips to Europe.

542717771.name: Awesome
542717771.author: a TripAdvisor user
542717771.reviewBody: Beautiful day on the water today! Captain Oscar and Peter  with Del Mar charters made sure everyone was well cared for from the old to the young!  We loved being the only ones at bird island. We were able to snorkel and kayak for 2 hours. Lots of sea lion action going on!  The boat is comfortable for traveling and the burritos were top notch. Will be going on more tours with del mar in the future. Book now! You won\u2019t regret it!

539187060.name: If nataure does not scares you...
539187060.author: a TripAdvisor user
539187060.reviewBody: It is not easy to see a hundresds of sea lions around you, coming back and forth just like if they wanted to hit you, but they don\u00b4t they are just palying sinde the small young fellows are the ones around you.

501297009.name: Worth the boat ride - swim with sea lions
501297009.author: a TripAdvisor user
501297009.reviewBody: Once in a lifetime experience!  Bring your underwater camera and lots of sunscreen.  Our kids loved this!

500969285.name: Nothing beats swimming with sea lions!!!!
500969285.author: a TripAdvisor user
500969285.reviewBody: I totally thought I was not going to be brave enough to do this, but I was and am so glad I did. My family and I will remember this forever. The sea lions are so fascinating and the boat ride was fun as well.

495492922.name: Bird island at last
495492922.author: a TripAdvisor user
495492922.reviewBody: So after 4 years of attempts on a smaller vessel)not eco fun) we decided to take a catamaran day trip to bird island.  It was a ton of fun but at the end, a long day.  The trip started at meeting at the dock at 6:30 and ended around 5.  Those entering from the Mayan palace have a much shorter and probably more enjoyable trip.  Drinks were weak but plentiful and that was had good.  Music was good classic rock in the morning then Cumbria later as the day progressed.  Not my thing but oh well can\'t please everyone.  They kept us fed well with bean or meat burritos and snacks.  The kayaks were great fun as was snorkeling.  The seals were plentiful and as near as you wished to go.  Glad we went but a shorter boat ride would have been good.

489074363.name: Long, long day
489074363.author: a TripAdvisor user
489074363.reviewBody: Fun day, however, we were told to be there at 6:30am and would return between 3:00 and 4:00.... We didn\'t get back until 5:30!! ... We were also told there would be food, snacks etc. So we didn\'t bring anything with us... Big mistake!! The 4 kids with us were absolutely starving! There was no orientation when we got on the boat... It would have been nice to know the time frame of how long we had once we got there. We weren\'t able to kayak because they were all taken.. We went for a swim and when we got back it was time to leave... So that was a bummer. Sea lions were cool. Just the overall experience could have been so much better.

469681902.name: Snorkeling with sea lions
469681902.author: a TripAdvisor user
469681902.reviewBody: Del Mar Charters w/Capt. Oscar was a great family adventure. An hour long trip (one way) in a speed boat capable of 14 people (including a crew of two). We had a small bay to ourselves and the sea lions. Capt. Oscar has a great knowledge of the local marine life and is obviously passionate about it. Highly recommend this.

454373331.name: What\'s not to like? Swim with the sea lions
454373331.author: a TripAdvisor user
454373331.reviewBody: Despite getting quite seasick on the way over, our 17 year old daughter thought swimming with the dolphins was one of the best adventures ever.  Her laughter and cackling through her snorkel was music to our ears.   We went over on one of the eco boats.  Food wasn\'t amazing, so if you don\'t like soggy sandwiches...bring your own....but we met some great people and had a great time.  We brought wetsuits which made swimming with the sea lions much more enjoyable...because the water was quite cold.  Bring warm clothes for on your way back!!!

451562401.name: Worth the trip??
451562401.author: a TripAdvisor user
451562401.reviewBody: Been there many times when we had a boat in Penasco.  Not much to see.   Fishing is not that great there.  Guess it is worth it if you really want to see seals and tons of bird guano.  Now we only see it from the ocean side holes at The Mayan Palace golf course when we golf there.

448698648.name: Wildlife galore!
448698648.author: a TripAdvisor user
448698648.reviewBody:
Isla San Jorge, known to the locals as Bird Island, is a formation off the coastline. You go by boat from Puerto Penasco (Rocky Point) on a cruise of 3 hours. The journey is very much worth it as you will see not just many birds but also sea lions sunning themselves on the island or cavorting in the ocean. They are loud and call to each other, really a great experience.

For birders, there are grey and brown boobies, pelicans, frigates and more. Apparently the island is a stop off for up to 20 different species of birds, so binoculars is a must. 

There are also eco tours which have kayaks and paddle boards for those wanting a closer look. It is a great way to see the coast from Penasco down to the Mayan Palace.

428266250.name: Wow!  Must see
428266250.author: a TripAdvisor user
428266250.reviewBody: This was just awesome.  We have been going to Rocky Point for years and I can\'t believe we have never done it.  It was wonderful!!!!!  You are right up close with the sea lions! They are fascinating!

415818515.name: Kayaking and Swimming
415818515.author: a TripAdvisor user
415818515.reviewBody: This is a fun time and great adventure.  Try the snorkeling or just swimming.  Waters can be rough so check out the weather before you go.  Great place to do just about whatever with water.

400161157.name: Fun times
400161157.author: a TripAdvisor user
400161157.reviewBody: Had a blast kayaking, snorkeling  and swimming  with the seals it was awesome. We got to see lots of dolphins  also.

397628063.name: Awesome time
397628063.author: a TripAdvisor user
397628063.reviewBody: My family has stayed at Mayan Palace several times and we have been out to Isla San Jorge two times now.  It\'s a great way to spend at day.  There\'s music on the boat and you can drink as much as you want.  When you get there you can swim so close to the sea lions.  We will definitely do this again.

397092915.name: Fun adventure!
397092915.author: a TripAdvisor user
397092915.reviewBody: Great day snorkeling and swimming with the seals. The trip was pleasant and the weather, of course, was spectacular !

397051778.name: Sea lions, sea lions, sea lions
397051778.author: a TripAdvisor user
397051778.reviewBody: The trip is not cheap but so worth it. The sea lions come right up to you and there are thousands of them. If you are a birder, it\'s called bird island for a reason. Bring your binocs and bird books.

384229776.name: Swim with the Sea Lions
384229776.author: a TripAdvisor user
384229776.reviewBody: Take a private charter, not the tour boats for an incredible day snorkeling, fishing, kayaking with the sea lions for a once in a lifetime experience.

376597628.name: Diving with the Sea Lions
376597628.author: a TripAdvisor user
376597628.reviewBody: Great trip and well worth it to go had lots of fun and saw alot of sea Lions. My friend who was with me had never been exposed to something like this and now talks about to everyone about what the experience was like

376494515.name: So incredibly interesting
376494515.author: a TripAdvisor user
376494515.reviewBody: We took Del Mar Charters on a Bird Island Trip. We snorkeled with sea lions....so fun! Definitely worth the trip!

375475438.name: Long Boat ride but worth it...
375475438.author: a TripAdvisor user
375475438.reviewBody: There is no dock. You will wade out a little to a waiting water taxi that will take you to a larger boat. I don\'t think the boat going there runs daily, so make sure to book it first as soon as you arrive. The deck up on top is very refreshing. As you near the island, that funny smell will be all of the lively ocean life that live at this island. It is thriving with many bird varieties and mammals...It is a fun excursion, especially if you love marine biology. Make sure to have fun observing while maintaining a safe distance from the animals. After all, you are in their habitat. The excursion boat will have kayaks and snorkel equipment available. Food, snacks, music and drinks are included...Bring plenty of sunscreen/chapstick, drink water!! Getting free booze is tempting, The staff and crew are experienced and you can go with confidence.

373863146.name: Loved every minute were there.  Worth the 90 min boat ride.
373863146.author: a TripAdvisor user
373863146.reviewBody:
Had a wonderful timing seeing all the sea birds, swimming with the sea lions and hearing the history of the island from our tour guide.

I was a little worried about how aggressive the sea lions would be, but they were nothing but playful.  They would come right up to you, blow bubbles in our face and then swim off.  The weather was calm and sunny, so water clarity was really good. 

Lots of fun and a once in a lifetime experience.

359924817.name: Great Trip
359924817.author: a TripAdvisor user
359924817.reviewBody: This was a lot of fun.  Open bar on the boat, and the crew was great.  Snorkeling with the sea lions was great.  would do this again,

353982927.name: Safety
353982927.author: a TripAdvisor user
353982927.reviewBody: If you travel in December the weather is very cold. I fell from stairs and hit my back. Nobody seems to care but I was in Puerto pe\u00f1asco hospital for 5 hours. I don\'t know the conection between pe\u00f1asco del sol hotel and eco funs. But the true I bought the tickets inside the hotel with Raul. One recomendaci\u00f3n do not buy tickets from this place,if you buy I recommend from the Mayan palace   .hotel they have better deals. And be careful from Raul inside Puerto pe\u00f1asco hotel.

351674358.name: Fun Day Trip!
351674358.author: a TripAdvisor user
351674358.reviewBody: We took the boat with ecofun tours departing from the Mayan to head out to the island. The lunch was a bit sparse and the snorkeling gear was definitely heavily used but my family had a wonderful time! (The alcohol flowed freely but there were no abnoxious drunks to deal with). Swimming with the sea lions was incredible! My daughter even had the chance to touch one of them as they swim up very close! We also kayaked and took a small boat around the island. It was a unique experience and a nice break from everyday on the beach. We would go again!

350930544.name: Great Scuba/Snorkeling!
350930544.author: a TripAdvisor user
350930544.reviewBody: A must go after the sea lions give birth.  You can see the little babies on the beach - so cute!  I believe this island was once featured on the Discovery Channel.

348551953.name: Wonderful way to interact with nature!
348551953.author: a TripAdvisor user
348551953.reviewBody: We took an ECO tour of this wonderful cluster of seven islands and the experience was incredible! I brought a wet suit and snorkel gear and spent 45 plus minutes snorkeling with the sea lions, they are so playful and inquisitive I highly recommend doing this if the opportunity presents itself. The warter was not warm but the once in a lifetime experience was worth a slight chill. After snorkeling I kayeked with the sea lions and took a 70 year old woman along for a ride, I  saw her checking out later in the week and she told me  " it was the highlight of her trip".

338720893.name: A GREAT Day Trip!
338720893.author: a TripAdvisor user
338720893.reviewBody: From the moment you step onto the boat the crew energetically does everything possible to make sure you\'re smiling!  Enjoy libations (included) and laughter on the leisurely trip out to the island (which Americans refer to as Bird Island).  At times, going and coming, we were accompanied by dolphins swimming in the wake of the boat.  The rooftop sitting area affords a great view and easy spot to photograph the dolphins.  Once at the island, kayaks are released, snorkeling equipment handed out, and guided small boat excursions ensue.  I snorkeled right up to a pod of sea lions and enjoyed watching the moms play with the pups.  There are birds, more birds, and lots of birds to enjoy as well.  The entire crew was wonderful and hilarious.

337415147.name: You have to go!
337415147.author: a TripAdvisor user
337415147.reviewBody: \nI recommend you visit , go swimming with sea lions , do some kayaking and take lots of pictures ....

328735413.name: Best thing to do in Puerto Penasco with the best instructor!
328735413.author: a TripAdvisor user
328735413.reviewBody: If you are headed to Puerto Penasco you cannot miss this experience, one of the most amazing experiences ever! The seals come right up to you and a very playful creatures, there is also large array of marine life.\nLea is your instructor along with Louiz and they are some of the most kind hearted and fun people ive had the pleasure of meeting, they treat you like family and give you an experience of a lifetime! \nwe definitely had a blast with them and we will defiantly be back in the future to experience this again and catch up !

314833966.name: Great Snorkeling Trip
314833966.author: a TripAdvisor user
314833966.reviewBody: Great trip to the island swimming, snorkeling, kayaking with the sea loins. They are very playful and curious.

310006122.name: Fun day trip!
310006122.author: a TripAdvisor user
310006122.reviewBody: We had a blast on the Bird Island tour. The sea lions are freindly and curious and it\'s amazing to see them in their own habitat.

306379243.name: must do!!!
306379243.author: a TripAdvisor user
306379243.reviewBody: this was the highlight of our trip, is you visit rocky point you must do this, the trip to the island was great, it had a meal included(ham sandwich chips fruit and cookies) open bar with many choices to choose from. once at the island you go kayaking and snorkeling. yes there are actual sea lions and there not shy! i went with Ecofun tours i highly recommend them for best experience.

306031841.name: Best Diving with Sea Lions Ever!
306031841.author: a TripAdvisor user
306031841.reviewBody: As scuba divers we had heard about the Sea Lions at Bird Island and decided to see for ourselves what was up. It was fantastic!! The juvenile SL\'s are inquisitive, playful friendly and totally non-threatening. The will swim and dive with you, tug at your fins and get so close to your face mask you can count their whiskers. This is a shallow dive, less than 30\' and the viz is pretty good. One caution, if you hear the Bulls barking at you, move away. They are very territorial and really mean business. After our first dive we moved to the other side of the island and found out what a mistake that was. If you go there, find the SL\'s and stay there for as many dives, or as much snorkeling, as time will allow.

305149235.name: Exceptional trip
305149235.author: a TripAdvisor user
305149235.reviewBody: went with ecofun tours. we had a blast.  Shelya was a kick. not fancy lunch but open bar and music during the trip was fun as well as other guests.

299885765.name: water fun for the family
299885765.author: a TripAdvisor user
299885765.reviewBody: get your water gear, kayak, water ski, fishing boat and take an adventure to see this island covered in sea lions. and on the way you might be surprised by a pod or two of dolphins. we were. this is better then going to a water park to see them caged. here they are free and your part of it.

278731786.name: Bird Island is a fun excursion!
278731786.author: a TripAdvisor user
278731786.reviewBody: We took the Eco Tour from Puerto Penasco and loved it!  You travel from the marina and go along the shore to the Grand Mayan to pick up more people then out to the island.  Some parts of the boat ride are choppy, if you get sea sick, bring Dramamine.  Getting to the island was a three hour trip  but the views made it seem much shorter.  Once there, you can choose to snorkel, kayak, motor boat, swim or stay on the boat.  You can\'t actually get on the island as the wild life are protected.  We snorkeled and were able to swim near the largest rock to see the sea lions.  There were about 50 including some large males, babies and the playful pups.  Many would come near us and swim under our legs.  Lots of fun!  The ride back was another three hours and we saw several dolphins.  It is a long day, bring water, snacks and sunscreen.  They provided lunch and an open bar-all good quality but we were glad for some crackers we brought.  We felt this trip was worth every dollar!

276319214.name: Noisy!
276319214.author: a TripAdvisor user
276319214.reviewBody: This is a sanctuary where people are not allowed--you just look at it from the water; you wouldn\'t want to walk there because it\'s covered in bird and sea lion poop.  But that\'s a good thing.  We saw lots of sea lion pups having a good time with each other and with the snorkelers from the tour boat.

274547061.name: BEST PART OF OUR TRIP
274547061.author: a TripAdvisor user
274547061.reviewBody: We took a boat out to Isla San Jorge where we were able to swim with sea lions. the experiences was incredible. The staff was way cool, and I still keep in touch with them to this day. The boat had an open bar, and they let me DJ the music, so we had one big dance party! Upon getting to the island, we got to kayak closer to the island and swim to our heart\'s content. Incredible day!

268980658.name: Sea Lion Breath
268980658.author: a TripAdvisor user
268980658.reviewBody: Kayaked and snorkled with the sea lions.  What a thrill.. Water a little murky but still an adventure. Great boat ride over.  Catamaran a little old but they accommodated our no meat lunch without a problem. Crew was wonderful. Check out the blue feet on the birds. Amazing.

264359653.name: Amazing Adventure
264359653.author: a TripAdvisor user
264359653.reviewBody: This was a highlight of our trip. We have snorkeled with sea lions before, but this trip was much better. The boat ride was beautiful, and dolphins surrounded us for much of the trip. There were games and activities for the kids, and open bar for the entire day. Once we arrived there were three options, and time to take part in all of them - snorkeling with the sea lions, kayaking among the sea lions, and riding in a motorized boat among them We did all, and enjoyed every minute. Lunch (a large sandwich, chips, fruit) was part of the trip. It was a great day, about five to six hours total. Highly recommend this!

263826973.name: Sea Lions
263826973.author: a TripAdvisor user
263826973.reviewBody: Once in a lifetime experience.  Swimming with sea lions is an experience you will not easily forget.  We paid $100 per person for this experience from the Mayan Palace.  It is a booze cruise (drinks included)  but also family and service oriented staff that will make sure you have a good time.

259199184.name: Fun trip
259199184.author: a TripAdvisor user
259199184.reviewBody: Enjoyed meeting people from the hotel. Kayaking was great.  Lots of sea life. Heard the snokeling was fun.

258434595.name: What a trip - survived swimming with sea lions
258434595.author: a TripAdvisor user
258434595.reviewBody: We tried all week to get out to Bird Island and got in touch with Oscar from Del Mar charters on the last day of our trip.  This was our last day and the experience was amazing.  Oscar is the best.  We snorkelled with about 30 pups and female sea lions.  At one point a female tasted my arm - very gentle beasts.  Will do this again - a must do trip.

256190520.name: Bird Island is fun
256190520.author: a TripAdvisor user
256190520.reviewBody: We took an hour and a half boat ride to the island cluster to see the many birds and sea lions that were there. Our catamaran boat trip included drinks lunch and games. We could snorkle, kayak or boat tour the islands once we arrived there. The sea lions surround your kayak or when you snorkle for quite an experience. Want to do it again when the water is warmer.

242275673.name: Long boat ride, but fun being there
242275673.author: a TripAdvisor user
242275673.reviewBody: I would get on the boat at the Mayan Palace and save a very long slow (2 hour) boat ride from the port. Fun interacting with the sea lions at the island though. Crew was friendly and helpful.

233796155.name: Beautiful
233796155.author: a TripAdvisor user
233796155.reviewBody: Great day out on the sea.. trip to the island and the sites you see.. Ecofun Rentals provides a great fun time and the staff is so very accommodating and friendly, we had a wonderful day.

211623184.name: I think this is also called Bird Island
211623184.author: a TripAdvisor user
211623184.reviewBody: We do this every year and love it. About 300 sea lions live there and if you do the Ecofun tour, you can kayak and snorkel with the sea lions. Great experience.

208986157.name: Best Place for Snorkeling
208986157.author: a TripAdvisor user
208986157.reviewBody: Hop on the Del Mar Charters boat or ride with Ecofun Rentals. Food, drinks, and snorkeling equipment provided on both. This adventure is a full day of fun, swimming with the sea lions that breed on Isla San Jorge. The pups join you as you explore the wonders of the deep, and to the delight of the kids, the staff will join you and bring up little sea creatures that you\'d probably miss on your own. When in Rocky Point, don\'t miss out on this experience!

669944566.name: Always fun
669944566.author: a TripAdvisor user
669944566.reviewBody: I go to this beach to watch the sunset and have a happy hour drink\nat Playa Bonita. Lovely spot.\nBeach is clean.

666789076.name: miles and miles of sand and shells
666789076.author: a TripAdvisor user
666789076.reviewBody: this is the main beach of PP in front of all the main resorts.  wonderful for swimming, sunning or long walks searching for nice shells.  huge tide swings allows for tide pools when the tide is out.

661702415.name: Spectacular Happy Hour on Playa Bonita Beach!
661702415.author: a TripAdvisor user
661702415.reviewBody: Wonderful 1/2 price drinks, free chips & salsa, Rigo\'s memorable live music on the terrace of  Puesta del Sol\'s Restaurant over-looking the beautiful Playa Bonita Beach on the Sea of Cortez!  The food is great, also.

659612634.name: Nice beach, no crowds in Febrary!
659612634.author: a TripAdvisor user
659612634.reviewBody: Nice beach, water was pretty clear.  A little cold.  Nice sandy beach, and lots of small seashells.  There were a few vendors selling their goods, but they weren\'t too imposing.

659123051.name: March Family Trip
659123051.author: a TripAdvisor user
659123051.reviewBody: The beach was clean, my wife and granddaughter enjoyed the beach. The local vendors were polite. The lady that give the massage on the beach was amazing, my wife really enjoyed it.

653363704.name: Playa Bonita RV Park
653363704.author: a TripAdvisor user
653363704.reviewBody: Nice location but unless you get a beach front site the sites are small. Sometimes we can\'t get out truck through the interior  roads because there\'s vehicles parked in front of the RVs. There\'s no other parking available either.

652258415.name: Valentine\'s week
652258415.author: a TripAdvisor user
652258415.reviewBody: My wife and I love coming down here and decided to take the week off and bring our dog Zeus, he loves it as much as we do and I really recommend this place to anyone, local food is amazing and really affordable and the entertainment is great! We will be back over and over till we find a place to buy!

650626865.name: Shells bells
650626865.author: a TripAdvisor user
650626865.reviewBody: I don\'t go shell hunting often, but we stayed at the Playa Bonita for the first time and Playa Bonita beach is one of the best I\'ve been on in Rocky Point. At least where we were. We decided to walk the beach to Calle 13 to Visit Skullys down Las Glorias. The access was easy, the beach was clean & everyone  we passed was friendly. I\'m not a big fan of long walks in the sand, because I\'m lazy, but I didn\'t even notice how far we went & didn\'t care. It was mostly vendor free, & when they did appear, they were non aggressive like many other beaches. Great view of old Port to the projected new Port, not to mention the sea of Cortez. Best of all, I found beautiful unbroken shells & I found my first baby sand dollar in perfect condition. It was a great walk on the beach.

650383802.name: Nice experience
650383802.author: a TripAdvisor user
650383802.reviewBody: We usually stay at the Playa Bonita Resort and usually have 1-2 meals at the restaurant. Nice view of the sunset and beach.

648512714.name: Very nice
648512714.author: a TripAdvisor user
648512714.reviewBody: I bought a place on the beach here 12 years ago and the beach was real bad with broken glass and left over fireworks everywhere. Now the beach is certified clean, it is cleaned every week. This area is part of sandy beach and is used mostly by the locals, the area most Americans use is west of here more in front of the resorts. Now go enjoy the clean beach and perfect water on the sea of cortez.

646011865.name: Huge tide, with tons of sand.
646011865.author: a TripAdvisor user
646011865.reviewBody:
Note that Playa Bonita is on the resort sides, so there is no free way to get there (only resorts). But you can easily access it by parking on calle 18 and going to the adjacent Playa Hermosa. 
The tide here is massive and there is probably 200 yards more beach when the tide goes out, exposing lots of great shells, crabs, tide pools and rocks.  

Even in the winter it was still a nice place (even if during our trip it was unusually cold (60 degrees).

636042325.name: Nice beach
636042325.author: a TripAdvisor user
636042325.reviewBody: Very clean beach with easy access. water was safe for children, not a bad current. parking was very close with only a short walk.

631327969.name: best beach in Rocky Point, Hotel RV park and restaurant
631327969.author: a TripAdvisor user
631327969.reviewBody: Best RV park beach (fairly priced spaces) decent hotel, restaurant is over priced but their happy hour is the best

630666115.name: Sunrise walks
630666115.author: a TripAdvisor user
630666115.reviewBody: Been here a number of times. Fairly clean, safe and uncrowded. Relaxing to walk from resort to Playa Bonita.

623301050.name: Great Shrimp Cocktail, fish tacos and service
623301050.author: a TripAdvisor user
623301050.reviewBody: Always nice sitting on the patio watching people stroll the beach.  Great service, good food and excellent service.  Cannot go wrong here!

595098131.name: Beautiful!
595098131.author: a TripAdvisor user
595098131.reviewBody: Warm waves & so beautiful.  Beach is very clean.  However there is a constant barrage of beach vendors.  They are friendly & polite but somewhat of a nuisance

593154453.name: Wrong Name
593154453.author: a TripAdvisor user
593154453.reviewBody: This beach has been known for decades as Sandy Beach.  Playa Bonita RV park is just one of several businesses that front this beach.  By using the name in this way you are in effect advertising for the RV park and cafe.

589829453.name: high tide is intense low tide is way out there
589829453.author: a TripAdvisor user
589829453.reviewBody: When new moon is on the high tide is very high and the waves crash in a hurry.  Knocked me down and almost out a couple of time.  Still had a ton of fun.  Lot\'s of vendors and even jet ski rentals

574992066.name: Nice beach!
574992066.author: a TripAdvisor user
574992066.reviewBody: Water wasn\'t warm in April. The tide goes way way out and you can walk out and see the tide pools. Overall very positive. Not many vendors hassling you.

562000933.name: Good RV park..
562000933.author: a TripAdvisor user
562000933.reviewBody: Here for two weeks.  Good RV park but very close quarters (cozy).  Here with the Winnebago WIT group.  Nice beach.  Parked at the beach.  Good clean sand.  Recommend.

556993859.name: Sweet
556993859.author: a TripAdvisor user
556993859.reviewBody: Sandy Beach as know locally is a great place to hangout.  Tides offer exploration of tidal pools, shells and other "flotsam".  Dolphins and Pelicans can be seen from the beach.

555303681.name: The original beach area
555303681.author: a TripAdvisor user
555303681.reviewBody: The Playa Bonita Hotel, restaurant and RV Park are in this area and it also attaches o the 13th Street area famous for the big hotels and sporting events.  The beach is nice but has a lot of rocks in many places.  In low tide you can walk out about a block or two and only get water up to your knees.  It also adjoings Sandy Beach which probably has the most famous concos areas.

555140759.name: Great view from beach hotels
555140759.author: a TripAdvisor user
555140759.reviewBody: Beach very clean, food is great! You have to try their blue shrimp, awesome!\nTaxi cabs are 2 dollars per person. Recommended to take taxi, as the streets Down town are very narrow.

553016679.name: Playa Bonita RV Park
553016679.author: a TripAdvisor user
553016679.reviewBody: Great place to park your RV for a month or so. The beach is soft sand and great to walk. Prime sites line the sea wall with best views.

552979083.name: Very nice
552979083.author: a TripAdvisor user
552979083.reviewBody: Very pleasant site, but the picture does not seem to be the same place as I visited. \nVery enjoyable beach in winter.

552608596.name: What to do in Rocky Point
552608596.author: a TripAdvisor user
552608596.reviewBody:
We kept on hearing about Rocky Point, Puerto Penasco. It is the closest real beach to Phoenix. It sounded like a fascinating place to relax by the ocean.
 
In talking some of our AZ friends who have driven there, they had to watch out for the stop signs (ALTO) as they could be on either side of the road and at a lower than normal range of vision. They also suggested bringing Mexican Pesos.

We lucked out as there was a cancellation on Sue Sinclair’s travel tour – New  Year’s Eve in Puerto Penasco. Having Jerry, the driver from Aboard American, and Diane, the travel guide from Sue Sinclair made the trip very enjoyable. 

We learned about the creosote bush in the Sonoran desert, saw the growth of plants along the washes, and saw the unique organ pipe cactus.  Lukeville is the border town. It is just South of the Organ Pipe National Monument.

 

We found out that Rocky Point even had an Al Capone connection. He partnered one of the hotels and casinos with Thomas Childs. Eventually they destroyed this because of political unrest. Some creative Mexican businessman opened Capone’s Pizza and Beer (not on site)
 
The present Puerto Penasco even has a Sam’s Club (Walmart) and large grocery store (Bodega Aurrera) just before you enter the main part of town.

The next morning we went to “Rodeo Drive” or “Shacks Fifth Avenue” . It is about 4 blocks long. One can enjoy negotiating with owners over purses, clothing, “lemon pots”, souvenirs, pottery, metalwork, and silver jewelry in a quieter shopping environment than the market area. USD was the currency the vendors bartered in.
 
Our bus then went to the Malecon Market area in the Old Port. As we had quite a few metal work purchases (Lightweight), we returned with bus the the resort.
 
We decided to walk west alongside the beach at low tide. A couple of shells found their way into our pockets. We walked by the RV resort. Then we stopped at the next two condos: The Sonoran Sky and Puerta Privada. The Privada’s model suite suggested we need to win the lottery as the suite was finished with class. We imagined the hardship of waking up to waves crashing the beach

In our initial research the next “condo” Las Palomas Beach Resort was recommended by Trip Advisor but we did not walk that far. To return we thought we would walk on the pavement back to the resort. With no sidewalks, it was a delight as every third vehicle seemed to be an ATV roaring past us. The distance was three times longer than if we had returned by beach.

For the last day in 2017 we cabbed it to Malecon Market. (We were told to always barter your price before going - around $2USD each was the going rate). We got off in front of Mary’s.
 
The Viagra at $2.99 a tablet at the Farmcia may have been a good price we were interested in the ambience of the Old Port. We strolled through the shops but nothing really attracted us along Circumvalacion y o Malecon Kino.

We stopped at a square where there was a bust of Luis Donaldo Colosio Murietta and a Penasco sign. We then walked down the stairs to see the statue of “El Camaronero”, the fisherman riding a shrimp.

We stopped to enjoy a peaceful time on the bench overlooking the Sea of Cortez. We listened to music coming from the Satisfied Frog restaurant, watched the seagulls and pelicans fly by, and observed the different types of boats on the ocean. We had heard of people getting a glimpse of dolphins swimming
 
Puerto Penasco is a fishing village. Therefore we decided to have seafood for lunch and we wanted to enjoy the ambience of being Oceanside. Tekila Bar and Restaurant had great food and a great view from the second floor.  We had garlic shrimp and clams.
 
A fascinating feature of our package is that part of your luggage was to include a cooler. We stopped off at the fish market to load up with shrimp and fish. One is allowed 50 pounds of shrimp to bring cross the border.

The vendor recommended to us was Mr. Shrimp run by the Gomez family. We bought 5 pounds of shrimp at $8 USD a pound ($19 at Costco) and some flounder. The next day we savored a fresh shrimp meal.
 
Our guide did not know if the UETA duty free shop in Lukeville was open on January 1. So we purchased a 1 litre bottle of Kahlua at Bodega Aurrera on the outskirts of Rocky Point. One of the advantages of being on a bus tour was that we were not pestered by the gauntlet of vendors selling their wares upon exiting the border at Lukeville.

546655000.name: Great time
546655000.author: a TripAdvisor user
546655000.reviewBody: Perfect beach to relax, hang out, get souvenirs, lay on the sand.. Our children had a great time collecting shells

544324508.name: nice beach
544324508.author: a TripAdvisor user
544324508.reviewBody: beach was clean and not crowded. There was a tiki hut in the afternoon for drinks.\nVendors would come by with kites, papaya and other items. If you told them no - they kept going they didn\'t pester us. Beach is long you can walk for quite a while.

543692264.name: Playa Bonita RV Park
543692264.author: a TripAdvisor user
543692264.reviewBody: Check in went smoothly and an attendant drove us directly to our spot.  There are a lot of huge travel homes and campers fitting  into small spaces barely with any room to set up a sitting area.  Many people bring dogs and set up their barrier fences to contain them.  Restroom and showers are adequate for a campground, nothing special.  Karaoke in the social club house on some nights.  You can barely see the beach unless you get a prime parking spot or the beginning of the row.  Vendors bring tamales and frutas.  Washing, waxing and painting of your set up is available.  Bring ear plugs.  Wi-Fii unreliable.

543626704.name: Beautiful and clean
543626704.author: a TripAdvisor user
543626704.reviewBody: We spent a lot of time on this beach.  It is beautiful and clean.  They had joggers at sunrise and horses at sunset.

535218556.name: Perfect for a long walk or run
535218556.author: a TripAdvisor user
535218556.reviewBody: You can get in at least 4-5 miles if you go round trip end to end. Simply pristine and beautiful. Good vendors if you need something but they\u2019re not obnoxious like some can be in other Baja beach cities.

516014474.name: Relaxing
516014474.author: a TripAdvisor user
516014474.reviewBody: Nice beach just off downtown Rocky Point. Very calm on a weekday with a few vendors strolling by. Rented a canopy for 200 pesos for the day. \n Bring your own drinks and snacks as the prices are high on the restaurant people offering menus.

513471308.name: no frills beach
513471308.author: a TripAdvisor user
513471308.reviewBody: The beach is excellent, the water is warm, and waves are nice!  Super low tide in AM and PM.  There are several covered seating areas you can rent for 200 pesos, or abut $12.  Honestly, they are a little shabby - our table had a crack in it, and 2 of our chair were repaired by lacing the broken parts together.  This was not a deal-breaker for me, however,  The price is right, and unless you bring your own umbrella and chairs (many locals do), this is all you have.  I\'m not complaining, just stating the facts.  Playa Bonia is a very relaxing beach, and we had a great time!  There are MANY vendors who will come by to sell you jewelry, sunglasses, henna tattoos, hair braiding, food, and drinks.  They are not agressive at all!  There are several food carts in the area which will also do table delivery service.  I love this beach!

507598362.name: Large beach
507598362.author: a TripAdvisor user
507598362.reviewBody: Large, flat beach here. Good to beach comb in the early mornings. Warm water to take a dip when the summer sun heats you up. Worth coming here, and would return.

507223158.name: Beautiful views---warm water---great beach!
507223158.author: a TripAdvisor user
507223158.reviewBody: We arrived at the beach mid-morning and rented a covered tent with table and 4 chairs for $15.  We did not want to be in the hot sun all day. The vendor placed us  about 20  feet from the water, which I said was too far.  He explained that as the tide came in, we would be closer to the water. Yes, when we left later in the  day, our toes were in the water!  We had a wonderful day going in and out of the water and watching all the beach activities.  Lots of vendors were selling wares but they were not pushy.  What a great stretch of beach to stroll and just enjoy the view and the water.

501765300.name: Sandy
501765300.author: a TripAdvisor user
501765300.reviewBody: Sandy and safe. Easy to walk and play. They offer different services from massage on the beach to shopping and food, to equipment rentals

501367668.name: Relaxing
501367668.author: a TripAdvisor user
501367668.reviewBody: My family and I had a great time at the beach. Only thing is that the tide keeps rising through out the day and we had to keep moving up, next time we know just to stay in the back to avoid that. I got my hair braided, a henna tattoo, a pina colada inside a pineapple, all without leaving my seat. Lots of vendors that come and go but they don\'t hassle you. Lots of shells and water activities to do. There is facilites and showers near by and parking. They are areas h can rent under the shade that come with tables and chairs. Our kids had a blast and as adults we just enjoyed the view and relaxed. De

492200970.name: Toes in the sand
492200970.author: a TripAdvisor user
492200970.reviewBody: The beach seemed to be less crowded than other parts of the coastline, a welcome discovery for thous looking for a quiet beach getaway. The water is clean and clear. Not much in the way of shells while we were there, but we went in high tide.

486189983.name: Rv park
486189983.author: a TripAdvisor user
486189983.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with close restaurants and things to do.  The Rv park used to be our favorite place, but no longer.  Last time there they lost our reservations.  We had a print out of our confirmation and they swore we had cancelled it.  They offered us a spot in he back.  We had made our reservations a year in advance.  They were not very nice about it. The spaces are very close together and with the huge RV groups that come through it is very hard to drive through the streets and even harder to park your RV.  We asked for help and when they backed up our 5th wheeler they dented the cab of the truck.  They refused to do anything about it.

485451717.name: Walk a lot
485451717.author: a TripAdvisor user
485451717.reviewBody: Nearly empty beach. Sandy with occasional coral that could be gone tomorrow. It looks like rocks but isn\'t. Not too many peddlers and definitely no hassle.  Low tide is easier to walk on as sand is deep in places. We took a bag and picked up debris but there were also some lovely shells

482238636.name: Beautiful place!
482238636.author: a TripAdvisor user
482238636.reviewBody: Love this beach the water is warm and pleasant really enjoyed getting some sun and sunset is breath taking I recommend everyone to experience Playa Bonita!

479632166.name: Great place for a wedding
479632166.author: a TripAdvisor user
479632166.reviewBody: We have had 2 children get married on Playa Bonita Beach.  It is a beautiful area, especially at sunset.  The restaurant close by (I believe it is called Puesta del Sol) organized wonderful wedding dinners both times.  This is a great place to watch the sun set.

476634822.name: Absolutely Pristine
476634822.author: a TripAdvisor user
476634822.reviewBody: One of my new favorites.  The water is so clear and beautiful. The sand is soft, the beach is super clean. There are close bathrooms, nice waterside restaurants. Parking can be a little challenging but we got lucky and didn\'t have to look too long. We will definitely go back and stay right on this beach. Stunning.

475123136.name: Sr
475123136.author: a TripAdvisor user
475123136.reviewBody: We spent 3 months at a condo there and will be back next year. Plenty of condos to rent from. The beach is nice and clean. We helped keep it that way cause some people don\'t care and just litter. There are plenty of trash cans along the way at the hotels and condos.

474325161.name: Low tide was great for walking and collecting shells !!
474325161.author: a TripAdvisor user
474325161.reviewBody: We stayed at the RV park.  The beach is right there.  Great walking and collecting shells.  Just make sure to walk during low tide.

473485451.name: Just too great to describe
473485451.author: a TripAdvisor user
473485451.reviewBody: We have been coming here for 30 years. We cannot say how much we love this beach. It is relaxing and peaceful. It is cleaner than it has ever been. Th e vendors are friendly and not too pushy. Best experience ever this week.

470062116.name: Nice and clean
470062116.author: a TripAdvisor user
470062116.reviewBody: The water is for the most part warm. At times throughout the day you may catch the water cool (not cold). Also, the beach is clean.

467814249.name: March 2017
467814249.author: a TripAdvisor user
467814249.reviewBody: Very nice and clean beach.  Early morning tide goes way out and can collect shells and walk.  Evenings would be nice to enjoy a sunset.

467015837.name: Beautiful and relaxing
467015837.author: a TripAdvisor user
467015837.reviewBody: Not busy during this time of year. The weather is a bit windy but still warm and beautiful. A Great getaway.

465566313.name: Beautiful
465566313.author: a TripAdvisor user
465566313.reviewBody:
Great!!! Beach venders are not pushy..clean beautiful beach!
Lots of shells and activities for everyone..nice sand!

461995352.name: Nearest beach to the city.
461995352.author: a TripAdvisor user
461995352.reviewBody: Playa Bonita is not only the nearest beach to the city of Panama, it is also has the best facilities with two top rated hotels, in addition to the beautiful Casa Bonita condominium and it\'s private Peal Club. If you avoid the rush hour you can be there in 20 minutes.

460484617.name: Nice clean walkable beach.
460484617.author: a TripAdvisor user
460484617.reviewBody: Nice beach with lots of room for play and long walks.  A few vendors but always very polite.  Beach very pet friendly.  Playa Bonita Hotel Resort centrally located on beach with nice rooms, swimming pools and terrace overlooking beach.  Hotel not pet friendly.  Attached restaurant was good for breakfast (also open for lunch and dinner). Continental breakfast was wonderful - toast, yogurt, granola, fruit plate and coffee or tea.  Hotel was a bit noisy on weekends but quiet through the week.

460122191.name: Excellent breakfast
460122191.author: a TripAdvisor user
460122191.reviewBody: Great breakfast, reasonable rates, good service. We would go there again. Loved the shrimp ommelette.

452412403.name: Vacation
452412403.author: a TripAdvisor user
452412403.reviewBody: Such a great place to go on vacation. I\'ve been all around the globe and this place never gets old. Great beaches, food and entertainment. My wife and I go 6-10 times/year.

438369693.name: Beautiful beach
438369693.author: a TripAdvisor user
438369693.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches on the Baja. Very nice!! Picture from our room. Clean beach and ohhhh so warm water even in November.

432654428.name: Great beach
432654428.author: a TripAdvisor user
432654428.reviewBody: Clean and lots of sand.   Lots of people walking with their dogs.  People out cleaning the beach every morning.   Great walking area.

432183099.name: Love this beach!
432183099.author: a TripAdvisor user
432183099.reviewBody: We have been visiting this beach for nearly 40 years.  The beach has improved over the years and is much cleaner than it use to be.  The beach is cleaned daily and there are trash and recycle barrels along the walkway.

430749094.name: Long beach walks
430749094.author: a TripAdvisor user
430749094.reviewBody: We loved walking along this well kept beach, putting our feet into the warm water. The sand was clean and fine, making walking easy. Very relaxing.

424146533.name: Greatest RV Area & Beach
424146533.author: a TripAdvisor user
424146533.reviewBody: My husband and I travel to Playa Bonita RV Park that is a couple of steps to Playa Bonita beach (Sandy beach). The nicest time to go is January thru March to enjoy a peaceful Vacation.

423958745.name: Playa Bonita
423958745.author: a TripAdvisor user
423958745.reviewBody: Simple words for a simple beach... not much special here just a pretty beach like the words in Spanish. They do keep it clean daily. Not crowded for sure. I have seen better also. I am not a big fan of Rocky Point and we left early back to the USA. One day was enough to see it.

415817826.name: Good Place to Swim
415817826.author: a TripAdvisor user
415817826.reviewBody: Great place to swim and also chill out.  Nice water and great shells.  Very quiet and great place to hang out.  You can lay out and shop while the vendors come to you.

413737960.name: Nice beach
413737960.author: a TripAdvisor user
413737960.reviewBody: It\'s a little rocky with some shells.  We went at sunset it was pretty quiet. A vendor sold us some blankets,  and another cut a fresh mango right there

411489964.name: Playa Bonita
411489964.author: a TripAdvisor user
411489964.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach for the most part.  The unending stream of vendors does detract from the overall experience. 

Take pesos as many of the shops are a better deal in pesos. There's a lot of broken glass which is unfortunate .  If you go early in the day while the tide is out take water shoes to navigate sharp rocks and shells.  Water was amazing,  beach was great  for the most part. 

Parking ranges from free to $10/day. Practice your bartering skills,  something foreign to most Americans, on the tarpes(covered areas) .

410375611.name: Nacho mucho yum!
410375611.author: a TripAdvisor user
410375611.reviewBody: The prices were comparable to \nU.S, yet totally worth it! Great view of beach with an ice cold beer.\nAfter head over to beach to go in banana boats or jet ski.

410321533.name: Beach
410321533.author: a TripAdvisor user
410321533.reviewBody: Love this beach.  Clean and not crowded.  But if you are not staying in a hotel in the area, parking is FAR away from it.

399360729.name: fun, clean beach
399360729.author: a TripAdvisor user
399360729.reviewBody: enjoyable few hours, jet skis are a plus ! Do not ignore the beach vendors that carry handcrafts, I got a couple of very pretty earrings and for my back yard some hand painted ceramics.

395080354.name: Nice beach
395080354.author: a TripAdvisor user
395080354.reviewBody: Nice beach close to town.  Shallow enough for small children.  Busy area and overrun by local vendors.

394335997.name: Very nice beach and warm shallow water
394335997.author: a TripAdvisor user
394335997.reviewBody: Beach is awesome and quite beautiful. Warm, shallow water that is great for swimming and for kids. Much nicer than I expected and well worth going to visit.

394081959.name: Nice beach
394081959.author: a TripAdvisor user
394081959.reviewBody: Make sure you have a lot of patience lot of street vendors, one every 30 second but the beach it nice mostly for locals the more nicer beaches are reserved for hotel guest and they are private

394041974.name: Sweet beach!
394041974.author: a TripAdvisor user
394041974.reviewBody: The beach at Playa Bonita is kept clean.  Crews came out every morning during my visit.  During low tide it is fun to go out into the rocky areas and see the small sea life living in and around the rocks.  There are decent size waves in this area but there also is plenty of shallow water for play.

389545996.name: Beautiful Full Access Beach
389545996.author: a TripAdvisor user
389545996.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and very clean and enjoyable .\n\nCompletely great experience for the entire family...and of all ages.

389544613.name: Beautiful
389544613.author: a TripAdvisor user
389544613.reviewBody: We had a great time swimming with no incidents or problems. Gorgeous beach but some abandoned hotels nearby for Planet of the Apes effect.

389384112.name: Review of location
389384112.author: a TripAdvisor user
389384112.reviewBody: Great location, family oriented, lots of vendors .  Great area to hang out if looking for lots of movement amongst people this is the spot to be !!!

388574484.name: Beautiful beach!
388574484.author: a TripAdvisor user
388574484.reviewBody: Wide sandy beaches, warm waters, beautiful beach to hang out on!  Watch a sunset, take a banana boat ride, get a massage!

385613750.name: Nice beach
385613750.author: a TripAdvisor user
385613750.reviewBody: Nice beach, just outside of town.  Our hotel was downtown on the beach and I personally like the beach at our hotel better.\n

384229245.name: Memorable Dinner
384229245.author: a TripAdvisor user
384229245.reviewBody: After spending the day on a privately chartered fishing boat, our captain cleaned our fish, and pointed us to Playa Bonita\'s Restaurant to have our catch prepared.  Our fish was prepared 4 different ways with sides.  The service was incredible, food and sides were excellent, margaritas were hand crafted, and the view is spectacular.  What a perfect end to a perfect day!

383554431.name: Much there
383554431.author: a TripAdvisor user
383554431.reviewBody: You can buy hand made goods, rent a horse, get a massage right there in front of the hotel. You can also enjoy drinks on the beach :D

380996817.name: Beach!  Nuf Said!
380996817.author: a TripAdvisor user
380996817.reviewBody: Warm water, beautiful beach.  Secluded, safe, enjoyable.  Wonderful.  Having spent more than a dozen years on California\'s crowded South Shore in cold water and dirty beaches this is freakin heaven.

378135324.name: Great beach
378135324.author: a TripAdvisor user
378135324.reviewBody: Clean, beautiful, big beach. Accessible to a great restaurant. Views of Sandy Beach and the Malecon. Easy to find and centrally located.

377979464.name: Great sunset patio
377979464.author: a TripAdvisor user
377979464.reviewBody:
I've been coming here for 30 yrs.. Wow where did the time go?
They have a happy hour and music by Rigo. The crown is 40 plus.
Nice and relaxing no boom boom! 
Enjoy!

376253633.name: CLEAN AND FRESH WATER, WITH MILES AND MILES OF SANDY BEACH
376253633.author: a TripAdvisor user
376253633.reviewBody: This beach i part of Sandy Beach in the Gulf of California or Mar de Cortez, water is warm from May to October and little cold during winter but great spot for sunsets and to have a beahc chair and enjoy sunsets.

375636963.name: This is a beautiful beach with dirty neighbors
375636963.author: a TripAdvisor user
375636963.reviewBody: We went to playa Bonita last night. The sunset was great, the beach was very peaceful. It was a Shane that every other step we took we found a potato chip wrapper, beer can and or plastic wrapper on the beach. We did everything we could to pick up after other people\' s trash. My kids kept asking why people were so dirty. I had no words for them. Such a shame that this beach is going to go waste due to dirty tourists and locals.

372517683.name: Nice walk
372517683.author: a TripAdvisor user
372517683.reviewBody: Playa Bonita is pretty if you walk further away from Pe\u00f1asco del Sol hotel. The beach next to the hotel is dirty, the water isn\'t clear, and there are a lot of vendors. The plus side of the vendors is that there are a lot of activities right there; from horseback riding to jet skis.\n\nBut walking down further, the water becomes clearer and more peaceful. We some crab, a bunch of fish, and of course Pelicans. If shelling is your thing, I definitely would recommend walking the beach because there are so many different shells to be found.

369969661.name: Nice beach
369969661.author: a TripAdvisor user
369969661.reviewBody: This is a nice beach to lay on or play on. Lots of locals walking around selling their wares and talents, They are very nice and if you say your not interested they will move along. I personally had a great time talking to the ones that spoke English. Brought my cooler and music and enjoyed the wonderful breeze and had a great time.

369013250.name: The way you want it!!
369013250.author: a TripAdvisor user
369013250.reviewBody: Beautiful, low key, comfortable, and on a gorgeous beach.  It is very located.  Beach resorts should Not be cold and sterile---this one is totally the opposite!!

365531302.name: Nice beach, difficult to find
365531302.author: a TripAdvisor user
365531302.reviewBody:
So it's easy to miss the public beach, but asking the locals should help you get there easily enough. 

there are big differences in low and high tide so if you want to swim try to go during high tide to avoid the pointy rocks.

Lots of salesmen walking around, which will approach you constantly.

361839482.name: Nice beach
361839482.author: a TripAdvisor user
361839482.reviewBody: This is a nice beach for sunning, swimming, and investigating tide pools or just for a leisurely walk.  There are usually numerous vendors.

357091054.name: Main Resort Beach in RP: Shallow, Warm Water
357091054.author: a TripAdvisor user
357091054.reviewBody: Playa Bonita is the main beach in the resort area of Rocky Point. The sand is a mixture of course and medium sand- don\'t expect white sugar sand like in Cancun or south Florida. The sea is relatively shallow without drop-offs near shore. The water is typically smooth making for great kayaking. A lot of California visitors love RP for the warm water.

355928455.name: Off season, but reasonable and good accommodations
355928455.author: a TripAdvisor user
355928455.reviewBody: In the off season in January we stayed at Playa Bonita resort hotel which was being restored to some large extent above the lobby in the open-air walkways and elevator. Hallways too were in a bit of disrepair, but clean and being worked on. Nothing fancy to report, pool and hot tub were nice, although the weather was too cool for a swim.
