The restaurant on site was closed for renovations, but the continental breakfast buffet was good both days we stayed. And the beach was nice. Breathtaking views, too.

355787304.name: An amazing quiet beach which still has the magic of Mexico without the upscale resorts and shops
355787304.author: a TripAdvisor user
355787304.reviewBody: This is a great quiet beach.  There are limited services but amazing beach combing, it fluctuates great distances with the tide, a person must watch the water, especially incoming, it can move in rather quickly.  Great shells and just fun.

354740813.author: a TripAdvisor user
354740813.reviewBody: Great place to stay with families,  mostly all balcony\'s had fabulous views.  Spa was not up to par for us,  expensive for nothing. Puesta Del Sol restaurant next door good food. The happy hour prices were awesome.. \n

353411027.name: Gorgeous
353411027.author: a TripAdvisor user
353411027.reviewBody: Not crowded, excellent location for friends and family. Water was perfect and the beach had plenty of activities to offer. Very clean.

351697549.name: Beautiful Sunset
351697549.author: a TripAdvisor user
351697549.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful. There were a lot of people but it wasn\'t too bad. Lots of little vendors, lots of rentals for jetskis, quads, and boats. It was a fun place to see. Bring a towel and some sunscreen!

351330425.name: Wow great Beach
351330425.author: a TripAdvisor user
351330425.reviewBody: This beach is so fun.  When the tide goes out you can look through tide pools for babies from the ocean.   Clean no racing vehicles in the beach.  We actually stay at the RV park.  Love it.

350925289.name: great vacation spot
350925289.author: a TripAdvisor user
350925289.reviewBody: Playa Bonita is a great spot for a real relaxing  beach is beautiful and you can sit back and watch the Mexican Air Force  ( Pelicans) a must see

349423035.name: Considerably clean beach.
349423035.author: a TripAdvisor user
349423035.reviewBody: Still a little too cold for swimming on my last visit. But great for walks, runs, and sunset viewings. Overall it\'s a nice beach and fairly clean.

348449113.name: Revisited Rocky Point
348449113.author: a TripAdvisor user
348449113.reviewBody: Stayed here in the past and enjoyed this well managed, well kept hotel with a great restaurant and reasonable prices. This time we stayed at a condo and walked down Sandy Beach for a Margarita, lunch and were not disappointed on Valentines Day. The guests all enjoy themselves, the Mariachi\'s are a welcome touch and guests are never out of line.

347734070.name: Beautiful beach great for collecting shells.
347734070.author: a TripAdvisor user
347734070.reviewBody: You can walk miles in each direction on beautiful soft sand during low tide.  Collected many gorgeous shells. During high tide wear your water shoes because you could be walking on many shell pieces.  No steep drop off for quite a distance.  Great beach to play at.

347714934.name: Short getaway
347714934.author: a TripAdvisor user
347714934.reviewBody: Just came back from a nice 4 day weekend on the beach very nice place to go and enjoy time the beach with clean water was a little cool but it was okay but the air temperature was 74 to 79 each day got a little Sun quiet on the beach no hassles everybody  was really nice

346443347.name: Traditional Mexican Beachside views with never fail meals............
346443347.author: a TripAdvisor user
346443347.reviewBody: Another long time favorite of locals this restaurant will be a relaxing and enjoyable addition to your busy schedule in Pto. Penasco.  Definite Mexican design and ambiance with both indoor and outdoor seating serving everything from hamburgers and fries to mouthwatering meals including carne asada, sopas or your favorite Mexican dish from a different local.  Recently I enjoyed lunch there with nearly 30 other women and we were well attended, everyone receiving hot delicious meals leading to many comments of satisfaction and all this with unobstructed views of the Sea of Cortez and the passing dolphins.  Clearly every family member will find something on the menu they like.  On the week ends and special holidays they have a fantastic and well priced buffet, during the Rocky Point Rally this is a popular must do.  They also have a very nice quaint attached hotel next door.

344307490.name: Like if this Hotel was a 5 star, My nephew was told by the lady who took Ms Reyna  place that he could not check
344307490.author: a TripAdvisor user
344307490.reviewBody: Horrible.  Mr Oscar, Please bring Ms Reyna Back to work for you. She was the best. She knew us by name, and would do everything in her power to make u Happy. I just want to say there are various couples that do not want to go stay with you.

339966183.name: Great beach
339966183.author: a TripAdvisor user
339966183.reviewBody: This is a place we return to often. It is clean and they have a lot of activities to enjoy. The water is almost always calm and fun to play in.

337944329.name: Nice & Clean Beach
337944329.author: a TripAdvisor user
337944329.reviewBody: The great weather and perfect condition of the beach were fantastic!  More seashells would have made it even better. :)

337854132.name: Nice!
337854132.author: a TripAdvisor user
337854132.reviewBody: Beautiful, we had a hard time getting to the actual beach since it was our first time on Puerto Penasco but we finally did asking people.\n

336689741.name: Nice but Chilly
336689741.author: a TripAdvisor user
336689741.reviewBody: We were there for Christmas and it was chilly, but several people (including us) dared to wade.  The beach was cleaner than some I\'ve been on, but there is glass and debris that you should look for if barefoot.  Farther down the beach were more trash, bottles, bones, etc, so we spent trips running to the trash.\n\nWe were approached frequently for purchases, but not long after my son said that he really wished he could ride a horse on the beach, we were approached to rent some horses on the beach.  Made his day.  The locals are friendly and eventually take no for an answer, so it\'s a pleasant way to spend the afternoon.

334807405.name: Beautiful beach
334807405.author: a TripAdvisor user
334807405.reviewBody: High tide fluctuations provided ample beach. Shells were abundant. The water was very calm and crystal clear. Sun rises and sun sets were breath taking. Definitely a great way to end a day of sight seeing. \n\nTold it was 26 miles of beach for your walking or jogging pleasure. We enjoyed our walks and shell collecting.

332982115.name: Beautiful Beach
332982115.author: a TripAdvisor user
332982115.reviewBody: We had the opportunity to walk this beach daily as our RV site was right on the beach.  The beach was kept clean and a tractor raked it daily.  Shrimp boats moored of the beach daily adding to the picturesque scenery. The sunsets were fantastic.

330886936.name: Avoid Spring Break!!
330886936.author: a TripAdvisor user
330886936.reviewBody: We had been here many times before being AZ locals, but once neglected to realize it was Spring Break and the hotels, beach, resorts, bars, restaurants were packed with 17-21 year old drunk kids everywhere. The beach is usually where the locals go to avoid the heat with their families and they make $ by selling food, trinkets, offering up banana boat rides, parasailing and it\'s nice. Unfortunately, it seems most locals don\'t care about the environment, throwing trash into the sea, leaving it all over the beach, it\'s sad. Other than that nasty little surprise, it\'s very enjoyable.

330386231.name: Rocky Point!
330386231.author: a TripAdvisor user
330386231.reviewBody: We love Rocky Point.  We use to go every other weekend and either stay in a hotel or camp on the beach.  Just a short distance and a nice get away.

329619350.name: Used to be great
329619350.author: a TripAdvisor user
329619350.reviewBody: Not as clean of a beach as it used to be, too many vendors trying to sell you items while you try to relax

327893429.name: Sunny, warm and inviting...what all beaches strive to be...
327893429.author: a TripAdvisor user
327893429.reviewBody: Been there on several occasions in December and March and it was great at each time.  A little cooler in December, but not much.  Water was clear, warm and refreshing.  Not crowded really, even over the holidays.  Camped on the beach at an RV park and so you can\'t really have a bad time.  A good bit of sellers at times, but it\'s easy to just say no gracias and they\'ll move on.  But, the beach is long and fairly wide and it\'s real easy to just walk and have a nice peaceful time, if that\'s what you want.  Love that place!

320402475.name: Great experience
320402475.author: a TripAdvisor user
320402475.reviewBody: Excellent food, good service, great view and fantastic Mexican coffee as dessert. The Mexican music was interesting, maybe a little bit too loud. Price / quality was also good. Overall  impression: fantastic evening.

318987028.name: great get away from the heat
318987028.author: a TripAdvisor user
318987028.reviewBody: We travel(ed) there on several occasions over the last number of years and always have a great time.  WE pull our RV up to the beach wall and camp for a week to 10 days.  You can swim, fish, run, walk, buy stuff and generally relax.  I suggest it to anyone since it\'s so close to drive.

318809976.name: excellent sand and calm waters
318809976.author: a TripAdvisor user
318809976.reviewBody: We spent most of our trip here. The parking lot was safe and not crowded. The beach itself was also not crowded, the only bummer was the chair rental guy was drunk on the job and couldnt tell us the price for chairs that made any sort of sense in any language! we opted to just use our beach towels and all was well, we left our belongings and had not issues with our belongings being safe.

315455155.name: Great place to kick back and relax
315455155.author: a TripAdvisor user
315455155.reviewBody: This is a large beach and the setting varies depending upon where you set up as parts can be rocky. We put our awning and chairs between the $10.00 campground and the Playa Bonita near the waters edge at high tide. It can be busy on a weekend but on a weekday we practically had the beach to ourselves. The sand goes out for a long ways so when swimming you don\'t have to be concerned about the rocks. Early in the morning a man on a quad was picking up trash. We had a lazy day of swimming in the warm water and watching the waves. We had plenty of iced drinks, snacks and water in our cooler There are also vendors on weekends with food and drinks.for the more adventurous. It was a wonderful, relaxing time.

311396307.name: nice place to watch the sun set
311396307.author: a TripAdvisor user
311396307.reviewBody: Watched the sunset here and enjoyed it very much.  The sand was clean.  Puerto Penasco is a bit sketchy but we never felt unsafe.

310675219.name: Beautiful!!!
310675219.author: a TripAdvisor user
310675219.reviewBody: Playa Bonita Beach is Beautiful!!!!  We stayed at a Resort Condo and the view from our balcony was breathtaking!!

306026458.name: Great Place to Hang Out
306026458.author: a TripAdvisor user
306026458.reviewBody: This is a very large beach, even larger when the tide is out. The sand is soft and the water is warm. Great views of the Sea of Cortez and sunsets. No ATV\'s allowed on the beach so that is a BIG plus. You will be approached by the local vendors. Please don\'t be rude, they are only trying to make a living. A simple no gracias will send them on their way. The biggest asset of this beach is Playa Bonita Resort and restaurant. They have the greatest happy hour in Rocky Point. The Guacamole is fresh and tasty and the drinks are cheap. They usually have some kind of live entertainment as well. If you stay for dinner I highly recommend Camarones Laguna Azul. These are shrimp, wrapped in bacon and stuffed with either cheese or a jalapeno pepper. This is a great place to spend a weekend or a week.

304823624.name: Nice public beach
304823624.author: a TripAdvisor user
304823624.reviewBody: This is a public beach, you can make a good deal with the parking and showers, they are a lot a vendors who just are doing that for leaving,  I\'ve never feel that they want to take advantage of us; I just feel bad since a couldn\'t buy all that they sell:(. There is a banana boat that is excellent, you can just wasting time in your floating for hours

304165090.name: Not your touristy Mexico
304165090.author: a TripAdvisor user
304165090.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for soft white sand and palms, keep looking.  Rougher sand than gulf/atlantic coast, can be rocky when you get into the water, bring flip flops (especially around spring break) for potential broken glass or larger rocks.  Plenty of local vendors, although nothing like Cabo/Cancun/other touristy places, and they\'re usually not as pushy.  Clear a patch of sand for volleyball, bocce, ladderball, futbol (again, just check for glass or large rocks first).  Overall, great place to drag up a beach chair, umbrella, and cooler and just relax for an afternoon; relaxed attitude is something you can\'t find on US beaches

299883563.name: quiet and away from public
299883563.author: a TripAdvisor user
299883563.reviewBody: if your looking for a quiet beach go during the week, then its like you own thee beach, sands are clearr and water perfect. bring your fun beach toys and kids and have a blast during your visit. no rocks on this beach, and when the tide goes out it goe way out! so dont park on the beach if tide out or you will lose your car. saw it happen twice.

296340908.name: Terrible!
296340908.author: a TripAdvisor user
296340908.reviewBody: Playa bonita is not all that nice. Water was dirty. There\'s glass on the beach. Really not much of a scenery.\nThe private beaches are way better! If your looking to ride the boats or kayaking they make house calls.

290480556.name: Relax from the rush
290480556.author: a TripAdvisor user
290480556.reviewBody: Playa Bonita Beach is average area beach. kept clean for sure. typical local vendors that actually take "no thank you" without an issue.

289679221.name: Nice n clean
289679221.author: a TripAdvisor user
289679221.reviewBody: It\'s nice family oriented beach, make sure to take enough water , chair n umbrella, to enjoy the beach.

287384766.name: 4th of July weekend
287384766.author: a TripAdvisor user
287384766.reviewBody: Was there on  4th july weekend , the water was warm, lots of people,  lots of vendors, it\'s a big beach it\'s extends from where all  the hotels  are in one section to the campground where we stay for 10 bucks a night right next to the beach. And end of the night around 9pm some of the hotels had fireworks

286835531.name: So and so!
286835531.author: a TripAdvisor user
286835531.reviewBody:
First and most important: Be AWARE of STINGRAYS! Unfortunately, I got stung, it was very painful and had to go to Red Cross ambulance to remove it and get some shots!
The beach itself is quite nice but can be dirty and overcrowded, especially its eastern part, where the locals come. There are a lot of pieces of broken glass in the sand, so take care not to cut yourself!
However, there is more fun because they play music, dance and you can purchase various things and refreshments (including fresh fruit specialties).
Also, it is amazing to see how much sea level changes between low and hide tide!

284766332.name: Great beach
284766332.author: a TripAdvisor user
284766332.reviewBody: This is a great beach, nice sand, good vendors and a few restaurants by the water. Water can be rough some days but usually it is not. It is rocky at some points, and during low tide, walking around the rocks is very nice, lots of sea creatures to observe. The only problem here is some tourists, and some vendors do throw some trash on the beach that will accumulate over the years if tourists and government alike do not pay attention. Otherwise great place to visit, and fairly inexpensive.

284478615.name: Great Place for Lunch & Dinner
284478615.author: a TripAdvisor user
284478615.reviewBody: The lunch & dinner quality & quantity is great.  We especially love the glaucoma dip & shrimp chemise.  Also, Oliver always greets us with a smile & attention to detail.  Oliver is knowledgeable of the menu suggest a dinner that fits the bill.     G&C

284295779.name: local beach
284295779.author: a TripAdvisor user
284295779.reviewBody: lots of vendors and people. Too many stray dogs trying to keep cool in the ocean.  But, it is a public beach and we were happy just to be there.

282632225.name: Life\'s a Beach
282632225.author: a TripAdvisor user
282632225.reviewBody: Nothing like staying right on the beach, being able to enjoy the peace and tranquility of an early morning walk or siting on the sand and watching the sun goes down at the end of the day. Then doing it again the next day. Definitely my kind of ground hog day

277085005.name: HEAVEN
277085005.author: a TripAdvisor user
277085005.reviewBody: A slice on heaven on earth. Clean tranquil and seashells to pick if that\'s your thing. Local vendors travel up and down with everything from drinks to silver jewelry. Beachfront horseback rides also available. Water clear and fresh you can\'t help but frolic after basking in the sun with your favorite cerveca.

274546644.name: BEAUTIFUL
274546644.author: a TripAdvisor user
274546644.reviewBody: This beach is so so beautiful! It was so fun to have to locals come up and make hand made bracelets on the beach, or serve pina coladas. it wasn\'t very crowded, so it was nice to simply relax and listen to the waves

273206929.name: Wonderful Beach
273206929.author: a TripAdvisor user
273206929.reviewBody: The whole Playa Bonita/Sandy Beach area is a great beach to enjoy.  There are many places to park all along the beach area especially closer to town (most at a fee) but it is a bit of a walk down to the beach so be prepared.  The tides here are fantastic especially at New/Full Moon so you may find yourself moving your spot quite a bit but how much fun it is to discover what lies in the sand when the tide goes out.  This is a wonderful place to hunt for seashells and creatures of the sea.  You can literally walk the beach from town to Rocky Point if your inclined.  It\'s a little crowded on the weekend but really mellow during the week.  There are vendors around but no hassle and some even have umbrellas to rent as well as all the sea toys.  I even saw campfires & fireworks at night.  Great place to hang out and enjoy.  We were there in April and sea temp was fine, no problem staying in water and warmer than pool at our condo rental.

272227772.name: Nice beach, big on low tide.
272227772.author: a TripAdvisor user
272227772.reviewBody: Nice and huge beach, with great change depending on the low or high tides. \nYou must to be careful when walk, because there are small pieces of glass on the sand. Wear shoes.

265922108.name: Beautiful, fun, windy
265922108.author: a TripAdvisor user
265922108.reviewBody: This is the place to hang out and swim. There are people selling nick nacks along the beach, a few restaurants to eat at, and we saw people kite surfing. Even in March the water was warm and nice. This area is very exposed though and therefore quite windy.

263785667.name: it\'s a beautiful beach
263785667.author: a TripAdvisor user
263785667.reviewBody: nice beach but watch out for dehydration I got sick from heat stroke :P\nthe restaurants nearby may not be cheap as you expect in Mexico cuz this area is very much Americanized...

259754919.name: Playa Bonita Lunch
259754919.author: a TripAdvisor user
259754919.reviewBody: This is a fun place to have lunch. Wind surfers will entertain you on weekend; a little shopping too!

259257249.name: The only beach I frequent
259257249.author: a TripAdvisor user
259257249.reviewBody: The beach itself is very clean and very well maintained. Great for an evening campfire or setting off chinese lanterns in the night sky.  every once in a while you can see a pod of dolphins on their hunt out in the distance and a great view of the old port from there.

251442212.name: Great place
251442212.author: a TripAdvisor user
251442212.reviewBody: Playa Bonita RV Park is on the water across  the bay from Old Town (The Melacan). Beautiful view.The grounds are kept clean and the people guests and staff are very friendly. They have showers and laundry. There are activities such as cards and bingo. This is the third time I have stayed here.

250007120.name: All the beaches in PP are great
250007120.author: a TripAdvisor user
250007120.reviewBody: This one is close to town and you can walk to it from the strip of hotels at Sandy Beach. The tides go in and out so you can walk very comfortably in your bare feet on packed sand.

248141757.name: Great Service but the hotel is a bit run down
248141757.author: a TripAdvisor user
248141757.reviewBody: Playa Bonita Hotel....Great service here, great restaurant on beach but if you stay a the hotel, expect the outside to be kept up better than the inside, especially the rooms.  They need to remodel the rooms.

247602674.name: great getaway & short drive from Phoenix
247602674.author: a TripAdvisor user
247602674.reviewBody: Our family of 4 went for 3 days from Phoenix, AZ to Playa Bonita at Puerto Penasco. Crossing the border into Mexico was amazing, because vegetation was the same, but people, road signs in Spanish , driving rules (2 cars drove thru\' red signals...) all change. You can bargain better if you know Spanish, and  there are lots of nice things to buy. If you want regular groceries (bread, milk, fruits...) go to LEY\'S (lot more variety) or OXXO . Many seafood restaurants (i don\'t know about food here, as I\'m a vegetarian). Roads run parallel & perpendicular. But the advice given to us was, eat at a restaurant only. We enjoyed it.  \n\nThe resort itself was good - room service, outdoor sauna, good food, clean & well maintained . We visited during the Christmas break. So it wasn\'t crowded and temp was 60 deg F. (cool).

247602385.name: Not soft
247602385.author: a TripAdvisor user
247602385.reviewBody: I like soft, stroll worthy beaches.  Unless the tide is out, the beach is coarse and hard to walk in.

246704543.name: vacation
246704543.author: a TripAdvisor user
246704543.reviewBody: I Liked the 2 pools and the restaurant, great food. I also liked the easy access to the beach. Free wi-fi.

246203083.name: Public Beach Access, Mostly Sand, Few Rocks.
246203083.author: a TripAdvisor user
246203083.reviewBody: This is the public beach that is located in the center of town off 13th st.  It is a pretty nice beach, better than Las Conchas but not as good as the Sandy Beach Resorts. There is free public parking at it is walking distance from several restaurants and bars.

244803407.name: Bonita
244803407.author: a TripAdvisor user
244803407.reviewBody: This beach is aptly named indeed! Playa Gorgeous would be more apt but not very local! Clear water, clean sand, good vibe, friendly crowd!

244269559.name: quiet, calm mornings and evenings
244269559.author: a TripAdvisor user
244269559.reviewBody: Anywhere on the Sea of Cortez is a wonderful experience.  From Los Barrels to Puerto Penasco, it is calm, quiet, peaceful and warm.  Morning and evening walks are the best anywhere.  Playa Bonita (or Sandy Beach) is no exception.  Laid back atmosphere, and yet toy rentals nearby if you need a little excitement.  Vendors are around if you need or want something, but if not, they move on with a simple No Gracias.  No need to be rude, they\'re just trying to feed their families, too.  There\'s absolutely nothing I don\'t like about the beaches in Baja including Sandy Beach at Puerto Penasco.

243348080.name: Fun Beach in Good Location
243348080.author: a TripAdvisor user
243348080.reviewBody: We have been going to this beach for nearly 10 years and it is a great place to let the kids play.  It can be very crowded, but is easily accessible.  The restaurant and bar are great too!

241030198.name: Gorgeous beach
241030198.author: a TripAdvisor user
241030198.reviewBody: First stop on our bar hop tour...the workers are friendly and the beach was breathtaking...has a true Mayan vibe.. Neat swings at bar and clean restrooms...

239396081.name: Great staff and food
239396081.author: a TripAdvisor user
239396081.reviewBody: Clean, refreshing and wonderful view. Courteous staff nice sandy beach fresh ocean breezes. Nothing to say bad about this place!!!

238461267.name: Great Beach
238461267.author: a TripAdvisor user
238461267.reviewBody: Great Beach. One of the most popular beaches. Very clean and can get crowded during high season. Water sports and a lot of vendors

227402056.name: Playa Bonita
227402056.author: a TripAdvisor user
227402056.reviewBody: We\'ve been the Sandy Beach and find that it is more rocky than Playa Bonita.  Public areas clean and virtually lava rock free!

207934482.name: Beautiful beach easy to walk and collect shells.
207934482.author: a TripAdvisor user
207934482.reviewBody: Lots of activities from souvenirs to Ultralight airplane rides, jet ski rentals, horseback riding, and "banana boat" riding.

205204281.name: Playa Bonito RV & Resort
205204281.author: a TripAdvisor user
205204281.reviewBody:
We stayed at Playa Bonito RV park in in Mid April 2014
It was a great experience and we enjoyed our stay very much. We had beach front site.
The good: nice folks, good security, good neighbors, good beach and access. Nice folks and overall experience was great.
What could have been better. The wifi could be better and we generally had to go to the reading room for consistent service. They could upgrade some of the plumbing for sewers, but according to everything I saw and witnessed they do what they have to to make sure things are in working order. We felt safe and had fun there during our 11 day stay. The community is being improved and this was the best park we found. the Playa Bonito area was great. We stayed one night at another park that was south of the port area on Playa de Oro we moved to Playa Bonito on the 2nd day! and really were glad we made the switch! Sandy Beach area was awesome!

205001900.name: Great Views
205001900.author: a TripAdvisor user
205001900.reviewBody: I like the breakfast on the patio. Dinners can be nice too. Angel is my favorite waiter. Ask for him when you are there

198336308.name: nice beach
198336308.author: a TripAdvisor user
198336308.reviewBody: Nice beach, not crowded even though it was U of AZs spring break. The only problem is that you will be hounded by beach vendors that usually go away after a "no thank you". There are some places that are more rocky than others that you can see when the tide goes out so beware if you go out swimming when the large rocks are not as visible at high tide.

196769535.name: Great beach in Rocky Point
196769535.author: a TripAdvisor user
196769535.reviewBody: Probably the best beach in Rocky Point and the vendors don\'t bug you until late afternoon.  A walk in the morning was great

188515925.name: Nice beach
188515925.author: a TripAdvisor user
188515925.reviewBody: Nice. However, do not go barefoot! People just seem to throw their glass bottles anywhere. This site wants me to say more than I have already?

186743305.name: Playa Bonita Restuarant
186743305.author: a TripAdvisor user
186743305.reviewBody: We tried the Playa Bonita Restaurant, right on the Playa Bonita Beach last time we went.  It was a little gem that we\'d never seen before.  We went for breakfast and it was great. Good food and beautiful views. Next time we want to try the bar.  It looks like it would be fun and was set up for dancing and possibly karaoke.

180956550.name: playa bonita beach a great place to tan, collect seashells
180956550.author: a TripAdvisor user
180956550.reviewBody: puerto penasco is only 3 hrs away but it feels like a whole world away. no traffic like phoenix, its peaceful and you can see the stars and the air is fresh and clean, no dust storms, no smog, just perfect, you feel like you never want to go back to arizona.\n\nThere are great gentle horses you can rent to ride along the beaches for hours

180738943.name: Best beach access close to town and at reliable motel
180738943.author: a TripAdvisor user
180738943.reviewBody: Looked after somewhat by the Playa Bonita and Laos Mar motel staff, Playa Bonita Beach is generally open to the public and is favored by both locals and visitors.  It is probably the cleanest and least crowded beach fairly close to town.  Views of both old and newer Rocky Point (RP) are spectacular at sunrise and sunset.  A few vendors sell tacos and locally-made crafts.  \n\nOne downside is that during Spring Break, noisy ATVs might be objectionable to some tourists.  Access is off the Coastal Blvd according to plentiful directional signage.  If you want to stay I recommend both Playa Bonita and Laos Mar hotels.  They are reliable and have long been favorites of RP regulars.  Many claim the best buffet and best margaritas inn town are served there.  Enjoy!

180522276.name: Serenity and nature on Playa Bonita
180522276.author: a TripAdvisor user
180522276.reviewBody:
This fine blond sand  beach stretches for miles.  At dawn the beach is quiet, with just the surf to accompany you.  You may want to dally in the tide pools--find pigmy octopus under rocks--or power walk--or just stroll.  Dogs are allowed, and credit to the dog owners the beach is clean.  Shells are abundant.  It's a great place to get lost in thought.

Later in the day mariachi  bands, food vendors and peddlers of all goods touristic will liven up the beach.   Sundown is magnificent--we hoped for a green flash but no joy.

At dark the beach goes  quiet again.

What luck such a beauty is only a few hours from Tucson.

176347665.name: Hot - don\'t go in September
176347665.author: a TripAdvisor user
176347665.reviewBody: had the beach to ourselves in the evening loved the tide pools\n\nThey could clean the beaches a little bit more - shouldn\'t allow glass on the beach - saw lots of glass beer bottles

175574010.name: Best views
175574010.author: a TripAdvisor user
175574010.reviewBody: This is by far the best place to watch the sun set. The water is warm and the scenery is beautiful. This is a safer place to visit. I would just suggest paying attention to your surroundings anytime you are in Mexico. Remember you are in another country so don\'t take anything for granted. I\'ve never had a problem but you really should be careful.

175491025.name: Awesome Beach!
175491025.author: a TripAdvisor user
175491025.reviewBody:
The beach is directly in front of the resorts and the ocean is only a few steps away.  The beach was clean and well maintained.  There were vendors walking up and down the beach which I enjoy, but I know some people hate.  Just say "No Gracias" and they are gone.  There are massage tables, banana boat rides, horse back rides, jet ski rentals.  People selling toys for kids, bags, hats, jewlry, etc...  TIP:  Try one of the mangos for $3, they are so juicy messy, full of spices and fantastic!   This beach has a tide like I have never seen.  It will literately drop and raise about 80 yards leaving a fantastic tide pool where my kids caught hermit crabs, little fish, bigger crabs, and even a jelly fish.  They spent hours each day looking for critters in the late afternoon.  TIP:  make sure to bring a little clear cage (crabitat) for the kids to keep their critters...  mine loved it.  Also bring beach toys for them.  TIP:  When the tide drops the exposed   rocks and coral are sharp be sure to bring beach shoes.  My feet got so torn up!   
The tide begins to rise around 9:00am, by 11:00 it is almost all the way up.  In the evening the tide probably begins to fall around 3:00.  By 4:00-7:00 is a fantastic time for your family to look for critters.  

This beach was a great beach for the family.....  I highly recommend if you are looking for a beach vacation.  The beach seems way better than California... 1.) The ocean water is warm 2.) you can drink on the beach 3.) there is an awesome tide that gives the kids something to do on the beach besides swim and play in the sand.  
We felt very safe the entire time

169483131.name: Amazing
169483131.author: a TripAdvisor user
169483131.reviewBody: Playa Bonita Beach is simply amazing. There is about a 15 foot tide. You can swim at 2 pm and then walk out 200 yards at 5 pm. \n\nDo not miss it.

168102775.name: Go see for yourself it\'s worth it !!! :)
168102775.author: a TripAdvisor user
168102775.reviewBody: If you want to relax you can... fish in the sea... swim  sunbathe ..., occasionally politely say no or yes to the beach vendors drink ...eat ...but most of all just have fun ....We did !!!!\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026

165813757.name: Fun in the HOTTT Sun.
165813757.author: a TripAdvisor user
165813757.reviewBody: Stayed at a resort on Sandy Beach and our family enjoyed our selves very much in the warm waters without the jellyfish we had been warned about. had a blast on the banana boats that cost about $5 bucks per person. Would suggest on bringing a large umbrella/tent to protect your family from the sun or rent one for $25bucks your choice.

165115641.name: The reason for the trip
165115641.author: a TripAdvisor user
165115641.reviewBody: Playa Bonita Beach is also known as Sandy Beach. Super-wide and clean sand. They comb and clean it daily. A good time to walk down it is at low tide when the tidal pools are filled with little marine critters skittering around. The water is warm pool-like in the summer. A great time to get in is at night in late summer when the photo plankton light up all around you and you glow. Of course, it makes it easier for the sharks to see you, too. Nah, just kidding about that. No sharks, just a great experience.

165112575.name: Gold Coast Shrimp - WOW!!!
165112575.author: a TripAdvisor user
165112575.reviewBody: Three words: Gold Coast Shrimp.  Perfectly cooked bacon wrapped shrimp with a rich cheese sauce, vegetables, and rice.Decadent, oh yes! This is our favorite dish in Puerto Penasco, and Playa Bonita is our favorite place to order it. Yummy!

159091007.name: fair beach with loads of people bothering you and junk for sale all at super high prices
159091007.author: a TripAdvisor user
159091007.reviewBody: Not a great beach with loads of people bothering you and junk for sale all at super high prices... Not much for swimming since it is rocky and dirty. This is not the part of Mexico to see.... \n\nEasy drive from Arizona or Southern California, but by far the biggest scam city in Mexico for travelers.

155262453.name: Best beach impossible to get to
155262453.author: a TripAdvisor user
155262453.reviewBody: This is the nicest beach in town and it\'s also where all the resorts are. It\'s almost impossible to get to if you don\'t stay at a resort, though. There is a public parking area at the end of 18th st where you can go down to the beach and then walk to a nice spot. If you have a 4x4 vehicle you might be able to go over some dunes and reach an undeveloped area, though.

154434867.name: Dirty and Vendor-Infested
154434867.author: a TripAdvisor user
154434867.reviewBody: Stay on Sandy Beach or farther south at Las Conchas.  This is the locals beach, so you can get decent prices on hair braiding if your kid is interested in that.

154304104.name: NO ACCESS TO THE PUBLIC
154304104.author: a TripAdvisor user
154304104.reviewBody: There was no access to the public at Playa Bonita due to construction.  Very disappointing!  You were able to see there was a good view, but too bad it wasn\'t accessible at the time we went.

153520145.name: Had lunch on patio
153520145.author: a TripAdvisor user
153520145.reviewBody: We had a group of 8 for lunch. Asked for seating on the patio, no problem. Good fish basket, clams were not the best, oysters seemed sweet to my taste, Salsa & chips were very tasty. View of the ocean is spectacular, and the beach is right there. Beautiful place.

152210843.name: Its okay
152210843.author: a TripAdvisor user
152210843.reviewBody: But margaritas aren\'t fresh tasting, chips and beans taste like lard and salt, and (granted -- this is of no concern to most) it is not  vegetarian friendly.

149811439.name: Sandy beach is the place to be during the day
149811439.author: a TripAdvisor user
149811439.reviewBody: I\'ve come here several times and the sandy beach around the playa bonita/penasco del sol hotels is the place to be during the day. There are several affordable activities you can do. Banana boat, Jetski rentals, ATV/offroad vehicle rentals to ride along the sands, parasailing, henna tattooing (be careful if you have skin allergies as they do use hair paint to make it black), and lots of locals selling Mexican curios including Mexican silver jewelry. The drinks are good too if you get a "Pina Colada" or a "Coco" (coconut). Most activities here are proper for children 7+. At night you may want to go down to "The Reef" at the end of the hotels away from town and you can park next to the beach and enjoy beers, sunset, etc. I also recommend going on the Sunset Cruise boats as they usually have great local live music, food, and drinks for cheap. The boats feature fireworks once sunset and go back within an hour.

147130889.name: Nice beach
147130889.author: a TripAdvisor user
147130889.reviewBody: Beach was great!  Had alot of awesome shells you normally wouldn\'t find.  The round curly ones:)   There was alot of black coral by our hotel, Playa Bonita but lots of sandy areas to play in.

145290782.name: Great service
145290782.author: a TripAdvisor user
145290782.reviewBody: The food was really great here. You could dine right on the beach. The service was very polite and attentive. Not very crowded

137781071.name: Happy hour at Playa Bonita hotel
137781071.author: a TripAdvisor user
137781071.reviewBody:
Yesterday, Saturday, at 6:30pm my mother and I visited Playa Bonita recommended by the owner of the condo we're renting, for the happy hour which occurs every day from 4 to 7pm. The restaurant had no customers, except a couple sitting on the balcony and us. 
The national beers and cocktails cost U$2.00 and we were provided with a basket of ok tortilla chips and salsa. Service was good.
My piña colada was bland, almost no alcohol.
Sunset is nice but the sun goes down in the north (right hand side) of the beach, so you can't see as well as if you're at the Old Puerto or at Peñasco del Sol.

135875117.name: The place to unwind
135875117.author: a TripAdvisor user
135875117.reviewBody: These sandy beaches are so inviting, fun to just walk on searching for shells, and the water is incredibly nice. This is a must do event even if you just want to relax and unwind...which is exactly what we did. Gorgeous beach!

135487968.name: Wonderful Vacation spot
135487968.author: a TripAdvisor user
135487968.reviewBody: I have been traveling to Puerto Pe\u00f1asco lately and I have realized that this paradisiacal  location is so wonderful. Here, you can find a wide variety of activities like Scuba Diving, fishing, and above all have a quiet and peaceful vacation free of pollution, and noise. The beach is amazing as well as its people. I certainly want to go back soon and enjoy the mixture of a blue ocean and golden desert sand.

134461485.name: Nice beach
134461485.author: a TripAdvisor user
134461485.reviewBody: Visitors need to have some sort of shade structure while on the beach.

133854937.name: Used 2 b Great
133854937.author: a TripAdvisor user
133854937.reviewBody:
The Playa Bonita is a short caballo ride up the playa from my casa on the playa.....
It used 2 b a great place to sit outside on the patio, get DRUNK & watch the Sunsets...
Now there r very few Gringos going 2 Rocky Point, since Gringos made up most of the Drunks
that frequented the place, they removed the tables, chairs & outside bars.........That Sucks !!
The Sunsets r still great but all the Fun Is Gone................
Hey All u Gringos, Remember, Rocky Point Is Still a Very Safe Destination...
The Media Lied & Screwed Up The Perception Of Rocky Point, Which Has Been
A Huge Injustice..... All The Ol' Fun Rocky Point Peeps Should Start Givin' Rocky Point
Another Chance !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Hope 2 c Every1 there 4 the RC Motorcycle Rally the 2nd Weekend in November.........................

130910439.name: Beautiful beach sunset
130910439.author: a TripAdvisor user
130910439.reviewBody: Go here for the sunset. The beach is beautiful, the colors are amazing when the sun goes down.

128527058.name: upscale
128527058.author: a TripAdvisor user
128527058.reviewBody: go here only if luxury is a necessity - but beaches are awesome and restaurants outside of resorts are reasonably priced - if you stay here, be sure to visit old town Penasco and Cholla Bay for some authentic Mexico flavor

128180131.name: over priced eats
128180131.author: a TripAdvisor user
128180131.reviewBody: We did not stay at the hotel but did eat brunch their saturday morning. It consisted of fruit, and regular mexican fare, and a omlet bar.  The only redeming thing about the brunch was the omlet bar which was ok and the fresh fruit (pineapple) . \n\nWe attempted to have dinner there but after looking at the prices  $15.00 for cevichi....um dont think so, by the way isnt the fish suppose to be cheaper in a costal fishing town??  After the sticker shock we left and went into town for a great meal at Al Capones.

127150699.name: NOT HAPPY
127150699.author: a TripAdvisor user
127150699.reviewBody: towels are very old and you only get one. The toilet is old a rusty. becareful when your in the shower the water all of a sudden changes to really hot to cold. my daughter forgot her camera in the room on top of the bed and i called right away to see if they had found it. I was told they didn\'t find anything. Which I can not belive if this is the last placed she used it at and she remembers she left it. I guess Mexico has a lost or found box right????\n

121359215.name: Playa Bonita Hotel Resturant
121359215.author: a TripAdvisor user
121359215.reviewBody: Good place to eat.  It is one the beach and lunch is a great value.

674470869.name: Sleepy little village far from the "madding crowd"
674470869.author: a TripAdvisor user
674470869.reviewBody: We drove out here and loved it. There is only one restaurant and we weren\'t ready to dine so don\'t know if it was good but driving around the village was fun.

665128707.name: Fun and funky neighborhood
665128707.author: a TripAdvisor user
665128707.reviewBody: Drove through the area but did not stop.  Loved the architecture!  Very secluded from the other areas of Rocky Point

665080870.name: Sleepy Gringo Fishing Village
665080870.author: a TripAdvisor user
665080870.reviewBody: Cramped, dusty, little village. Mostly Americans, and some ex-pats.  JJ\'s Cantina is a central place to gather and have a drink.  Not a lot going on here.

664792763.name: Off the Beaton Path
664792763.author: a TripAdvisor user
664792763.reviewBody: Short drive from Sandy Beach into a more laid back small village with dirt streets and no pressure. Beautiful views on either side including the bay. A couple of restaurants with JJs being the most notable. Restaurants are generally closed mid-week in the off season. Lots of Americans own the colorful homes in this area. We tried fishing from the surf at Pelican Point without luck, however with the right gear and timing, I think it would be OK. A highly recommended day trip to explore. Another bonus is Cholla Bay is usually calm if the wind is up on the gulf side.

660043277.name: Laid back and low key
660043277.author: a TripAdvisor user
660043277.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is a step back in time to a Mexican Beach without condos, ultra lights and crowds. It is quiet, low key, and a place to slow down. We ate lunch at JJ\'s. The food was great and affordable and the staff friendly. We sat outside and watched the ocean. Later we took a leisurely walk on the beach and watched the local boats come in and out at the marina.\n\nThis place is very special. It is quiet and relaxing. The cantina\'s are friendly and the people are great.

651955503.name: Great little area away from the hustle of Puerto Penasco
651955503.author: a TripAdvisor user
651955503.reviewBody:
We rented a house through AirBNB and were extremely happy with both the house and the area.  We happened to be there on a Monday thru Thursday and most of the restaurants were closed on Tuesday and Wednesday so we had to eat in the main town on those two days.  

The streets are all plowed sand but very easy to get around.  There are a couple of small markets for those convenience items needed like purified ice and water, beer, snacks, etc.

Highly recommend staying in Cholla Bay.

651589306.name: Beautiful View
651589306.author: a TripAdvisor user
651589306.reviewBody: Beach access was hard to find but the view was spectacular.  We enjoyed watching the tide come in and out.  Quiet area not a lot of traffic.  Was an easy distance to great eateries.  Town was a couple miles away.

646177047.name: This was beautiful spot
646177047.author: a TripAdvisor user
646177047.reviewBody: Found it while exploring on the last day and think this is where we will go next time we come. Cleaner community and less pushy vendors.

644950174.name: Spectacular sunsets
644950174.author: a TripAdvisor user
644950174.reviewBody: Clean beach, lots of shells and Sea Glass, we\'ve watched Dolphins, flying fish, Osprey, Pelicans, Gulls, Sandpipers, Cormerans, kayakers, Pongas and snorklers... It\'s a great place for families, romantic sunsets, a walk on the beach and exploring tide pools when the tide is low. Bring a kite on a breezy day, or a beach chair to just enjoy the view. It\'s nice before the area gets busy with all the off-roaders.

644776927.name: Great views until the tide goes out.
644776927.author: a TripAdvisor user
644776927.reviewBody: Very interesting little community. The view of the bay was great until the tide went out. Used that time to find shells.

635943122.name: Beautiful sun and moon rising
635943122.author: a TripAdvisor user
635943122.reviewBody: Marginal roads but great views. Drinks and company good all around. Not a great beach, but 4 wheelers and zip line are lots of fun.

631313093.name: awesome as always
631313093.author: a TripAdvisor user
631313093.reviewBody: we love Cholla Bay its always a balst and its nice not to have to be stuck in all the craziness of RP but that we can got to town in only 10 mins is the best!!

621870842.name: shell hunting is great
621870842.author: a TripAdvisor user
621870842.reviewBody: drive to J J\'s and park, have lunch and go shell hunting and beach combing, walk around the point, at low tide you can almost walk across the bay

617407572.name: Beautiful!
617407572.author: a TripAdvisor user
617407572.reviewBody: Definitely our preferred place to hang out. Plenty of places to eat, drink, entertainment, and beautiful views. It\'s a little expensive to be honest, and don\'t eat ice remember that, we were sick for days!

611269475.name: JJ\'s Cantina
611269475.author: a TripAdvisor user
611269475.reviewBody: JJ\'s is a must if you want a taste of what it was like in the 70\'s. Friday & Saturday nights are the best. Great view to have a taco and margarita ocean side.

609063964.name: Drove around
609063964.author: a TripAdvisor user
609063964.reviewBody: Drove here from town not expecting to find anything spectacular and we sure didn\'t! There is not a decent beach here so I don\'t get the attraction.

608641890.name: Beautiful beach
608641890.author: a TripAdvisor user
608641890.reviewBody: The water is warm and clean.  Excellent for small children.  My grandkids had a blast.  This was the first time my 4 yr old and 6 yr old grandkids had seen the ocean and they enjoyed the sunny beach.

595598060.name: Beautiful slice of life
595598060.author: a TripAdvisor user
595598060.reviewBody: Stayed a week on Cholla Bay in May 2018. Beautiful place with amazing beaches. Went swimming everyday and could not have been happier.

594401792.name: Awesome!  Must visit during low tide!
594401792.author: a TripAdvisor user
594401792.reviewBody: Check the tide schedule, and get out there during low tide for shelling!  Found many sand dollars, shells, octopus (make sure your shells don\'t have any little guys living in them!)  Gorgeous spot!  Stop at JJ\'s for a bloody mary or margarita or cerveza!

588617917.name: Must go to JJ\'s
588617917.author: a TripAdvisor user
588617917.reviewBody: We always make a point to go to JJ\'s when we travel to Rocky Point. Cholla Bay was one of the first parts of Rocky Point that Americans started building homes. JJ\'s is a land mark as one of if not the oldest bar in the area.

587751793.name: What a beautiful place
587751793.author: a TripAdvisor user
587751793.reviewBody: What a beautiful place. Tucked away from the touristy spots.  A quiet calm water bay.  The sand is okay as it\'s a bit rocky. And the roads can be dusty.  But bbn if you want to really get away...

586550932.name: Go to Choya Bay
586550932.author: a TripAdvisor user
586550932.reviewBody: Small town about 20 min from Puerto Pe\u00f1asco. Americans seem to have overrun the town \ud83d\ude44 and are very rude...but Choya Bay is breathtaking at sunset. Oyster Bay is very cool as well. The beach is littered with hermit crabs and you can wade in the shallow waters. We didn\u2019t make it to Oyster House this trip, but I\u2019ve heard they\u2019re amazing. Cute little place to visit!

586478938.name: Pretty Seaside Location
586478938.author: a TripAdvisor user
586478938.reviewBody: If you\'re travelling to Puerto Penasco, Cholla Bay is worth a look. The bay is a nice location to watch the sun rise and set. Seaside homes washed in earthy pastels line the slopes above the bay, giving the site a bit of a clean, throwback appeal. From the deck at JJ\'s, a bar and eatery, you can gaze across the bay and watch fishing boats working the tides. At low tide, you might see adventurers bent at the waist as they dig for clams and mussels. Others ride the beaches on horses or the faster ATVs. All in all, Cholla Bay offers a tranquil pastoral setting.

586301260.name: A little rough around the edges but breathtaking beautiful
586301260.author: a TripAdvisor user
586301260.reviewBody: When you first see it, a little dusty but it grows to a beautiful rocky, quiet, from the crowd.  Slowly growing but bows the time to see before every one finds this secret.  Ocean calm and crystal clear.

582321689.name: Great if you want a quiet getaway
582321689.author: a TripAdvisor user
582321689.reviewBody:
I've always like Cholla Bay. It's quiet and feels a bit lost in time and far from the "big city" of Puerto Penasco.

JJ's is good for some fish and chips and some beers. There's a beach right there for a quick dip.

Better is Tucson beach a bit farther up the road. There's a right turn that you can usually identify by the activity. You can see the beach from the road. 

Here you'll mix with Mexican locals. It's a worthwhile experience. I was there with a friend a while back and we were watching a family prepare some deep fried fish. Our mouths must have been watering, so they invited - insisted - we share with them. It was one of my best experiences.

The beach is quite nice...smooth water, great for kids. There's sand and rocks and of course there are wild swings in the tide. 

It's a great change from Miami - I mean Sandy - Beach.

581808993.name: Quick Trip
581808993.author: a TripAdvisor user
581808993.reviewBody: I stayed at Cholla bay for a quick trip with my friend and her family. It was nice and quiet in the area. The beach is rocky, but when it\u2019s low tide, there is plenty of sandy beach. When it\u2019s high tide, there isn\u2019t much room and everyone seems to go around the same time. There is an access road to the beach to park, but there is not a lot of room and I saw people parking all crazy! The waves were calmer in the bay than other parts we saw along the trip. It might be hard to navigate to where you are going if you\u2019re not familiar with the roads. It\u2019s sandy and dusty when you drive, but it\u2019s not terrible. Must see beach!

580708177.name: Worth the drive
580708177.author: a TripAdvisor user
580708177.reviewBody: A short drive from where we stayed. Eclectic houses. Fun bar with seating on terraces with sea view. Found a great little oyster house--will come back there for a full meal.

577452568.name: JJ\'s Cantina
577452568.author: a TripAdvisor user
577452568.reviewBody: Not impressed.  I ordered a pina colada which came in a plastic 10 oz cup. My daughter had been there at a previous trip and talked it up, but we both left with the mind set of "been there, done that".  Because we had a toddler with us, we couldn\'t sit in the bar area and outside tables are concrete with concrete seats.  No one came out to see if we wanted further drinks...you go it on the way in, and go back if you want more.  I won\'t visit there again with so many available bars & restaurants over in Malecon.  JJ\'s is a very out-of-the-way spot and in my opinion not worth the trip.

574992976.name: Disappointing
574992976.author: a TripAdvisor user
574992976.reviewBody: All dirt road and quite dusty everywhere. The beach is hard to get access to. Some nice houses here but they need to pave or gravel the roads.

570013176.name: Pretty Desolate
570013176.author: a TripAdvisor user
570013176.reviewBody: This is an area a short ways north of town. It is definitely an adventure. Make sure to stop by JJ\'s Cantina. Tasty food and beach access.

565182489.name: Visited it as part of a tour.
565182489.author: a TripAdvisor user
565182489.reviewBody: Worth driving to Cholla Bay, if you are not staying there.    Beautiful.     It has condos, private houses, resort type resorts.....\n\n

560815515.name: Has Really Grown
560815515.author: a TripAdvisor user
560815515.reviewBody: Hadn\u2019t been there for about 4 years..... there are several new homes. But I noticed very few new businesses. Our friends are kinda looking for a vacation home, but to haul water and have to travel into Puerto Penasco for any variety in shopping.... wouldn\u2019t be the best circumstances. JJs was still goin strong!!!

560656191.name: Very Cool and Different Soy in a Puerto Penasco
560656191.author: a TripAdvisor user
560656191.reviewBody: I loved the artsy houses here. It\'s a very small community- much different than the rest of Puerto Penasco. Two restaurants- one bar. Amazing views. It\'s far away from the rest of town but quite charming in its own way. It\'s quiet here and I omaha one people watch out for each other here. I liked it. It\'s worth the trip out here. They say you haven\'t been to Puerto Penasco if you haven\'t been to JJ\'s ( the bar) \ud83d\ude0a

557148041.name: Make a Tour
557148041.author: a TripAdvisor user
557148041.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is at the end of the road but worth a scenic tour.  Many expats have houses here that for the most part sit empty.  There is a bar for a cold beer and snack.  Watch the fishermen put there boats in and out and observe the catch.

555289844.name: Laid back, funky, US getaway
555289844.author: a TripAdvisor user
555289844.reviewBody: Cholla Bay has always been a "modest" place, favored by folks looking for a quiet but very reasonable place close to the US.  It is sort of like a suburb of Rocky Point.  It used to be a very inexpensive place to get a little place, but it is getting "gentrified" in spots and the prices have risen.  \n   The nature is amazing and the birding can be exceptional -- especially when there are very low tides (several days a month).  Audubon groups come here from Tucson and Phoenix to study the mudflats and low tide nature and birds which can never be found in the US.  When there are extreme low tides it is a wonderland of coastline nature.  \n   The sand dunes around Cholla Bay are a favorite place for 4 wheel and off road vehicles and the hill rides are thrilling.

555151539.name: Dusty town
555151539.author: a TripAdvisor user
555151539.reviewBody: We drove out from Rocky Point. It\u2019s a bit of a drive on a hard packed road. There is a checkpoint but no problem. The town is a dusty mix of nice and not so nice houses. There were a few businesses but not much open. Couldn\u2019t see any beach access. Don\u2019t see the draw.

544262824.name: Cholla Bay is Great if You Live There
544262824.author: a TripAdvisor user
544262824.reviewBody: Other than JJ\'s Cantina there isn\'t a ton to do or see in Cholla Bay.  Yes there are beautiful views, but there are great views everywhere and you don\'t have to drive down a long dirt road to see them. \n\nIf I was going to choose a place to live in Rocky Point, I would however choose Cholla Bay.  It seems like a great little community and I would love to be a part of it.

507598232.name: Pretty area
507598232.author: a TripAdvisor user
507598232.reviewBody: Pretty area. Small. In the middle of the little town. Not too many cars can really park here, but enough room to move around. Nice beaches, not much to beach comb here but still worth a stroll.

506926064.name: Old town Penasco
506926064.author: a TripAdvisor user
506926064.reviewBody: Well it is the first enclave of homes built that started Penasco, the homes are old and look run down but what\'s inside can wow you and surely be opposite as well. While looking for a home here we ran the gambit of looking at homes here at Sandy beach and Los Conchos. All have thier charm but Cholla bay was just to old and run down for us to enjoy it.

495535169.name: Dissapointing bay-combing
495535169.author: a TripAdvisor user
495535169.reviewBody: We visited Cholla Bay ahout 7pm during a low tide. I timed it to make sure it was a low tide, specifically in an attempt to see as much sea life as possible. Unfortunately, we didn\'t see much; tons of snails, hermit crabs and soft shell crabs. I read you can find sand dollars, star fish, baby octopus and conch. However, its best to go the morning of a full moon. Next time we visit, I plan on planning accordingly.\nOverall it was an enjoyable experience for us and our boys (ages 6 and 10). \nWEAR shoes! The mud is gross. There are MILLIONS of snails, glass on the shore and super sharp coral and rocks.

493385449.name: Great beaches
493385449.author: a TripAdvisor user
493385449.reviewBody: We go all the time, we live here in penasco.  Its so beautiful.  Always nice i just wish people would clean up after themselves

488795753.name: Great place to visit
488795753.author: a TripAdvisor user
488795753.reviewBody: Great place to go and relax.  The weather is great and many places to go and eat.  There are numerous choices to stay and relax it will be tough to make up your mind.

482797393.name: Popular but not my cup of tea
482797393.author: a TripAdvisor user
482797393.reviewBody: Popular for gringos, especially on weekends as I understand. Just not my cup of tea. Nicer beaches, better restaurants elsewhere.

471226215.name: Wish we\'d kept my grandfather\'s fishing cabin!
471226215.author: a TripAdvisor user
471226215.reviewBody: Xochitl\'s is a hidden gem of a restaurant.  JJ\'s patio is a great place to watch the fishermen bring in their catch of the day.

469202093.name: Spring break 2017
469202093.author: a TripAdvisor user
469202093.reviewBody:
A nice town near rocky point.  But no restaurants or services
 Beach is nice but the real feature is the tides. Looks like they go out a mile
Nice Catholic Church in the town. 
Road is mostly dirt. But easy to access from sandy beach in rocky point
Great place to watch sun set

463254614.name: Hard to swim
463254614.author: a TripAdvisor user
463254614.reviewBody: If you\'re planning on swimming and what not, this is not it. So many rocks make it hard for young children to walk and enjoy. The name is Las conchas though, meaning the sea shells. Definitely fun to just chill by the beach though, tan and relax!

457892904.name: Its a little run down with some good homes and many dumps.
457892904.author: a TripAdvisor user
457892904.reviewBody: Caught somewhere between 67\' hippies, margaritaville, and regular homes.  We live further south west.  Much nicer.

455733983.name: Quiet Little Beachtown
455733983.author: a TripAdvisor user
455733983.reviewBody: If you drive past the beach condos and keep on going you will reach Cholla Bay.  This is a really small beach town and mostly occupied by private beach homes.  There is only a few bars and restaurants which is good and NO hawkers or vendors which is heaven.  There is only a few ways to reach the beach but you will see the entrance as you drive on the main road.  There is a really good Seafood restaurant called the Oyster House owned which serves good seafood dishes at reasonable prices.  The price is expensive for Mexico standards but worth for a splurge.

453319065.name: Beautiful beach
453319065.author: a TripAdvisor user
453319065.reviewBody: We arrived when the tide was extremely low so there were many hidden tide pools full of animals and colorful shells to explore. We rented a 4x4 at the marina and headed to cholla for a wonderful afternoon of fun. Lots of locals and tourists alike. Huge beach so there is plenty of room and sand for everyone. Don\'t miss the fresh shrimp tacos...yum!\n

449518297.name: JJ Cantina is a place you can\'t pass up.
449518297.author: a TripAdvisor user
449518297.reviewBody: I\'m not a super fan of Cholla Bay. It\'s not a place I would get into the water. JJs however has delicious simple Mexican fare at great prices in a fun atmosphere. We make a stop here on a every visit to Puerto Penasco. The Mexican blankets and things are less expensive here than on sandy beach also.

448104423.name: Wonderful Get Away in the Unspoiled Beauty of Cholla Bay
448104423.author: a TripAdvisor user
448104423.reviewBody: Drove out here after reading Tripadvisor. This is our very first visit to Puerto Penasco so wanted to check out all the place has to offer. This is a charming, understated fishing village....loved the simpleness of the environment. Saw dauphins feeding near the shore with large groups of pelicans. Sat at the Oyster Bar chatting with locals and enjoying the Oysters of Puerto Penasco. Lovely few hours. Do not be intimidated by the dirt road!!! Go

447491657.name: Not a beach destination
447491657.author: a TripAdvisor user
447491657.reviewBody: We drove this area looking for a nice beach and didn\'t find one.  We did find hard access areas and lots of rocks.  check your tide chart before going but if you\'re looking for a beach this may not be the palace for you.

446934760.name: Beautiful
446934760.author: a TripAdvisor user
446934760.reviewBody: We drove out and walked on the beach very quiet and had the beach to ourselves. Beautiful little community. If you want to get away from the busy beaches this would be the spot.

439183789.name: Beautiful place
439183789.author: a TripAdvisor user
439183789.reviewBody: This place is a must visit and absolutely stunning and beautiful like a walk back in time. Very clean and many cool houses along the shore and stunning views. Climbed the small mountain along the shores and you get an incredible view.

437397618.name: Off the beaten path.
437397618.author: a TripAdvisor user
437397618.reviewBody: Get away from the condos and take a stroll through small town/village.  Walk the bay when the tide is down.  Stop for breakfast , lunch or just a drink.

425403564.name: Traci
425403564.author: a TripAdvisor user
425403564.reviewBody: JJ\'s was lots of fun. People were so nice. The drinks and food were so good. Grest view of bay. \nBoys had a great time kayaking in the bay.

424368753.name: Way out there!
424368753.author: a TripAdvisor user
424368753.reviewBody: Once you get past the Sandy Beach hotels, it is all sand road.  Right now it is under development and there are a few small stores and restaurants, but is mainly residential with some nice homes.  Kind of isolated at this point for amenities, but if you are looking for solitude, this would be it.

420548320.name: Beautiful Beach
420548320.author: a TripAdvisor user
420548320.reviewBody: This area of the beach is less rocky and Beautiful. The water is shallow many feet out. The water is salty great for healing and comforting to my achy bones. We enjoy eating at the places near here like JJ\'s and Changos. An awesome beach bum spot.

418006954.name: sun bathers delight
418006954.author: a TripAdvisor user
418006954.reviewBody: where else can you enjoy the sun in such a awesome setting soothing and comfortable almost to good the bomb

416307816.name: Great beach
416307816.author: a TripAdvisor user
416307816.reviewBody: We live coed the beach, the water was super clean and the right temperature. There was tons of venders, to get your taco and drinks. Be aware of broken glasses. There are millions of them.

414735377.name: Calm waves, rocky shores, fun day!
414735377.author: a TripAdvisor user
414735377.reviewBody: If you keep driving from the resorts down the long dirt road, you get to the little area of Cholla Bay. It\'s beautiful in the sunrise and sunset, and the area is always bursting with life and energy. I came with my husband and we spent a few hours at the Tucson Beach, and it was so much fun playing in the waves and building castles in the sand. We went early morning and not many people were out, perfect for lying around. The rocks are a little sharp to walk on down the way, but the entire cove is nice to go walk around. If you want the picturesque sand beach, blue sky, big waves, you\'ll need to go to the Sandy Beach around Wrecked at the Reef. JJ\'s is also a great place right in the area, with cheap drinks compared to inland. The food is good, but small portions, so order large if you love eating like me!

414321094.name: long bumpy sand road to get here, but beautifil bay view
414321094.author: a TripAdvisor user
414321094.reviewBody: home to the infamous JJs cantina, you\'ll also get the best bay views. very built up now though so you need to go south of the main town to get to the beach. if you can time it right, one of the best times to go is low tide. if it\'s really low you can nearly walk across the bay. really cool.

410613567.name: An old school fishing community that has kept the old world charm!
410613567.author: a TripAdvisor user
410613567.reviewBody: Fortunate enough to visit often from Arizona! Great little area with friendly fun loving people. Local businesses for food and drinks make the a must stop while in Puerto Penasco! Recommend JJ\'s Cantina for drinks and fun as well as Xochitlas for breakfast or lunch! Try scottscondo.com  if your looking for a place to stay while in Cholla Bay?

409773163.name: Beautiful
409773163.author: a TripAdvisor user
409773163.reviewBody: This was by far one of the best things of our trip loved the scenery and how quit it was. We visited pe\u00f1asco in a busy weekend and the time we spent in cholla was just the best.

394046342.name: What a peaceful place
394046342.author: a TripAdvisor user
394046342.reviewBody: My husband and I wanted to find a new area to run on one of our days at Rocky Point.  We drove out to Cholla Bay and ran the beach.  It ended up being a bit hard to run because of the rockiness of the beach but we hopped and jumped and played on the rocks and then went up to the road to get some milage.  I really liked this area because it was not crowed and the waves were very low.  There is not as much actual lay out a towel beach area but I think that is what keeps it from being too crowded.  A nice area to check out.

390113324.name: Beautiful area, worth checking out.
390113324.author: a TripAdvisor user
390113324.reviewBody: We had rented quads and were riding them out on the peninsula and decided to check out Cholla Bay. The town itself is nice and quaint, with many pretty little houses throughout.  The bays and the view were beautiful, it is definitely worth checking out.

389545219.name: Nice beach
389545219.author: a TripAdvisor user
389545219.reviewBody: Although it was a little rocky, we had a glorious swim and mini snorkeling expedition. We saw sergeant major and a few other fish. Very enjoyable.

384656077.name: Worth Exploring
384656077.author: a TripAdvisor user
384656077.reviewBody: Our other plans changed so we decided to explore La Cholla. It has curving sandy streets with some driveways that take you down to the beach. After Sandy Beach this wasn\'t impressive, but it was a nice place to check out. The tide was out so a huge expanse of the bay was open - so not as picturesque as the location had been described.

383566781.name: Just wanted to see the area
383566781.author: a TripAdvisor user
383566781.reviewBody: Beautiful doesn\'t make it.  I could live here!\nOnly one paved street but most of the area has made a great comeback. Obviously, a contractor or two went belly up during construction, but most of the homes are great.

383310113.name: Great Ex-pat community
383310113.author: a TripAdvisor user
383310113.reviewBody: Worth a look- and if you go and don\'t stop in at JJ\'s for a drink, a meal, and the stunning view you are missing something!

382521595.name: Beautiful sunset
382521595.author: a TripAdvisor user
382521595.reviewBody: Went out to Cholla Bay for dinner and was able to sit on the rocks and watch the sunset.  It was glorious.  Not quite "Zadar most beautiful sunset in the world" beautiful, but close.

381950703.name: JJ Catina
381950703.author: a TripAdvisor user
381950703.reviewBody: You can\'t go to Cholla without stopping a JJ\'s.  Now they are spelling Cholla Choya  They have tacos and burritos and drinks.

376551694.name: Visit to Cholla Bay
376551694.author: a TripAdvisor user
376551694.reviewBody: The beach is great, mostly dunes and motorcyle and dune buggie  people visit.  Drove through the residential area, lots and lots of houses for sale, not interested but interesting to see them all.

375637332.name: Great beach but dirty
375637332.author: a TripAdvisor user
375637332.reviewBody: This a great bay. Close to everything but far from everything else. The locals seem to maintain it. Such a shame tourism is going to be its downfall. Grocery bags, wrappers and beer cans can be seen at a distance.

372809528.name: Great area of Puerto Penasco
372809528.author: a TripAdvisor user
372809528.reviewBody: Off the beaten path and worth the trip out there. Have a few drinks at JJ\'s, eat some oystrers and crab cakes at the Oyster House, go for a ride on a jet ski, or enjoy a sunset. We\'re actually looking into properties here for ourselves...

368492165.name: Felt like an adventure to drive out to Cholla Bay
368492165.author: a TripAdvisor user
368492165.reviewBody:
Cholla Bay is at the end of a dirt road from the Sandy Beach area of Puerto Penasco. The drive out was fun in our family sedan being passed by all sorts of vehicles including ATVs. Since it's mostly sand it would be a ball to rent on and drive around the area. We didn't.

The road is smooth and easy to follow due to some raised sand on the edges. The dusty dirt road winds into town and it was a real kick to stop at the only stop sign found in town and its right in front of the police station. We stopped. 

The town is old and doesn't look prosperous, but the road leads you to JJ's bar with is a good watering hole with an excellent view of the bay. The tide was almost at high  tide so we missed seeing it a low tide. We'll go back another day to experience that. 

The town is really funky and JJ's is cool. We didn't do much while there, but the experience brought a smile to our faces.

367034977.name: Absolutely gorgeous
367034977.author: a TripAdvisor user
367034977.reviewBody: It\'s a hidden gem run Rocky point floors we took the four wheeler in there we had a great time there\'s a little restaurant in there that\'s really good

364737859.name: Great for Shell Hunting
364737859.author: a TripAdvisor user
364737859.reviewBody:
A recipe for a perfect afternoon:

1. drive out to JJs Cantina in Cholla Bay in the afternoon
2. Have a few cold drinks, and a couple tacos
3. Watch the tide go waaaaay out
4. Walk out into the bay and experience some world class shell hunting
5. Go back to JJs for more drinks and tacos

You're Welcome! :)

363310424.name: Went Clamming at Cholla Bay
363310424.author: a TripAdvisor user
363310424.reviewBody: We went out to Cholla Bay at a very low tide to go clamming and we spent about 3 hours with 3 of us raking clams. We ended up with almost a 5 gallon bucket of delicious steamer clams. It was definitely worth the effort, we picked up some jumbo shrimp in the old port and had a seafood feast!

361840507.name: Unusual community
361840507.author: a TripAdvisor user
361840507.reviewBody: This is a long-standing community on a small peninsula with a large shallow bay that sees big tide fluctuations at times.  At low tide you can walk out and collect clams, sand-dollars, and other interesting things.  Xochitil\'s and Chunga\'s restaurants serve great food, JJ\'s Cantina is a popular "watering hole",  Rentals are avilable throughout the community.

360897294.name: Vacation
360897294.author: a TripAdvisor user
360897294.reviewBody: Joe Lopez nice little area that\'s just north  of Puerto Penasco well worth the drive over there it\'s a nice place if you want to get a house to stay a lot of the houses are on the beach there someone that Bayside and then there\'s some on the ocean side I would recommend the Oceanside for staying there is a nice Overlook middle Mountain Hill whatever you want to call it the drug addicts and doing that is very Rocky at the top you can take a four wheeler up there and then walk the last couple hundred feet to the very top and enjoy the Fantastic view from there

359656453.name: Safe place to come
359656453.author: a TripAdvisor user
359656453.reviewBody: I have been coming to Cholla Bay for forty years. I have seen all the changes and encountered different levels of safety issues in travel over the years. Currently I have to say it is probably the safest it has ever been to travel and live. We moved down about 2 months ago and really enjoy it. Once you know where you are going you can find all the things you need to live a comfortable, relaxed life style.\nIf you want to live like an American maybe stay in the States. But if you want to enjoy the people and the simpler life then live like you belong here and accept the lifestyle your life will be relaxed and enjoyable.

358186023.name: Old Mexico
358186023.author: a TripAdvisor user
358186023.reviewBody: We drove out to Cholla bay on a dune buggy. The ride was not very long ( maybe 6 miles) and was a great experience with much of the road unpaved.  Once we got there we immediately went to JJ\'s Cantina for some cold beers. We sat and talked with some locals about the extreme tides. They told us a story about a guy parking his car near the bay at low tide, and then going boating. When he came back his truck was floating as the tide had come up so far. He was not very happy but it was quite amusing for people sitting at the bar (although he was quick to say that they had tried to save the truck but it was totally locked). \nThe taco stand to the left of JJ\'s has the most unbelievable shrimp tacos for a $1.50. \nThis was well worth the trip especially if you\'re into exploring.

358025225.name: Where did the water go ???
358025225.author: a TripAdvisor user
358025225.reviewBody:
Took the buggy out there.

The road is ragged so hang on tight.

When we got there it was low tide.

Cholla Bay has the second most extreme tide swings in the world.

Great time and place to collect Sand Dollars.

357089505.name: Dusty Roads but Quiet & Peaceful (mostly)
357089505.author: a TripAdvisor user
357089505.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is northwest of the touristy part of Rocky Point where all of the big resorts are located. The pavement stops and the road is sandy/dusty. There are a few restaurants and bars in Cholla Bay. We enjoyed lunch at Mr. Fish Taco on the main road. Every so often someone would blast by on an ATV and dust us out, but other than that, I enjoyed the area. The beach has more rocks and is a tidal flat.

355418813.name: A Particular Lifestyle
355418813.author: a TripAdvisor user
355418813.reviewBody: Best is you know someone there or are a fan of JJ\'s Cantina (a real local destination). A small community with maintains it\'s fishing village roots.

355323982.name: Quaint
355323982.author: a TripAdvisor user
355323982.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is a quiet little town just past Sandy Beach. It\'s a quirky area with very old shack like homes, as well as amazing, huge, beautiful mansions. It\'s almost all dirt roads and easier to navigate on a quad than a car! It\'s definitely worth checking out!!!

354452819.name: Great for bird watching
354452819.author: a TripAdvisor user
354452819.reviewBody: We enjoyed going to JJ\'s bar where the margaritas were only $3 and the people watching was pretty interesting as well.

353977510.name: Cholla Bay
353977510.author: a TripAdvisor user
353977510.reviewBody: Can\'t get enough of Cholla Bay. Watching the tide, listening to the waves perfect for peace of mind. Been coming to "the Bay" since 1982. Never enough.

351728226.name: An Added bonus to the Puerto Penasco Visit
351728226.author: a TripAdvisor user
351728226.reviewBody: Definitnely worth the drive out, the beach is amazing, the tide can be intimidating, it comes and goes really fast.  Birds are great on the tidal basin.  Great little restaurant for lunch and breakfast

351183587.name: I really need a Beach break !!!!
351183587.author: a TripAdvisor user
351183587.reviewBody: A really good friend could see i needed a break and suggested Cholla Bay Mexico ! No traffic , a beach vacation , with a quiet and secure beach house ! I packed our car and set out with a friend for a week of rest and relaxation . Amazing , when we arrived the cabana looked very simple , we opened the gate walked around the house and that sunset was definitely painted by Angeles ! We entered the casa and found this place had everything for the perfect getaway . First to our right a full kitchen micro wave , toaster oven , fridge , and more . Next in a greatroom style layout the with the living room , bar, and 2 queen size beds . left to the bed room 2 more queen beds dresser , and all in all casual but done but very Mexico ! We opened the windows and you could hear the ocean waves , the patio is right on the beach , The night could not have been better ( i thought ) ? We brought food , and grilled on the patio looking at the ocean , the moon was full ,the fish were jumping WOW just too perfect . From there it just got better , saturday we rented horses and took a ride on the beach about 5min drive from our location , from this house in 5min you can rent Quads,atv , fishing trips , night clubs , cafe\', watch sealions , grey whales and much much more . But at the house QUITE !!!

350926677.name: great times
350926677.author: a TripAdvisor user
350926677.reviewBody: great spot to meet great people great sunsets beach is beautiful,  always room for fun family  a must go!!!

350576663.name: Great little town
350576663.author: a TripAdvisor user
