350576663.reviewBody: We came out here last weekend to cruise around town and it is a really nice area. You can stop at JJ\'s and watch the fisherman bring back there catch of the day

345297479.name: Nice little community
345297479.author: a TripAdvisor user
345297479.reviewBody: Was surprised at the cute little community Cholla Bay is.  There is a park for kids, grocery, bars.  You can drive on the beach and there are sand dunes to climb with your jeep or 4 wheeler.  Nice little drive outside of town.

343886175.name: Wild beach
343886175.author: a TripAdvisor user
343886175.reviewBody: This beach is very large, the locals use to come here to have fun, its a really justbeach, actually, there are not amenities and it\u00b4s more for  real beach lovers and suntan lovers. Quiet and safe.

339177191.name: Must see
339177191.author: a TripAdvisor user
339177191.reviewBody: A charming small village that is a must.. Fun to drive atv to, which can be rented in rocky point. Eat at Jjs resturant ,.. A locals place ..fun

336690256.name: Great place to kayak or swim
336690256.author: a TripAdvisor user
336690256.reviewBody: Beach was vacant except for some fishermen. Waters are more calm than on the open beach. Water was chilly but swim-able in Dec. Not much in town for eating or activities. Stick to the beach.

335218583.name: The only thing you have to fear is fear itself.
335218583.author: a TripAdvisor user
335218583.reviewBody: For the last 15 years I\'ve been traveling to Puerto Penasco, Mexico (some call it Rocky Point) and just about every time someone says to me, "Oh, no, you\'re not going to Mexico, are you?" Just 62 miles across the border this town of 25,000 offers beautiful beaches, good restaurants and friendly natives and tourists. It is Phoenix\' and Tuscon\'s beach, just 4 hours from each. ANY place in the world you must have your wits about you. For example, I don\'t drive in the desert at night. There is probably more Cartel activity in Chicago, Atlanta and Phoenix. So, don\'t be afraid....just go.

334239619.name: Nothing much there
334239619.author: a TripAdvisor user
334239619.reviewBody: Maybe there is more activity in the summer in Cholla  Bay but during the winter it is dead.  Cholla  Bay reminds us of what Penasco was like in the 80\'s & 90\'s.  The only reason we had to go there was boredom and to go to JJ\'s.

333119132.name: Well we saw it
333119132.author: a TripAdvisor user
333119132.reviewBody: Took the drive to Chilla Bay. I guess if you are looking for a place to buy property then you would like it. But except for JJ\'s Bar there isn\'t much to do. The beer was cold.

328919590.name: Wonderful beach for a family visit
328919590.author: a TripAdvisor user
328919590.reviewBody: We spent a long weekend at a vacation rental and the kids had a great time.  The beach was not too busy and so the kids got a chance to play in the sand and the water.  As the tide went out, everyone got the chance to go shell hunting and a huge area of beach opened up due to the shallow beach sloping for a few hundred feet.

320694681.name: Back in time
320694681.author: a TripAdvisor user
320694681.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is a lovely community, set apart from the hustle and bustle of modern life. Dirt roads wind through the town where brightly colored homes overlook the water. It is a beach haven for Americans, many of whom have been going there for decades. \nIt is a great place to go shelling but please remember to be respectful of the residents who have chosen to live there because the area is so calm and tranquil

318986312.name: Fun place to collect shellfish and seashells during low tide...
318986312.author: a TripAdvisor user
318986312.reviewBody: This a fun place to go during low tide as it goes out for at least a mile.  During that time, all of the invertebrate sea life that\'s in the sand, digs down to stay until the tide comes back in.  At this time you can take a shovel and a bucket and collect clams and other "shellfish" and also seashells.  and when you\'re tired and thirsty, stop in at JJ\'s Cantina and have a cold one or two.  And buy a t-shirt.  All in all a good time.

307657002.name: Cholla Bay - Mexico time
307657002.author: a TripAdvisor user
307657002.reviewBody: We have had a home here for 60 years. Love it!  It\'s part of our lives and we crave it when we have not been here for a while.

304186815.name: Relaxing, beautiful, real Mexico
304186815.author: a TripAdvisor user
304186815.reviewBody: Beautiful, rustic, quiet and unique.  Walk out to the middle of the bay at low tide, you\'re miles from shore but still standing in 6 inch deep water (shuffle your feet!).  Pick up sand dollars, then head in to JJ\'s for a beer.  Great trip every time

297350413.name: Have a great time in Cholla Bay
297350413.author: a TripAdvisor user
297350413.reviewBody: Great place to kayak and swim. Tide goes out considerably so be aware of that. This is also where you can rent amazing homes for a good rate. It is away from town a bit but very peaceful. You can always walk to JJ\'s for a good time.

291747202.name: Unique, Spiritual, Quiet, Special...
291747202.author: a TripAdvisor user
291747202.reviewBody:
Cholla Bay (the residential area of Rocky Point) is so unique.  
It doesn't have all the glitz and lights and activity of Rocky Point which is a welcomed retreat at the end of the day.
Offering the 2nd largest Estuary in the world, it is so fun to see the water as it ebbs and flows throughout the day.  Exploring the sea floor while the tide is low is amazing while the beautiful color when the tide is high is indescribable. 
Sally's restaurant has a wonderful breakfast along with a "local" feel.
JJ's Bar has homemade lemonade with great stadium-like seating outside that overlooks the sea.
Riding ATV's along the coast you will see beautiful lava rock formations along with dolphins, seals and gulls.  So surreal!  
The only "real" B and B in the region is located on Cholla Bay--Mrduljas de Familia Bed & Breakfast.  Truly unlike any you will EVER stay at.  Amazing!!
I would definitely recommend Cholla Bay for the adventure, the rest and relaxation...the experience.

290804925.name: Small Locals beach and town area
290804925.author: a TripAdvisor user
290804925.reviewBody: Beautiful and charming little place.  Had cute little bed and breakfast places.  Small little stores and a nice mix of local and seasonal type homes.  Wonderful small little beach area that was much more local and not so tourist.  Beautiful homes that will have you planning your retirement home plans :)

290481245.name: skip this one
290481245.author: a TripAdvisor user
290481245.reviewBody: Cholla Bay has lost any appeal from the glory days, in this traveler\'s opinion. very dirty even by area standards.

290124281.name: Great Place to Buy Property...
290124281.author: a TripAdvisor user
290124281.reviewBody: Cruise liner port under construction...airport...Beach...Nice Restaurants...Close to Phoenix..Homes for Sales under $200/SF..

286809733.name: La Cholla Bay
286809733.author: a TripAdvisor user
286809733.reviewBody: La Cholla Bay is a beautiful small town with great beach. Right next to JJ\'s cantina is a small beach area where the waves are super calm and the ocean is great. \n\nAwesome you have to go there is you to to Rocky Point

285564313.name: Memorial Day week
285564313.author: a TripAdvisor user
285564313.reviewBody: Love Cholla Bay... It\'s not far from Sandy Beach... There\'s JJ cantina where you can sit outside and have a gorgeous view of the bay... There\'s a tiny taco stand next to JJ\'s with the Best Tacos and ceviche... Don\'t forget to stop there!!

284475460.name: At the top of the Sea of Cortez
284475460.author: a TripAdvisor user
284475460.reviewBody: I love Rocky Point. We come out here often for concerts, mainly Roger Clyne and the Peace Makers, which always includes at least one trip out to Cholla Bay and JJ\'s Cantina. In June of 2015 I finally got to float around in Cholla Bay and listen to the bands play at JJ\'s. Keep in mind that Rocky Point is called that for a reason, lots of rocks in Cholla Bay around Rocky Point so tread lightly.

284458934.name: Just inside the mexican  border  about 75 miles in , great beach front experience
284458934.author: a TripAdvisor user
284458934.reviewBody: Oh I just love Puerto Penasco ( Rocky Point) Mexico.  We\'ve gone on several trips here as \'girls\' trips and just loved it each time.  Renting a waterfront condo , stop by the local super market and load up on food and drink. then just kick back and relax. We love the wide tidal swings and beach walking.  Warm waters and plenty of uncrowded beaches.

282753193.name: Redneck Riviera with All Dirt Roads
282753193.author: a TripAdvisor user
282753193.reviewBody: Cholla Bay "village" is at the end of the Sandy Beach Peninsula. It is a long drive on a dirt road to get to the village. Once there, you see alot of run down and abandoned bldgs with junk in the yards. Except for a few nice homes on the water, all the rest is very disappointing. The real estate is cheaper here for a reason. There is a boat launch and one very small beach. Most of the oceanside lots are cliff like over the water without easy access below. All dirt roads with clouds of dust when anyone passes you makes for an unpleasant experience. We would never stay there when the posh resorts of Sandy Beach are only a few minutes away.

281383296.name: Mostly American Ex Patriots and houses.  Dirty and Gritty but if you have a place here, the beach and surf are great.
281383296.author: a TripAdvisor user
281383296.reviewBody: The place is all beach houses that are only occupied by about 3 months out of the year.  There are TONS of rentals here.  The streets are dirt, but things like ATV, or Buggy or water sports are basically ALL expected here.  There are few rules and you can do pretty much what you want with few rules.  Enjoy the Freedom.

274984116.name: Sand dollar heaven
274984116.author: a TripAdvisor user
274984116.reviewBody: So many sand dollars and great beach combing ! Walked out 2 1/2 miles while tide was out. Awesome !!!

273456272.name: Nice little drive \'out of town\'
273456272.author: a TripAdvisor user
273456272.reviewBody: For the most part we only visit Cholla for JJ\'s but we also cruise around and just take a look at the little bay.  It\'s quiet and out of the way but worth taking a look at.

272251123.name: Fun to Visit.
272251123.author: a TripAdvisor user
272251123.reviewBody: If you have a vehicle check out Cholla Bay, the road to it is hard sand, dusty, dirty & bumpy but not a problem in our Subaru.  The bay itself is an experience because of the extreme tide (especially at New/Full Moon) and all kinds of sea treasures are to be found.  The town is also a fun experience, there\'s "JJ\'s Cantina" a nice watering hole with a great patio & view of the bay.  Take the time to drive around and see all of the Casa\'s, Casita\'s and ???.  This is a nice little seaside community & worth the visit.

270436081.name: Fun area
270436081.author: a TripAdvisor user
270436081.reviewBody: Had a fun time looking for shells at low tide.  The tides down here really are pretty radical.  We looked in vain during lowest tide for sand dollars, but they eluded us.  Fun area to check out.

267139364.name: Definitely worth visiting!
267139364.author: a TripAdvisor user
267139364.reviewBody: I wish we would have found this place earlier in the day.  We had a great time looking for shells and even found an angry blue crab.  We\'re not big swimmers but love just exploring. We did have to ask a local how to get to it.

265527699.name: fishing on the rocks
265527699.author: a TripAdvisor user
265527699.reviewBody: Cholla Bay town looked like it was mostly vacation homes set in a dust bowl on the ocean.  We found a public area near the water and had a 10 minute walk over some treacherous rocks to get to a fishing place.  You have to watch it if the tide is coming in or you can get stuck and not be able to get back.  Did catch a couple fish.

260647782.name: Nothing To Write Home About
260647782.author: a TripAdvisor user
260647782.reviewBody: 50 years ago this place was dusty dirty backwater refuge for low cost dwellers seeking beachfront property. Now there are more of the same not making it any better.

258314716.name: maybe biased, but Cholla is amazing
258314716.author: a TripAdvisor user
258314716.reviewBody: So  I am biased, As I have a house here. The gentleman who referred to it as a "redneck riviera" has zero clue what he is talking about. zero. Yes there are some houses that are not used and not upgraded, however more then not are or are in the process. And the ones that are done would be very expensive in the United States. As for what to do around cholla, well jj\'s is a good choice for drinks, Tucson Beach if you want to swim and relax, and Mr Fish Taco for food. As many mentioned shelling is great at low tide, and snorkeling is pretty decent around Pelican point and also on the Sea of Cortez side of Cholla. Plenty to do, very quiet at night, which is a great thing. Cholla is everything that is good about Rocky Point in general. Great people, great activities and just a good vibe.

257452178.name: Cool place to rent a house
257452178.author: a TripAdvisor user
257452178.reviewBody: Kind of a community of expats on their own on the other side of the big sand dunes.  Only negative is there is a big tide which means no water to swim in for 1/2 the day.

256554625.name: Stop at JJ\'s for a beer
256554625.author: a TripAdvisor user
256554625.reviewBody: It is somewhat typical of Mexico, however the tide change is impressive!  Great place to bring a rake and collect some clams at low tide

256191018.name: Redneck Riviera
256191018.author: a TripAdvisor user
256191018.reviewBody: This community has a few nice houses but overall it is run down with trailers and cheap houses. Dirt roads everywhere so lots of dust. It also is a bit of a drive from downtown. Best thing to do in the area is go to JJ\'s cafe which has alot of the action in the area.

254987497.name: nice excursion for a couple of hours
254987497.author: a TripAdvisor user
254987497.reviewBody: This is a quaint fishing village north of Peurto Penaso, and we toured here for something to see.  You will travel a gravel, dusty road to village.  there is a small Cantina, (JJ\'s worth the stop).   An eclectic bounty of homes, Small to a  and VERY Large Castle built into the rocks.   Bought 50 Lbs of Shimp here for the Cheapest price ever!  Right behind the Cantina.   Vacation homes for rent on the Sea of Cortez.  there is a B & B here.  the Tide goes out and leaves a very very Rocky beach area..  Worth the drive to visit, but I would have a hard time staying here for a vacation.

247597698.name: Funky neighbourhood
247597698.author: a TripAdvisor user
247597698.reviewBody: Drove around and saw some pretty funky houses. Right on the ocean with beautiful views. All dirt roads (in good condition) so be careful if you have a car rental.

244824334.name: Cholla Bay slow paced area
244824334.author: a TripAdvisor user
244824334.reviewBody:
We have visited Cholla Bay while RV camping at the Reef.
Great little community with a few restaurants that are reasonably priced for breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as drinks.
Great views and if you like to clam this is the place to go during low tide on the mud flats.
Great medium sized clams for the taking. 
Worth a visit.

244276316.name: Must see at low tide...
244276316.author: a TripAdvisor user
244276316.reviewBody: Nice, peaceful back-water beach where at low tide you can go collect clams.  The site is pretty awesome at low tide as it goes out for a mile or more.  And there\'s a nice little bar in town, too.  Fun afternoon.

243089107.name: best homes
243089107.author: a TripAdvisor user
243089107.reviewBody: If I moved to Puerto Penasco, this is where I would choose to love. Long sandy beaches, terrific ocean views and still close to town. Just wish the road was paved, good thing it seldom rains in Rocky Point!

234195888.name: Good stretch of sea front views in Puerto Penasco
234195888.author: a TripAdvisor user
234195888.reviewBody:
I have been coming down here for 24 years and hope to come for at least the next 24.

My first visit was to Cholla Bay so I am a bit biased.

The area has developed and has way too many gringos for my taste but you can get away from them when you go a bit up or down the coast.

Cholla Bay is not in the middle of the action so is a good place to enjoy your afternoon and a great sunset.

The road is a bit bumpy but just drive slower.

228014529.name: JJ\'s Cantina
228014529.author: a TripAdvisor user
228014529.reviewBody: Great place to have a drink.. Very inexpensive ( margarita 3 usd) food was delicious. Sit outside to watch the local fishermen and people watch

227911870.name: Cholla Bay
227911870.author: a TripAdvisor user
227911870.reviewBody: find JJ\'s place.. right on the beach.. food and drink available.  Not a big selection but I have only been there during the day.\nBehind JJ\'s at low tide you can walk out about 1/2 mile and search for Sand Dollars.  Large conch type shells too, most broken but fun to find.. Bring a bucket for your treasures..

226764848.name: My Happy Place
226764848.author: a TripAdvisor user
226764848.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is hands down, my favorite place to soak up the sun in Mexico. The bay is lovely, no huge waves, no sand in your bathing suit, not too many tourists. It is a great little town, perfect for a relaxing get away. While you are there go visit JJ\'s Cantina and get some cheap-good quality food, and cheap margaritas!!

226177441.name: Friendly Community
226177441.author: a TripAdvisor user
226177441.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is a great friendly community.  The perfect beach town.  Chunga\'s and Xochi\'s are great places to eat.  JJ\'s is a great place to get together with friends and enjoy the bay.

220369567.name: Isolated and quiet
220369567.author: a TripAdvisor user
220369567.reviewBody: This place has a long drive.\nDirt roads no pavement, we couldn\'t find access to the beach, we were planning to relax, play and to try to find some sand dollars, no luck. The only good thing was the welcome sign with the seahorse. This place is perfect for people that want to stay far away from civilization.

216308520.name: Smooth seas as far as the eye can see
216308520.author: a TripAdvisor user
216308520.reviewBody:
If you like beachcombing, go to Cholla Bay at low tide. Lots of clams and octopus to be had by the eager and/or skilled digger/fisher. Found many sand dollars, sea stars, conch shells, etc.

Swimming is also great, since the water is incredibly calm and shallow for a long way out. Warm water just like all of Puerto Penasco, maybe even warmer than some areas.

Not necessarily easy to get to since you have to drive through town to find the main public beach access, but worth the drive.

213364199.name: cholla bay seashells
213364199.author: a TripAdvisor user
213364199.reviewBody: i love cholla bay, its like a standstill community and very friendly. water all around. i go there each time to get sand dollars and other seashells. and stop at jj\'s for a bite or drink. its all dirt roads but its safe sort of like indiana beaches in the 1940s. there are all kinds of homes up to over 1 million dollars. have fun and get sand in  your shoes.

210856798.name: Meh
210856798.author: a TripAdvisor user
210856798.reviewBody: JJ\'s is the best part of this area.  It\'s been around forever and has a really cool outdoor area with views of the bay.  The rest of the town is not for me.  It\'s rustic and hasn\'t changed since my family first visited in the early 1980\'s.  I love the town of Puerto Penasco, I love Sandy Beach area, I love the little neighborhoods around the town, but Cholla Bay feels like a ghost town.  The little store is pretty overpriced (which makes sense since the nearest Oxxo is about 25 minutes away). The houses do not have city sewer or water, but everywhere else you stay does.  The houses are supposedly occupied,but it looks like some of them haven\'t been stayed in for years. Basically, we are not campers.  If we are going to spend $100 plus per night on lodging for vacation, I want a/c, a washing machine for our bathing suits, toilets we can flush (without having to say if its yellow, let it mellow, etc), a shower or bath tub I can use for as long as I want, etc.  I don\'t feel those things have anything to do with being an "ugly American", rather being smart and wanting certain things for our hard earned dollar and being on vacation.  To us it is a nice place to visit, but we wouldn\'t want to stay there.

209652649.name: Let your hair down !
209652649.author: a TripAdvisor user
209652649.reviewBody: Long before I visited Cholla I had heard the rumblings about this get away ! I was a military brat traveling all over, Taiwan , Korea, Japan, Brazil ,well you get it !, So when I found a place 3.5 hours away , with an ocean, beach camping, fishing, quads, sand rails, sailing, dancing and the worlds most beautiful sun sets,  WOW ! I\'m all over it ! Take some friends or make some ones , if you can\'t have fun and make memories here , you have issues !

204609126.name: Some people just don\'t get it...
204609126.author: a TripAdvisor user
204609126.reviewBody: In reading these reviews about Cholla Bay and Rocky Point, it is clear that a select few tourists just don\'t get it.  Sadly, the \'ignorant, ugly American\' is alive and well.  They seem to fail to remember that this is MEXICO, a 2nd or 3rd world country...Not South Beach, Florida, or Huntington Beach, CA with Hard Rock Cafes or the like.  I\'ve lived overseas, and I am constantly amazed that some Americans put every foreign destination through their ignorant American \'filter\', and are always disappointed/complaining...It\'s like trying to put a square peg into a round whole - It never fits. Cholla Bay is rustic...That\'s a huge part of its charm.  I have been traveling to this area for 40 years, and no one in the area seems to want it to be Cancun. It is supposed to be sleepy & relaxing!  Yes, many things are closed mid-week, BECAUSE that is their \'weekend\'.  They are intentionally open Sat & Sun to profit while the tourists are in town. One reviewer wrote that they got sick on the food.  Strange...I\'ve never got sick on the food in over 40 years. So, in closing, to all those who complain about this area, perhaps you should plan a trip to the Ritz Carlton next time...In the USA.

198839987.name: Cholla Bay
198839987.author: a TripAdvisor user
198839987.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Cholla Bay 5 times now since 2001. It\'s not for those looking for a crazy drunken weekend. it\'s for those who want to relax and enjoy doing nothing. reading, eating, hanging out on the beach or patio overlooking the water, clam digging, kayaking, fish tacos, sleeping in the sun. Enjoying family and leaving your cel phone and the internet in your other pants. That\'s why you go. To Truly relax. I love Xochitle\'s. they have great food and an upper patio with a view of the water. JJ\'s is cool for your small town bar interests with bands and drinks. People have been coming here with their families for generations. And of course if you\'re interested in a couples true getaway I\'d recommend this place. It\'s so removed and quiet.

196769715.name: Needs Help
196769715.author: a TripAdvisor user
196769715.reviewBody: Cholla Bay might be a great place to look for sand dollars, but other than that, not to much there.   Things seemed to be closed when we were there mid-week.   Maybe more to do on the weekend.

195939638.name: Quaint and colorful
195939638.author: a TripAdvisor user
195939638.reviewBody: We just did a drive by, but the area was so cute, with typically abandoned buildings that are unfinished to gorgeous little houses.  The bay is lovely and a sight to see.

190639563.name: A ghost town in January
190639563.author: a TripAdvisor user
190639563.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking on the beach.  We stopped at JJ\'s and almost deserted as was the whole town.  I know this is the off season, but it was a little creepy.

181752585.name: Really a nice fishermans village!!!!
181752585.author: a TripAdvisor user
181752585.reviewBody: Nice and old town, quiet, friendly people and out of the way of the busy town. Easy to get there... you can easily go fishing, plenty of fish all over!! We enjoyed the beach, nice walk....

180958160.name: the best place to get sand dollars at low tide
180958160.author: a TripAdvisor user
180958160.reviewBody: my favorite place to collect seashells and sand dollars for necklace making. it is beautiful, easy to walk on, and go when the tide is low, check the tide charts, go at the lowest spot, you will see crabs, baby octopus both digging in and out of the sand.

180740126.name: Not for everyone; A mecca for yahoos at times
180740126.author: a TripAdvisor user
180740126.reviewBody:
My first visit here was in 1966 and actually little has changed.  La vida loca!  Perched precariously alongside a rocky hill at the water's edge, Cholla Bay was once a rugged outback for pioneering Americans who didn't mind living in a remote and dusty dirt-bike colony off on bumpy roads and 10 miles from town.  Although "La Choya" now has electricity and TV, many still live off the grid.  Stores and services are very few out here and I recommend you gas up before coming.  The best route is from Downtown Rocky Point along Hotel Row and onto wide  "dirt expressways" starting near The Reef club.

You will have to be quite tolerant of ATVs and other off-road get-ups going to and from La Choya although most drive safely.  Things can get out of hand during Spring Break or other holiday periods when a less-desirable "yahoo" kind of tourist or visitor seems to take over.  Nevertheless, try to make your way to an historic "Arizona Institution", JJ's Cantina, the center of social life here.  The view from JJ's waterfront terrace is worth a stop but you should catch Trip Advisor's reviews of JJ's to learn about his food and drink options.  

Bottom line: The variety of housing types and the twists and turns of local "catwalk" streets are fascinating and represent the choices people here live with for the sake of remoteness and a sense of relative freedom from the stresses of la vida loca.  However, its not for everyone and unless you are with locals or veteran tourists, I recommend you should skip going here.

179722204.name: Cholla Bay
179722204.author: a TripAdvisor user
179722204.reviewBody: Great beach, very tranquil area, set up your gear beachside and go for a swim, if you have atvs, this is a great area to hang out.

165806909.name: I still love this place
165806909.author: a TripAdvisor user
165806909.reviewBody: I like going to JJs first just before sunset. Then wade in the bay at low tide. A totally peaceful experience. After JJs that is:)

165114583.name: Great View
165114583.author: a TripAdvisor user
165114583.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is great. The view across the water is beautiful. Water is clear and you can go down from JJ\'s Cantina and swim if you want to. Boats dock there and you can see their catch.

164959209.name: Excelent place, Warm Water
164959209.author: a TripAdvisor user
164959209.reviewBody: the water is more high in temperature, calm and warm. I love this place, No waves. the difference between this place or the open sea is about 10 grades\n

163118222.name: Tucson\'s Beach
163118222.author: a TripAdvisor user
163118222.reviewBody: We are from Tucson, and so the nearest beach for us is in Puerto Penasco, Mexico (4 hours away). If you rent a house in Cholla Bay go there expecting to relax and have a laid back time. We love to spend the morning walking out with the tide looking for crabs! We head home, have breakfast and lay in the sun for a bit. Before you know it the Tide is up and you can go for a swim or have fun with some water sports. If you like bring or rent a quad because there are hills and paths all over the place that are sure to be a fun ride. We usually buy beer and drink on the beach but you can go to JJ\'s Cantina or Wrecked at the Reef if you are looking for a bar (both are great with beautiful views). If you visit Wrecked at the Reef head down to the beach there and take a look at the rocks. I love to hang out there and just check out all of the rocks and shells that roll in when the tide is out. We like to grab some steaks and shrimp in town and cook them on the grill for dinner (if you want message me and I can find out where we get the steaks because they are always delicious). Watch the sunset, and by then you will be really tired and we usually call it a night. Perfect getaway for us :)

162354315.name: Cholla Bay, Rocky Point
162354315.author: a TripAdvisor user
162354315.reviewBody: Long time traveler of Rocky Point. After reading these reviews I wanted to add my comments. \nPeople - this is MEXICO! That is what makes it so special. Cholla Bay is a BAY and basically a mud pit at low tide; however, that is also  the best time and place to find sand dollars. True, you can look and look and not find any, but then all of a sudden you see one, then there is another one, and another one. Before you know it you are trying to figure out how to get 100 sand dollars back to your car. And also true different times of year produce different results. We have had our best luck in October, water still warm and weather cooling down. We found 153 sand dollars between the 2 of us - No kidding. Also, our dog has the best time there  running around and finding "critters" to play with. \nOf course, after a day of searching for treasures you head straight to JJ\'s for a refreshment.

162293629.name: Tourist trap
162293629.author: a TripAdvisor user
162293629.reviewBody: Beach was nice and the tide went way out in the early morning, found nice shells and sea creatures. Gross display of wealth driving through very poor areas to where the condo\'s are. Vendors downtown charge more for things than you would pay for them in the USA. Looked for colorful dresses from Mexico and found they were made in India and they wanted 3 X\'s what I pay for the same thing at Ross. The cheapest place to buy from vendors was by a cantina called JJ\'s. we got there as the tide was coming in and the folks were trying to get off the beach before the water took over.They sell shrimp, red snapper and grouper down by the docks but only had shrimp and scallops when we got there. was told by the salesman to watch them filet our fish if we found some as they would try to sell us shark instead. had to drive through armed federalizes entering and exiting, they speak no English and just keep repeating themselves. they searched a car in front of us. went through 3 border patrols upon leaving the country. not at all interested in going back. we got very sick on the food the last day of our trip and took a couple days to get back right.

160997760.name: It\'s my second home
160997760.author: a TripAdvisor user
160997760.reviewBody: It\'s our home away from home.  It\'s like a quaint village - on the ocean.  The water in the bay is calm, which our dogs love.  We spend high tide weekends in the water with many friends.   And we can always drive to Sandy Beach if we want to play in the waves.  Plus we can walk to JJ\u2019s Cantina for a drink or our fave places to eat (Mr Fish Taco, Chunga\u2019s, Xochil\u2019s).  The perfect place to get away and relax!

157653583.name: Not much to see here
157653583.author: a TripAdvisor user
157653583.reviewBody:
Not much to see here...

Little village with some decent houses surrounded by ghetto old houses... 

We rode motorcycle around the sandy roads and did not really find anything of noteworthy mention...

155261837.name: So many changes
155261837.author: a TripAdvisor user
155261837.reviewBody: I remember when I was a kid this was an open beach and it was one of the funnest places to scuba dive, now there are so many buildings up against the coast that you have to really look for that entrance to the beach and fight for parking. The beach sucks when it is low tide.

154303896.name: THE WORST!
154303896.author: a TripAdvisor user
154303896.reviewBody: There is NOTHING at Cholla Bay.  We got lost looking for it and when we found it, there was no access to the beach.  We attempted to visit their CHOLLA MALL and it was ridiculously pricey and its an outdoor, 2 _4 blocks of little shops.

151633511.name: sleepy little drinking town with a fishing problem
151633511.author: a TripAdvisor user
151633511.reviewBody: quaint little village go to jj\'s tavern  to hang with the locals, walk the flats, go fishing. other than that Not much to see or do here

147791261.name: Cholla Bay, JJ\'s, Xochtitl\'s, Chungas
147791261.author: a TripAdvisor user
147791261.reviewBody:
Very good food and great quaint village. 
Xochtily's noted for tortilla soup 
Chungas noted for the California omelot 
JJ's great drinks and tostadas

145831919.name: Reminiscent of a abandoned ghetto
145831919.author: a TripAdvisor user
145831919.reviewBody: Cholla Bay never was a \'great\' place to visit, but it did have a bit of charm due to not having water nor electricity for many years.  As for entertainment, JJ\'s Cantina was an okay dive bar for a while.   Things have certainly gone downhill in my book.  The town seems to be a magnet for \'Junk\'.   Old broken down cars, boats, and all assorted crap, litters most of the area and the beaches are covered in trash, most of which has probably blown out of peoples yards.   I have been to Mexico many, many times, both in and out of tourist areas, seaside and inland, and most of the time have found pride even in the poorest of neighborhoods, but not here.  There was a horseshoe game going on with approximately 20 people playing in a very downtrodden park, but there was no other sign of life in the entire place.  The only business open (Saturday) was JJ\'s, of which there were two employees evident, but NO customers.  I wonder why?

143549235.name: la cholla bay
143549235.author: a TripAdvisor user
143549235.reviewBody: Cholla Bay nice place to visit with the family.\nJJ\'S Cantina a must..If your in Cholla Bay in Oct. go to the Holloween Party they are the BOMB!!

141581664.name: Pretty bay, shallow water to play in
141581664.author: a TripAdvisor user
141581664.reviewBody: Took our 3 pups there to splash around in the bay. Could not find anything in town open on a Tuesday and no visible public beach access in town. Parked just outside town in a large sandy area with direct access to the water. That part of the bay is very shallow and a great place for kids and dogs to splash around, as long as you are aware that some people throw empty beer bottles in the bay.

134323004.name: Cholla Bay Trashed
134323004.author: a TripAdvisor user
134323004.reviewBody: We visited Cholla Bay on June 25, 2012 and parked our car at Tucson Beach - sadly the beach was trashed, garbage drums overflowed, used diapers, soiled toilet paper and human waste were strewn along the beach. Huge disappointed that such a beautiful place is essentially raped by humanity.

133855289.name: Party At JJ\'s Cantina
133855289.author: a TripAdvisor user
133855289.reviewBody: The only place 2 party in Cholla Bay,( $20.00 cab ride from\nRocky Point ), is JJ\'s Cantina..........Hands Down !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

131224951.name: Go to JJ\'s when in Cholla
131224951.author: a TripAdvisor user
131224951.reviewBody: Hands down the best and maybe only bar in Cholla Bay.  Been going to this bar for years and years.  Great tiered patio out back.  Good place to drink beers and watch the tide go in and out.

130880306.name: home
130880306.author: a TripAdvisor user
130880306.reviewBody: We made it our perm. home 11 yrs. ago and are very happy with our Sea of Cortez view, great neighbors and the overall atmosphere of the people and area.

130303956.name: What is the big deal about Cholla Bay?
130303956.author: a TripAdvisor user
130303956.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is a densely packed with houses and not much else.There are a few bars and restaurants are there. I think I would skip it all together next time I travel to Rocky Point.

129452606.name: A "must see" in Rocky Point
129452606.author: a TripAdvisor user
129452606.reviewBody:
Stay on the road that goes past the resorts. It turns into a sand road, but it is well maintained and even if you are driving a mini-van you'll be just fine. Go straight past "Wrecked at the Reef" (a very nice bar / restaurant that until recently was a real dive) and stay on the road into town. There is a security check point as you enter, but they will just wave at you as you pass through.

If you're hungry stop at Xochitl's (pronounced "so-cheese") and enjoy the best chili rellenos on the planet. If you are thirsty or if you just want to get a t-shirt stop by JJ's Cantina. Both are on the main road as you enter Cholla Bay!

When you leave, be sure to stop at Wrecked at the Reef for more drinks and cool t-shirts.

128526840.name: authentic
128526840.author: a TripAdvisor user
128526840.reviewBody: more authentic and less touristic than old town Penasco - great sand dollar hunting and clamming when tide is out - very shallow shelf margin when tide is in so save for kids to play in the water - town has reasonably priced and SAFE restaurants

55417006.name: Absolutely worth the drive
55417006.author: a TripAdvisor user
55417006.reviewBody: This is a most unique village with a mixture of the very wealthy and the very poor.

15133015.name: Wow! Amazing community!
15133015.author: a TripAdvisor user
15133015.reviewBody: Cholla Bay is north of Sandy Beach and encompasses a colony of high-end seaside colorful cottages.  These homes are side by side and full of charm.  Take a ride up here if you have time.  It\'s worth the drive.

672297566.name: Quite interesting
672297566.author: a TripAdvisor user
672297566.reviewBody: Nice display; informative ; great family/kid place\nWhen I went they were only open on Friday... hope that they expand their hours!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

650089070.name: Every Shell You\'ve Wondered About
650089070.author: a TripAdvisor user
650089070.reviewBody: Naomi Black has put many hours and much effort into making this extensive shell museum come alive. All shells are labeled and provide information about them. It\'s only open on Fridays but Naomi is always there to answer any questions you might have. A great place for field trips or to take that weird shell you discovered and find out what it is.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

636657114.name: Lovely, educational, easy to find!
636657114.author: a TripAdvisor user
636657114.reviewBody:
After hearing about the Seashell Museum from friends while on Thanksgiving holiday, we heard it was only open on Fridays but worth the visit if we could make it.
My seven-year-old daughter and I really enjoyed learning about marine life specific to the sea of Cortez. Learning about the life cycle through the digital microscope imaging (for lack of a better term) was exciting for my daughter. Naomi was a very pleasant guide and we enjoyed some trinkets from her shop as well. My older children would have loved it, since we have collected so many different shells from many of the areas around Rocky Point. We bought her seashell poster and put it on our craft room wall, and have already been referring to it this week. Thank you Naomi!

By the way, what did you say that tiny orange worm may have been that I told you about? I believe it caused a rash on my left hand that has tiny blisters and feels like shards of glass in my fingertips, only in my left hand which would make sense since I was holding my camera with my right hand on Thursday night during the low tide when we were out there with flashlights. I’ve been reading about different ribbon worms, fire worms and possibly even baby jellyfish?

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

594690321.name: Shellebrate Pe\u00f1asco and the Sea Of Cortez!
594690321.author: a TripAdvisor user
594690321.reviewBody:
Being a resident of Penasco I spend quality time at the seashore seeking seashells!

And now I know the names of them!

And I can see how other artists cleverly use them too!

Naomi and Russ have created a wonderful space to learn more about the jewels of the sand and sea.  A worthy visit for all ages.  They deserve a huge "thank you" for devoted the time and resources for others enjoyment and education.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

587699722.name: Seeshell Museum pe\u00f1asco
587699722.author: a TripAdvisor user
587699722.reviewBody: We follow the GPS address to ramon figueroa and ended knocking in a house and a kid got mad because we knoced thinking it was the museum\nIt is not the right address

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

586068586.name: Worth visiting
586068586.author: a TripAdvisor user
586068586.reviewBody: The host of this museum is very nice and admission is free. Its in a neighborhood but the sign on the building is very clear, google maps will take you to it. It\u2019s a nice little museum and one of the few things to do other than the beach and restaurants here \ud83d\ude0a

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

581051595.name: Shellabrate....
581051595.author: a TripAdvisor user
581051595.reviewBody: The SeaShell Museum in Rocky Point, MX is a MUST see whether you are just visiting or a resident.  Naomi Black has poured her soul, her love of seashells and the fascinating world under the sea in to her SeaShell Museum.  It\'s fun, educational and fascinating.  The shells are beautifully displayed, along with a framed tide walkers guide and continuous running videos of the shell creators.  You can also purchase unique items made with shells in the adjacent Sea Debris Gift Shop.  Don\'t miss this experience - I guarantee you will discover something you never knew - up close and personal.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

581040125.name: Naomi really knows her SH****! (shells)
581040125.author: a TripAdvisor user
581040125.reviewBody: Great, Informative tour of some of the coolest shells anywhere! There are shells from almost every part of the globe, but mostly around Penasco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ramon Figueroa 375 1/2 block west of Constitucion on Ramon Figueroa.

674213345.name: Best Place to Shop in Puerto
674213345.author: a TripAdvisor user
674213345.reviewBody: If you want to shop while in Puerto Penasco, forget the Old Port. You won\'t find a better selection of treasures and fun experience any where else. The "mall" extends along both sides of the street for about 4 blocks. Lots of variety and several good restaurants to be enjoyed. Ask for the price, then offer 25% less--it is expected. We ended up with lots of shell wind chimes, hand blown glassware and gifts for the ones back home. There is lots of free parking all along the street. Safe and clean and fun, what could be better than that!

664524770.name: Variety of shopping options
664524770.author: a TripAdvisor user
664524770.reviewBody: We found great Talavera pieces at Temo\'s Talavera in a huge shop full of talavera along Cholla Mall (Rodeo Drive).  Really just a street with shops on both sides.  Nice cotton clothing at Plaza Fabiola.  If you get hungry for lunch, eat at Mariachis and Tequila.  Typical touristy souvenirs, but also some great finds if you look.

661197196.name: Authentic shopping experience
661197196.author: a TripAdvisor user
661197196.reviewBody: Beautiful selection of Mexican decorations and recuerdos. Local shell shops had an outstanding artistic quality! Bought several gifts there.

659952959.name: Rodeo Drive, Cholla Mall or Dirt Mall no matter what you call it the shopping is great.
659952959.author: a TripAdvisor user
659952959.reviewBody: We stop here every time we go down to Puerto Penasco.  Talavera pottery, woven tablecloths, planters, shells etc.  However the Plaza Fabiola is the highlight for me.  It\u2019s the largest selection of cotton gauze clothing for women and men.  I\u2019ve purchased at least 4-5 items here.  They wear well, do not shrink and styles are always fresh & new.  Cute jewelry & home decorations also. As a plus, there\u2019s a bench & newspapers for spouses to wait & entertain themselves.  They take credit cards.  All items marked in US $.

650537363.name: No Bargain at all!!!
650537363.author: a TripAdvisor user
650537363.reviewBody: Shops here refuse to bargain as tourists end up handing over the money without trying to bargain.... Comparing this to any market in India this place is a ripoff. Its basically any over priced tourist place.

636081404.name: Slower pace and a great margarita
636081404.author: a TripAdvisor user
636081404.reviewBody: Living here, I prefer to Cholla  mall or \u201c Rodeo Drive\u201d as we call it, to the Fish Market area.   You can find anyhing you need from wood carvings, to beautiful blown glass plates.  Su Casa, and Fabiolas carry high end clothing and gift items.  My husband loves to sit and enjoy a good margarita from Tequila and Marachi\u2019s while I shop for bargins.  The vendors are friendly and parking is so much easier then downtown.  There are great items that the kids can afford as well as fine art for the adults.

631230727.name: Enjoyed the feel of Old World Mexico
631230727.author: a TripAdvisor user
631230727.reviewBody: Great shops.  Even better eating.  Even better adult drinks. The casual pace of the main street was enjoyable.

624132117.name: Preferred over Old Port shopping
624132117.author: a TripAdvisor user
624132117.reviewBody: I prefer this shopping location over Old Port. The shops are nicer and have a better selection of things. It\'s also known as Rodeo Drive. We splurged and picked out some margarita glasses. The options!!!! There were so many choices.

622005412.name: Shopping yay!
622005412.author: a TripAdvisor user
622005412.reviewBody: Just wanted to let people know- if you are looking for alebrije, go to Temo\u2019s Televara and Plaza Fabiola. You will find them there

617707437.name: Fun place to shop!
617707437.author: a TripAdvisor user
617707437.reviewBody: First of all, I hate shopping!  This "mall" has enough variety to keep me interested.  You can find everything from the goofy trinkets that you would expect to real home furnishings etc here.  Prices are reasonable and the shop owners are thorough and personable!

617492198.name: Shopping Rodeo Drive in Feb. 2018
617492198.author: a TripAdvisor user
617492198.reviewBody: We found great shopping here, and especially with locally hand crafted items. Good prices, too. We\'ll stop by the next time we\'re down there.

598639629.name: Less Pushy
598639629.author: a TripAdvisor user
598639629.reviewBody: These shops were less pushy than the shops down on the Malecon/Old Port.  Prices were also better than buying items from vendors at the beach.  Cleaner and cooler shopping as well.  A little hard to find, but worth going here instead of the Malecon for shopping.

589830924.name: Much better than old por
589830924.author: a TripAdvisor user
589830924.reviewBody: Not as pushy better selections and friendlier vibe.  The pottery was amazing, Bought several outside decorations and Mariachis right in the middle for great food.  Love it

568559835.name: Back again for house decorations
568559835.author: a TripAdvisor user
568559835.reviewBody: Been awhile since we had been to the mall, as these shops on two sides of the street are called.  Mother in law wanted decorative ceramic tiles for a backsplash and a ceramic mirror and she found both here.  The Malecon is more for trinkets and shirts where this place had more substantive housewares and art and decorations.  You still get the chance to negotiate and dig for a bargain.  Never accept the initial price.

547755698.name: Sergio\'s for silver jewelry
547755698.author: a TripAdvisor user
547755698.reviewBody: Sergio\'s has a huge selection of both silver plated and sterling silver jewelry.  If you are looking for the cheapest, he will direct you to the plated, if you want quality, he will tell you price for weight and then weigh the item for you.  Seems like the best we could find for selection and pricing in Puerto Penasco.

535221757.name: Better than your typical Mexican curio shops
535221757.author: a TripAdvisor user
535221757.reviewBody: We travel frequently to many places in Mexico and usually bypass areas like this but something told us this seemed a little different and we should check it out. Glad we did. It\u2019s just a few blocks on both sides of the street but the shops are neat and clean; the shop keepers friendly but not overbearing. You\u2019ll find lots of very typical tourist stuff but there was also nice artwork, locally made pottery, and other fun finds. Definitely check out a store called Su Casa. Owners are very nice and helpful.

512034774.name: A little pricey
512034774.author: a TripAdvisor user
512034774.reviewBody: The map location is incorrect on the Trip Advisor app.  Use Google to find it.  Had a great variety but found alot of the prices really high even after negotiating them down.  Low pressure and very friendly people there.

507594197.name: Beyond Average
507594197.author: a TripAdvisor user
507594197.reviewBody: Beyond average place. Nothing really unique here. Cheap made items that break within a few days if used. Ideal for random trinkets and tourist souvenirs.

476148153.name: Loved it!
476148153.author: a TripAdvisor user
476148153.reviewBody: The stores are super cute, the owners are not as pushy as other places in Mexico..very fair prices...many nice things..lots of places to eat and have great drinks at!

452557215.name: Great Stores
452557215.author: a TripAdvisor user
452557215.reviewBody: My wife and I are regular visitors to Cholla Mall. They have something for everyone. Whether you want a t-shirt or high fashion clothing, interior design or furniture, crafts or metal works it\'s all there.

442611485.name: Some good shopping here
442611485.author: a TripAdvisor user
442611485.reviewBody: Most of the stores on "Cholla Mall" have the same items found in Old Port. However, there are a couple of stores with really nice handicrafts. Su Casa and Plaza Fabiola, right next to each other.

423360661.name: Great shopping
423360661.author: a TripAdvisor user
423360661.reviewBody: This is more upscale than the vendors in town. Great handcrafted items. Go all the way in to the stores or you will miss some beautiful finds.

409123302.name: From "Cardboard Mall" to Rodeo Drive"
409123302.author: a TripAdvisor user
409123302.reviewBody: The name and esthetics have greatly changed over the years but the shopping has always been amazing! Nana the shell lady to custom handmade leather sandals it\'s one stop shopping. PLEASE haggle! It\'s part of the experience.

397095460.name: A fun afternoon of shopping!
397095460.author: a TripAdvisor user
397095460.reviewBody: Great fun to wander in and out of the shops. Keep your eye out for lovely Mexican handmade crafts and talavera pottery. \nBargaining is expected... but don\'t be insulting. Offer a reasonable price and go from there. Settling on about 3/4 of the seller\'s original asking price is a good place to settle!

397069603.name: Keep of the sidewalk and just set inside and go all the way to the back...
397069603.author: a TripAdvisor user
397069603.reviewBody: This place is quite amazing, lots to see of Mexican hand made articles, people named the "curios" do not know why... maybe because as you walk you become "curious" about what you see. Any way, talk to the people selling there, ask them where they come from and ask thm if they speak a different language or dialect, you will get thirlled, in this Quarter Mile Street you will find so many different dialects and people from south of Mexico that will make this shopping experience a cultural trip.

390862294.name: Cool Fun shops and it will get better
390862294.author: a TripAdvisor user
390862294.reviewBody: Built for 2017 cruise ship stop it has plenty of shopping and bonus is many unique items. \nPlans are to continue with improvements as they prepare

378135618.name: Great shopping
378135618.author: a TripAdvisor user
378135618.reviewBody: Love the stores here...there are some special and unique finds here. Prices are a bit better than the Malecon.

375930135.name: More shopping options
375930135.author: a TripAdvisor user
375930135.reviewBody: In preparation for the planned cruise ship terminal (2017...?), this shopping mall has been built to handle the anticipated traffic.  Most of the locally produced goods that you find in the Old Port section are here, but spread along a wide street with plenty of parking. Restaurants have not yet followed but probably will.  A nice alternative if you don\'t enjoy the often crowded waterfront.

368557032.name: Best shopping area!
368557032.author: a TripAdvisor user
368557032.reviewBody: The visit to Cholla Mall was fun with plenty of shops of all kinds. My friend and I felt very safe..the people are friendly. I found some very nice original art work which I didn\'t see in any other shops and we did plenty of shopping.  One of the shops had some really good quality cotton clothes not as inexpensive as I thought they would be but again this was quality clothing .....none of the merchants were in your face pushy following you down the street trying to get you to buy things...yes that happens...Make sure to visit you will enjoy the variety ...not your typical shopping place.  By the way, the streets are now paved.  Enjoy!!!

368488826.name: Much more enjoyable shopping than at Old Port
368488826.author: a TripAdvisor user
368488826.reviewBody:
People who own property there and want to decorate it with Mexican arts and crafts go there for their shopping. It's one street about 1/2 mile long with stores selling everything  from cheap trinkets to upscale art, vases, wall decorations, etc. It is also known as Rodeo Drive.

While there is some hustling going on as you walk by a shop it is nowhere as aggressive and frequent as in Old Town. It is a much better shopping experience. Plus, some of the stores have very good products. We stopped there several times while in Puerto Penasco.

As usual, your car will be washed whether you want it or not. A tip: Raise your window wipers and they will leave you alone

363059808.name: Good place to shop
363059808.author: a TripAdvisor user
363059808.reviewBody: This area is a good place to shop.  There are numerous shops with a good variety of items.  You should be able to find what you are looking for.  Less pushy than the shops on the waterfront.  My favorites are Consuelo\'s Arts and Crafts, and Su Casa.

360250663.name: Great shopping!
360250663.author: a TripAdvisor user
360250663.reviewBody: Cholla Mall, what we called "Rodeo Drive" 20 years ago has become more charming and colorful over the years. The Mall is several blocks long. Easy parking (and free) along the main road. Some shops are filled with Mexican curio including endless objects of Oaxacan art and clothing, Telavara dishes, souvenir clothing, pottery, pewter, iron works, sea shells and so much more. Most little shops enjoy bartering. There are also numerous more upscale art galleries/interior decorating shops with truly unique works of art, well priced and very worth checking out.

355787880.name: A great shopping pleasure of Mexico
355787880.author: a TripAdvisor user
355787880.reviewBody: This street mall has just about any type of Mexican souvenir that you might want, all reasonable priced.  Fun to stroll down the quiet street and shop -

331005249.name: We always find fun things here!
331005249.author: a TripAdvisor user
331005249.reviewBody: We really like shopping here since the vendors aren\'t as aggressive and obnoxious as they are at Old Port.  We always find interesting and unique things in the shops here.

328918861.name: Great place for getting your souveniers
328918861.author: a TripAdvisor user
328918861.reviewBody: This street of shops is a great place to find your take home items, whether they are dishes, glasswork, art, shell creatures, hats, etc.  This area is certainly more laid back that the Malecon area as others have mentioned.  You get less pressure and more room to move around.   During the day, it is safe to walk around even with kids.  It is not full of restaurants, which could be a pro or con, depending on what you want.

282976337.name: A must do while here
282976337.author: a TripAdvisor user
282976337.reviewBody: What is a trip to Puerto Penasco without a visit to Rodeo Drive?!?!  It is usually not crowded and store owners are very nice.

272249813.name: Best for Shopping.
272249813.author: a TripAdvisor user
272249813.reviewBody:
Stopped here on a Sunday on our way to Cholla Bay and it was quiet, peaceful and fun.  So much so that my husband was able to pull out one of our beach chairs & set it up in the shade of a closed-up building, sipping his beer while I traipsed up and down the streets thru all the shops.  We were able to park right on the street, midway near "Mariachi's & Tequila Bar & Grill" (the new & only Rest/Bar around).

The "Mall" is several blocks (on Cholla road) of various shops, from "Moma & Popa Stands" to "Artesan Galleries", each with it's own charm.  Everyone is friendly, attentive & helpful but not pushy.  You can find lots of metalwork, pottery, seashells creations, artwork, they have it all and the price is always negotiable. 

We found the whole experience more enjoyable than the Malecon (Old Port) as it was more laid back.

213362893.name: shopping on rodeo drive
213362893.author: a TripAdvisor user
213362893.reviewBody: my friends found their dishes, glasses, ART work, cards, PHOTOS of rocky point, PRINTS of mexican children, pewter, pottery, etc. etc.  on this street. don\'t forget to visit consuelo\'s art and crafts for all kinds of really neat items to use and take home to friends, also su casa and david\'s kopelli, there is also a pharmacy and there is always parking places. david of kopelli is opening a FOOD restaurant in october that will have snacks, dinner, etc. etc. it is a must stop and you can walk in the shade on either side of the street. then farther down is the brand new exciting rocky point convention center, and the road winds down to the sea of cortez and the new exciting sandy beach MEDICAL CENTER which has an ambulance and doctors. Remember there are places to park on the street. there are even beach toys for the sand or water.

199829021.name: Temo\'s Talavera for Beautiful Pottery and Home Decor!
199829021.author: a TripAdvisor user
199829021.reviewBody:
If you love collecting Mexican talavera pottery, this is the mother lode!  Anything from giant planters, planters shaped as rabbits, donkeys, frogs, pigs, trays, dishes, bowls, sinks, kitchen canisters, etc. are abundant in Artemio's shop - and he packs it up nicely for you in cardboard boxes.  

The Dirt Mall is also called Shack's Fifth Avenue, Rodeo Drive, or on the sign, it says "Curios" - is a great place to buy souvenirs from friendly people.  We also bought two metal cactus plant decorative pieces for our front yard from a lady at the end - she and her husband handmake the items right there.

I would rather shop here than the Malecon - they are not pushy…but it is on a dirt road, and there are no eateries nearby - so stop to shop, then head out elsewhere to eat.

197482158.name: You Must Go Here
197482158.author: a TripAdvisor user
197482158.reviewBody: We missed this on the first trip to Puerto Penasco but will not miss it again.  Unlike the other shopping area, this seemed to be much more laid back and the vendors let you look without hounding you so much.  It also had what appeared to be a greater selection of items.  The only downside was that there was not the eating areas like on the port side but we were there to shop and found a place to eat on the way back to the hotel.  For example we purchased a childs purse and it was made by the shop owner...you could watch her make the items toward the back of the store.

187361756.name: Su Casa on Rodeo Drive is a Must See
187361756.author: a TripAdvisor user
187361756.reviewBody: Just when you think you\'ve seen it all, a new shop appears that takes your breath away with a refreshing assortment of items with which to decorate and enhance your home with the unique Mexican touches that you love.  Su Casa offers a first class variety of choices at affordable prices.  You won\'t find the same old thing that every other store on Rodeo Drive features; you will be pleased with different items ranging in price to meet all needs.  In addition, Su Casa not only offers furniture for your condo or home, but will also custom make just about anything you might want to add that special touch.\n\nAs you window shop along Rodeo Drive, don\'t walk on by when you come to Su Casa; give yourself a treat and walk through the doors for a warm welcome and a feast for your eyes.  No salesperson to breathe down your neck; just a friendly greeting, and then you are free to browse to your heart\'s content.  Enjoy !

186089979.name: Cholla Mall Shopping
186089979.author: a TripAdvisor user
186089979.reviewBody: I made a wonderful discovery the last time I was down in "Rocky Point". There is a whole area that has been revitalized. Its called Cholla Mall or \'Rodeo Drive\'. It was full of fun shopping. My favorite was Su Casa. It had great gifts, wonderful \'stuff\' to decorate my home. The prices were all over the ballpark, so I was able to find something unique that fit my budget\u2026 but the greatest thing was that even the most expensive items were well worth the price. I plan on going back!

180752005.name: Check it out one time, then leave
180752005.author: a TripAdvisor user
180752005.reviewBody: Although the Trip Advisor locator map for Cholla Mall is hundreds of miles off (as are most of the Puerto Penasco attraction maps) this local "Rodeo Drive" tourist shopping center is very easy to find by turning west off Blvd. Benito Juarez (Hwy 8 into town) at the Avenida Revolucion traffic signal.  Formerly Cholla Mall was a "captive audience" situation as all ATV traffic going to Cholla Bay or to the dunes and back was funneled through here.  Business has dropped off in the last few years here but it should be improved in a couple weeks by completion of a new paved road that ties into Hotel Row better than in the past.  Parking is around back of the "storefronts" and the shops are best inspected on foot.  \n\nI recommend visiting Cholla Mall one time only, just to experience the dazzling merchandising effect it has.  Most of the vendors all sell the same thing and bartering is expected.  Frankly, the items sold are mostly low quality \'junque\' and are typical of souvenirs gullible tourists might buy.  Stores along Benito Juarez offer much better quality.  Bottom line: This is part of your Mexico experience so try it once and then leave.

165470867.name: No Tourists Around
165470867.author: a TripAdvisor user
165470867.reviewBody: Go here after Old Port and cut yourself a sweet deal as the day we went not one Gringo around. Free shots and low prices!

165090023.name: Shacks Fifth Avenue
165090023.author: a TripAdvisor user
165090023.reviewBody:
Each time we visit Puerto Peñasco, we always take a trip for fun to the Cholla Mall, affectionately known as Shacks Fifth Avenue, or Puerto Peñasco Rodeo Drive.  My first time there, I was reminded of many years ago visiting Olvera Street in Los Angeles as a boy. Though I feel much safer in Puerto than In LA...

There are a number of shops on both sides of Choya street, each with it's own feel.  Some very clean and upbeat, others very run down and dark.  But a wide variety of curios, clothing, souvenirs and typical Mexican fare.

More than one pottery store with beautiful works of art. Dresses, hats, ponchos, shoes, huaraches, belts...and the usual knick knacks touting a visitt tto Puerto Peñasco.

Prices are generally much better than down on the Malecón, but the shop keepers are still up for a quick bartering session. That's half the fun.  

We always park at the end of Choya near Luis Encinas and the Tecate convenience store.  A walk down one side of the street and back up the other, ending with a cold 50 cent bottled Mexican Coke at the Tecate.

162354995.name: "Almost Free!"
162354995.author: a TripAdvisor user
162354995.reviewBody: Over the many years we have traveled to Rocky Point, I always put this on my "must do" list. Remember, this is Mexico and I love to bargain. I have many trinkets to remind me of our multiple trips to Rocky Point, many of them came from here. Of course things are over priced, that is the fun of it. And if you cannot get the price you want - it will be at the next shop. Keep an open mind and if you really like it and got the price you can afford and willing to spend - Buy It! After all, you are on vacation!

130304730.name: A good place to shop!
130304730.author: a TripAdvisor user
130304730.reviewBody: I love the Cholla Mall. It is not a mall by any means. It is just a bunch of your typical Mexican curio shops on a street, but there are some great stores here. They have made some serious improvements to this area in the last decade, including awnings and a paved road. The prices here seem to be cheaper than by the fish market and the owners seem to be nicer.

120841556.name: Not really a mall
120841556.author: a TripAdvisor user
120841556.reviewBody: This is more of a street of shops.  About 1/3 are closed down.  Owners are nice and helpful.  Prices are more fixed than downtown, but more reasonable too.  Some great sculpture shops.  More limited selections than downtown.  Not too much to do here so why not stop by.

63068751.name: Visit JJ\'s on your way to the mall
63068751.author: a TripAdvisor user
63068751.reviewBody: While on your way to the mall you must stop in at JJ\'s for a bite to eat.  The view is fabulous and the hamburgers are great as well.

55417519.name: Don\'t miss this shopping stop
55417519.author: a TripAdvisor user
55417519.reviewBody: This is far better shopping than along the bay. Less hassle with the same goods for sale. Easy parking with various (30+ shops). Everyone  seems to speak English.

16657527.name: Good place to shop
16657527.author: a TripAdvisor user
16657527.reviewBody: I have visited the Cholla Mall many times in the last 15 years.  It has greatly improved during this time, and now has a paved street running through it.  It is much cleaner than 15 years ago, and there is a wide selection of merchadise.  I enjoy shopping there more than down by the port.  It is a great place to buy gifts from Puerto Penasco.  One thing I do not like in Cholla or down by the port is the filthy language and messages on t-shirts.  I like to take my young neices and nephews shopping, but it is getting worse each year.  I do not support the stores that carry these items.

4404576.name: neat place to poke around
4404576.author: a TripAdvisor user
4404576.reviewBody: February 2005 we were there. I liked it!  Some people call it The Rodeo Drive of Mexico, with tongue planted firmly in cheek!  It is quite a charming place, though.  The shopkeepers are friendly, the selection is good, language is not a problem and I think the prices were a bit better than on the Malecon.  Housewares, clothing, interesting garden ornaments, etc.  The place really hums when the tour busses pull in!\n

676844531.name: Healthy nightlife
676844531.author: a TripAdvisor user
676844531.reviewBody: We visited over Memorial weekend. The area was very busy with lots of people and vehicles. Everyone seemed to be having fun and they even had things for kids going on. Lots of shops and restaurants/bars. Street food looked good even though we didn\u2019t try any because we had already eaten. Very quiet during the day, more my style. That said, there\u2019s something there for everyone.

674210952.name: Old Port and Malecon
674210952.author: a TripAdvisor user
674210952.reviewBody: No first trip to Rocky Point would be complete without spending some time and money at the Old Port. The port is still used daily by the fishing boats. Several fish shops sell the daily catch of shrimp, squid, octopus and whole and filleted fish. Not as cheap as you would think. Keep in mind the price is per kilo. Lots of souvenir and Mexican goods shops dot the streets between the restaurants and "pharmacies". A polite "no" is all that is needed as it is customary for the vendors to call out and try to lure you inside.

669474746.name: Fun shopping spot
669474746.author: a TripAdvisor user
669474746.reviewBody: This is  fun shopping area. Not to big. Typical Mexican shops. People are very friendly. Parking gets tight. There is a nice parking are that is right next to the Malecon.

665128811.name: Beware of hawkers!
665128811.author: a TripAdvisor user
665128811.reviewBody: We did not enjoy walking around the Malecon.  Souvenir shops with very aggressive vendors. Will not be returning.

665081877.name: OLD PORT
665081877.author: a TripAdvisor user
665081877.reviewBody: This is the old part of town where the fish market is.  There is a bit going on at the malecon.  The rest is generally curios shops and restaurants. Not really other shopping. On the malecon, there are some vendors and some things going on.  But, you mainly go down there to eat or find souvenier trinkets.  Definitely worth a visit or three when you are at Rocky Point.

664580544.name: Tiny but great views
664580544.author: a TripAdvisor user
664580544.reviewBody: Tiny shopping, restaurant area adjacent to Malec\u00f3n.  Typical souvenir shops, MANY seafood restaurants.  Just go to Blue Marlin and across the street on the corner for Thrifty ice cream.

664569112.name: Souvenir hunting
664569112.author: a TripAdvisor user
664569112.reviewBody: A lot of souvenir shops, restaurants and bars. Views along the seawall are excellent and the shops are fun. Only giving an average rating because there is a big difference between "Average and Very Good".  We had fun and I will go back but I wouldn\'t rate it very good.

661067545.name: Typical strip of restaurants, bars, pharmacies and souvenir stuff!
661067545.author: a TripAdvisor user
661067545.reviewBody: If you have young impressionable children  stay away. If not, then just go have fun. Lots of shrimp for sale and dont forget the Captain Rest up above the city where the light house sits

655859533.name: Malecon Puerto Penasco
655859533.author: a TripAdvisor user
655859533.reviewBody: This reeks of tourtist trap.  However, there were several very interesting restaurant options.  We walked around on a Wednesday afternoon and several of the establishments were closed.

652784415.name: Nice enough, but constant harassment
652784415.author: a TripAdvisor user
652784415.reviewBody: This is a nice, safe place with vendors, bars and some good restaurants at reasonable prices.  The downside is the constant harassment from all of the hawkers trying to get you to come to their pharmacy, or restaurant or whale watching tour, or sunset cruise or whatever.  If you resent being bothered literally every 20 feet then this is not the place for you.

651603143.name: Fun place
651603143.author: a TripAdvisor user
651603143.reviewBody: Definitely a tourist trap, but has some excellent restaurants and lots of shopping options for local goods.  Be sure to bargain with them or you will pay too much.  This even applies to the Pharmacies.  There are 2 or 3 on each block. Great view of the Sea of Cortez.  Safe nice place to visit.  We were there off season, so there were not that many people so it was good.

650547359.name: Visit to Old Port
650547359.author: a TripAdvisor user
650547359.reviewBody: Always nice to visit the Old Port. Great views of the Sea of Cortez from Mary\'s Restaurant. Vendors galore. Fish Market. And a number of nice restaurants to have lunch or diner.

647198429.name: Local restaurant
647198429.author: a TripAdvisor user
647198429.reviewBody: Our RV friends introduced us to an off the beaten path restaurant called Jessie\'s Carreta.  The first night we went there 4 people had the coconut shrimp which had a coconut flavored dipping sauce.  I had the chicken chili relleno which was prepared differently than a traditional chili relleno.  The chili was cooked but was open and served as a dish for the chicken and cheese filling. Very good. Today we went there for hamburgers since they looked so good when we were there our first time. I had the Texan which had bacon and cheese, chopped lettuce and tomato, onion and bbq sauce. It came with home made french fries and 2 onion rings.  Delicious! Our bill for 2 hambyrgers and 3 drinks was $13, not bad.  We would definitely go back.

646176661.name: Pay the guy to park.
646176661.author: a TripAdvisor user
646176661.reviewBody: Strange that they sell many of the same goods as Old Orchard Beach in Maine. It was fun to haggle prices. We paid a guy to park and he watched the car. Everyone is looking for a hand out just choose who is worthy and ask them to be your guide we got some extra deals cause we had a local helping us.

646012910.name: Closest thing to a downtown/tourist area.
646012910.author: a TripAdvisor user
646012910.reviewBody: Lots of seafood vendors and tourist shops.  People do gather out on the plaza though, so it\'s a good time to people watch. Parking can be a little tight, but not too bad for us in the winter. Some okay restaurants, but not as cheap as others in the area.

643873255.name: Great place to buy wonderful seafood, otherwise, would skip
643873255.author: a TripAdvisor user
643873255.reviewBody:
We found the shrimp and fish vendors to be extremely clean, polite, and the quality of the seafood was amazing.  Super fresh, delicious!

Honestly, if you are not in the market for fresh seafood, I would skip this.  It is very crowded, the other vendors are quite pushy, and there is some pretty inappropriate material being sold there.  Not sure why penis mugs are such a big thing.  

One tip, if you are going and buying souvenirs, NEVER pay the first price.  Put it down, start to walk away, and they will come after you with a lower price.  Also,if you are purchasing multiple items, buy them from the same vendor, you will get a better deal.

641991448.name: Just \u2018Meh\u2019 for us
641991448.author: a TripAdvisor user
641991448.reviewBody:
For us, Old Port is pretty much what we don’t want when we come to Rocky Point - tons of people and traffic, and people just bugging you while you’re trying to shop for souvenirs.
Streets are narrow, few places to consistently find parking, and street guys trying to direct you to their places.
The goods are the same no matter where you look - here, “Rodeo Drive” or others.
There are a number of fresh fish stores and restaurants - so that’s a plus. And a Thrifty with a large parking lot (believe it.)
For us, as we experienced yesterday, it’s a pass.

639148367.name: A popular place to drive by LOTS of people
639148367.author: a TripAdvisor user
639148367.reviewBody: For a quick and easy trip to Mexico try Puerto Penasco.  It has a small boardwalk (malecon) by the water, lots of Mexican color and some yummy restaurants.  Be prepared though, it\u2019s very crowded and everyone is trying to get your attention.  It\u2019s a bit calmer away from the water.

636886545.name: Buying Mariscos in Puerto Penasco
636886545.author: a TripAdvisor user
636886545.reviewBody: Fish and shrimp vendors on the Malecon have two scales for weighing their sales, one kept behind the counter that registers accurate weights and a second (usually on top of a counter) that registers about 60% heavier. When buying, insist on the \u201cescala precisa.\u201d

625988637.name: Fun place to visit
625988637.author: a TripAdvisor user
625988637.reviewBody: Do not settle for 1st or 2nd pricing of things! Always get 4 different prices around with the other shops before you make your buy. You\'re most likely going to see the difference of pricing after that. Very nice place to visit and walk around with your family.

624794104.name: Great Fish Markets
624794104.author: a TripAdvisor user
624794104.reviewBody: The quantity of fresh fish, shrimp and clams was awesome, caught earlier in the day. Several good restaurants in the Old Port also. Too bad there are so many touristy-type vendors calling at you.

624131879.name: Lots of shopping, restaurants
624131879.author: a TripAdvisor user
624131879.reviewBody: This is a nice excursion for shopping and restaurants. You can get just about anything here. We also sent to Rodeo Drive for shopping and found a better selection and less crowds.

623860238.name: Skip it!
623860238.author: a TripAdvisor user
623860238.reviewBody: Skip Old Port for shopping and dining. There is a much nicer shopping area without the barkers and crowds around a restaurant called Mariachi. There are shops with nicer things and artisan crafts. The street is nice. \n

623520853.name: A fun place to experience in Mexico \ud83c\uddf2\ud83c\uddfd
623520853.author: a TripAdvisor user
623520853.reviewBody: We love coming down to the Malecon in the Old Port and seeing all the vendors shops, the Mexican ceramics are amazing, the fish market has fresh caught shrimp and fish at low prices, and trying out all the various restaurants and bars is fun too! There is something for everyone to see and experience...try it out!

621873950.name: great shopping, good food, don\'t miss Mary\'s, best Michalada\'s in town,
621873950.author: a TripAdvisor user
621873950.reviewBody: Lots of shops to find that gift or keepsake your looking for, lots of restaurants to chose from, fish market with fresh fish and shrimp

621495988.name: How to avoid getting ripped off at the fish stalls ..
621495988.author: a TripAdvisor user
621495988.reviewBody:
I've seen a couple of people complaining about buying fish at the Malecon and then learning they got less than they paid for.
2 easy solutions:
1.  Buy a sealed bottle of water before you go buy fish.  Remember "a pint a pound the world around?"; well, "a liter a kilo" also holds true.
When you make your selection, pull out your water bottle and place it on the scale.  If it's a half liter bottle, it should weigh half a kilo.
It's at this point the sales guy usually smiles and says something like "oh, hold on ... here's the REAL scale!".  The price will probably also go up a buck a pound; but paying a true price for true weight has always been OK with me.

2.  Skip the Malecon altogether and go to Productos de Mariscos a block or two east of the Burger King.  This is the wholesale house where the fish stalls are buying most of their stuff to begin with.  At the stalls, you are usually buying defrosted shrimp that will disintergrate if you refreeze them.
Here you will get them solid frozen and they will stay that way until you get home.  The weights are true, all the shrimp are the size advertised, and if you specify blue or brown, they are all that way.
