But don't skip the flounder fillets or whole fish.  Absolutely awesome.  But remember, the limit to take home is 50 lbs per vehicle.

618511076.name: Old Port
618511076.author: a TripAdvisor user
618511076.reviewBody: Stayed in Old Port for the first time.  Great location stayed at the Dream Weaver great hotel. Had dinner at the Blue Marlin.  all walking distance.

616808658.name: Typical Mexican Market
616808658.author: a TripAdvisor user
616808658.reviewBody: Pretty much your typical tourist market. Lots of pharmacies that they push but lots of different souvenir options. Good restaurants and fish market. Not bad but nothing special.

611268899.name: Good shopping
611268899.author: a TripAdvisor user
611268899.reviewBody: Lot\'s of good shopping and nice restaurants. Fun walk along the ocean at the end. Some fish markets but best to buy along the harbor.

611166731.name: Love!
611166731.author: a TripAdvisor user
611166731.reviewBody: I love old port for the food, atmosphere and just to people watch. I live here so I spend a lot of time at the Malecon!

609955889.name: Fish Food and Fun F\'n Great Time
609955889.author: a TripAdvisor user
609955889.reviewBody: Great waterfront boardwalk packed with seafood mongers, bars, music and beautiful scenery. I had a great time just people watching and checking out the scene. Had some good meals and entertainment. Locals are polite and friendly. They have the Tourist Police for the drunk college crowd, they have the local Policia and the hardcore Federales. I feel safe and sober but watch out for 1 tequila 2 tequila 3 tequila Floor. Ha Ha

608203292.name: Desert meets the Sea
608203292.author: a TripAdvisor user
608203292.reviewBody: This part of town gets busy once the sun goes down. You can find lots of restaurants and vendors selling all of the typical touristy stuff.

607193164.name: Old Port, The Malecon
607193164.author: a TripAdvisor user
607193164.reviewBody: Great shopping and restaurants with ocean views. Many activities take place here, concerts and other gatherings and entertainment. Glorious place to view sunsets over the ocean while having dinner.

605928644.name: If you like shopping go here
605928644.author: a TripAdvisor user
605928644.reviewBody: Tons of fun and entertaining for all. If you are in Rocky Point you must go here. Buy the jumbo shrimp!

599899985.name: Churrasic Vender best churros
599899985.author: a TripAdvisor user
599899985.reviewBody: We have visit Rocky Point for years a nice place to go and get out of the daily routine, after a long day on the beach take a walk to the Malecon there are several street trucks with food for all taste. You want regret it, the activities keep going after mid night and there is even entertainment for kids.

596239101.name: Cheated by Richards Fish Market at Old Port in Puerto Penasco
596239101.author: a TripAdvisor user
596239101.reviewBody: We bought ten pounds of red snapper and shrimp from Richards Fish Market, one of the open-air vendors in Old Port and weighed our purchase when we got home.  We were given 10 ounces instead of 16 ounces for every pound we bought.  They have rigged the scale.  Take a pound of butter with you and put it on their scale before making a purchase.

589829662.name: pushy
589829662.author: a TripAdvisor user
589829662.reviewBody: pushy vendors more relaxing and better selection in town more. Little nervous with the pushiness but never had any real problems

586940967.name: Breakfast at the fish market
586940967.author: a TripAdvisor user
586940967.reviewBody: Iguana banana,great food quiet but active from the second floor you can people watch and keep an eye on your truck.no worries they are all about helping you.try it soon love the people and country.Visit soon as you can

586550352.name: Stereotypical
586550352.author: a TripAdvisor user
586550352.reviewBody: Shops sell identical items at same or similar prices. There are shops, restaurants, and street vendors. There is live music on the weekends I believe and a beautiful view of the ocean. Worth visiting, but not for the souvenir shops.

586516151.name: This Port Is Postcard Pretty
586516151.author: a TripAdvisor user
586516151.reviewBody: Some people come to Old Port for the shops and shopkeepers willing to dicker over the price of their tourist wares. Others come for the many restaurants and food vendors who serve up deliciousness--and often a lot of it--usually at very reasonable costs. Still others come to see the old lighthouse at the top of the "rock", or to scan down at the harbor and watch as fishing vessels and skiffs ply the waters of the port or rock at their moorings. Old Port is pleasantly picturesque. It ought\'a be high on anyone\'s first visit to Rocky Point. Be aware, though, that parking is difficult and the merchant\'s district can be elbow-to-elbow crowded.

577453106.name: It\'s all in reach!!
577453106.author: a TripAdvisor user
577453106.reviewBody: Lots of shops, pharmacies, bars & restaurants in walking distance. Park at the $5 "safe parking lot" and wander around. It was a fun place.

574992582.name: Great views!
574992582.author: a TripAdvisor user
574992582.reviewBody: Restaurants are pretty good here. The shops are just souvenir stores that all sell pretty much the same stuff. Good for a walk on a nice day.

574465092.name: Lots of shops aggressive shop keepers.
574465092.author: a TripAdvisor user
574465092.reviewBody: OK for quick souvenirs but for nice mexican made items and better prices to the Chollo Mall.  Nice quality and shopkeepers will negotiate prices. Be prepared to pay to use Bano

573763130.name: Small but nice enough
573763130.author: a TripAdvisor user
573763130.reviewBody: We visited the malecon a couple of times. Parking is limited but there are men who will find you a spot (for a small tip).\nVendors we\'re friendly, seafood fresh and there was a small boardwalk along the Sea. Beware of the holes around the palm trees! Too easy to step in one. \nWorth an hour or so and lunch if you\'re hungry.

572164705.name: Very diverting
572164705.author: a TripAdvisor user
572164705.reviewBody: We visit the Old Port or Malecon very time we visit Puerto Penasco. We like walking by the port, shopping, and most especially eating. The shrimp cocktail stand that is always parked right next to the church is our favorite place for shrimp cocktail and ceviche. It is called Mariscos El Temo. We also get a Thrifty ice cream or sometimes a coffee. There are great photo opportunities at the port as well and this is where we attend Mass at 12:00 noon on Sunday.

571691883.name: Love it down at the port
571691883.author: a TripAdvisor user
571691883.reviewBody: First off I love the people of Mexico. The vendors and the food. Rocky point comes alive when you are down here on the weekend, especially. I always find good prices and little trinkets. So fun! The hot dog stand is a fan of my kids and for 20 pesos you cannot beat it. \n\nThe sunsets are not to miss while at old port either. The greatest views. Enjoy! Barter and be respectful to the people. It\u2019s their job to ask and to try to get you in their shop. I e just seen and heard so many rude Americans. Feels off as you\u2019re in their country now.

569749590.name: SOMETHING TO DO FOR AN HOUR OR SO.
569749590.author: a TripAdvisor user
569749590.reviewBody: Old port is where all the fish markets are, cheap fresh fish and shrimp. Lots of bars if you want to party, and lots of small stores selling junk no one wants. It is OK for an hour or two to just walk around, and most of the resturants are not that good. Can be difficult to park on a holiday and weekends

568559137.name: Great fun if you like to negotiate
568559137.author: a TripAdvisor user
568559137.reviewBody: This is the busy tourist area where everyone is coming for souvenirs, pottery, restaurants, bars, and endless amounts of things you never knew you wanted until you saw them.  My kids are old enough now to negotiate and we used it as a manage your money opportunity.  They bargained for toys, little purses, cheesy shell animals, necklaces, and on and on.  Adults got decorative tiles and a ceramic mirror.  If you do not like the idea of bargaining over and over for things that you probably don\'t need, then you just don\'t belong in the Malecon.

565182010.name: A Drinking Village with a Fishing Problem
565182010.author: a TripAdvisor user
565182010.reviewBody: Old Port has great restaurants, lots of bars, tons and tons of shopping.   Activities on the beach park such as live musicians, car cruises, etc.

563972740.name: Fun Times Shopping
563972740.author: a TripAdvisor user
563972740.reviewBody: Wife and i wandered from shop to shop here and found lots of interesting items and very few pushy sales people which made it a great experance

563190816.name: This is Mexico
563190816.author: a TripAdvisor user
563190816.reviewBody: After dinner at the Blue Marlin we walked old town.  Loads of shops offering different prices.  People are trying to lure you into their restaurants.  Very safe to walk and great ice cream.  Recommend.

562156166.name: An interesting and safe place to browse local fare and Mexican souvenirs
562156166.author: a TripAdvisor user
562156166.reviewBody: Many Mexican border towns will introduce you to the types of goods and services you can find throughout Mexico. But a few downtowns, like Old Port in Puerto Penasco, are a very pleasant sojourn for walking around. It\'s authentic, safe, and engaging in typical Mexican fashion. Whether you buy, barter, or browse, there is lots to see. Plus, there are several quite good restaurants ...just ask around, you\'ll find something European or local ...word of mouth testimonials abound.

561564052.name: Old Port
561564052.author: a TripAdvisor user
561564052.reviewBody: Loved the entire Malecon area.  The small shops, eating places, the statue, the hustle and bustle of the people and the view of the ocean. Even managed to purchase a couple of souvenirs.

561036917.name: Crowded tourist area
561036917.author: a TripAdvisor user
561036917.reviewBody: Crowded shops, great restaurants and bars and great views of the Sea of Cortez.  Typical beach tourist town with plenty of crowded shops and fresh seafood markets where you can buy the catch of the day and fantastic shrip and clams at very reasonable prices  Parking is limited but there is secure parking at the entrance to the malecon. .

560739252.name: Same ol Same ol
560739252.author: a TripAdvisor user
560739252.reviewBody: It seems maybe there wasn\u2019t as many people as we are used to. It hasn\u2019t changed much. It is still a fun couple hours to do in an afternoon. Only place I found true pure vanilla. I\u2019m sure others have it, but lot of the old staples have a lot of additives!!  Still can find some good stuff at good prices.

560655415.name: Very Touristy
560655415.author: a TripAdvisor user
560655415.reviewBody: Be prepared for getting hassled by store owners for everything...but then again this is Mexico. The only reason to go up here that I can see is for tourist reasons. The views are beautiful though from the cliffs and there are lists of great bars and restaurants up here.

560309865.name: the atmosphere --
560309865.author: a TripAdvisor user
560309865.reviewBody: some bars are way to loud and try to play over each other, but it\'s still the pier and plenty of fresh fish, lots of STUFF to buy -- so over the touristy stuff, but fun to be had by all -- we love our RP trips

558866713.name: Warning new color coded curbs in old port!
558866713.author: a TripAdvisor user
558866713.reviewBody: I have been going down to Rocky point for about 30 years and knew that the red curbs was no parking. But now they have added yellow and blue. Since none of these are identified we assumed blue was ok to park in. Never even making the handicap connection as there were no labels or signs.  Once we returned to our car we were asked by a police office to show proof of handicap. We did not have that and tried to talk to the policeman about identification of the parking. All he did say was I speak very little English and took our documents and told us to follow him to the police station, which we did. Once there  he proceeded to write our ticket and told us to pay at the window. No one was good at English there. The man who took our money had a hard time converting the fine 806 Peso to dollars. And once he did he said we get 50% off ..why we still don\u2019t know as he was unable to tell us. So the total cost was $22 but a very scary and enlightening event. Just thought I would share.

556686052.name: Another Malecon
556686052.author: a TripAdvisor user
556686052.reviewBody: Worth a visit.  The usual trinkets found throughout Mexico.  Beautiful view from the sea wall across the bay with the shrimp boats anchored.  Lots of places to eat, check the pricing and better value to pay in pesos.  There is some free parking.  Vendors will try to have you park in front of their shops to ensure that you buy something from them.  The scales of most fish/shrimp vendors are not accurate.  We take our own, but great seafood here.

556492387.name: Fun time if you enjoy traditional Mexican fishing port
556492387.author: a TripAdvisor user
556492387.reviewBody: Many restaurants, bars, shops and magnificent view of the Sea of Cortez and surrounding area of town and Sandy Beach.

555302876.name: The original and most famous place for seafood and nicknacks
555302876.author: a TripAdvisor user
555302876.reviewBody: This is the most famous area for restaurants that look out on the ocean, for fresh  shrimp and seafood for cookouts or to take back to the US,and to get trinkets and T-shirts.  There is also the malacon and walking and socializing along the seafront.  This is also the place for music and concerts and some decent hotels.

554301912.name: The Malecon  is all  about souvenirs. Nothing classy or of quality  that i saw.
554301912.author: a TripAdvisor user
554301912.reviewBody: We were pretty  disappointed  in the Malecon. Nothing  special. Lots of hawking  for sales and everything  looked the same. Cheap! Narrow  streets make driving  precarious; and unless you like Mexican  trinkets ,  skip it!

552749038.name: Good place to barter for trinkets
552749038.author: a TripAdvisor user
552749038.reviewBody: Based on other reviews, I was apprehensive about the Port. I was glad that the time of year we were there, there wasn\u2019t overcrowded streets and shops.  The vendors are polite and not overly pushy, and we found some great bargains on fun items.

552712078.name: Can\'t enjoy
552712078.author: a TripAdvisor user
552712078.reviewBody: So many people bugging you to buy stuff, do time share visits you can\'t relax and enjoy yourself for even a minute.

552552852.name: Too many tourists.
552552852.author: a TripAdvisor user
552552852.reviewBody: OK, I guess, but too many tourists. You need to bargain so much that it is not fun. \nI would say go once (watch where you park) and never return!

548880620.name: Day trip to Puerto Penasco Old Port
548880620.author: a TripAdvisor user
548880620.reviewBody: Spent late morning and early afternoon in the Old Port section of Puerto Penasco (Rocky Point). Nice walk beside the Sea or Cortez and great views of the shrimp boats. Lots of local color vendors and restaurants and pubs. Many photo ops here.

547753140.name: Mr. Shrimp for fresh shrimp!
547753140.author: a TripAdvisor user
547753140.reviewBody: We went to this little vendor in old port to buy 5 pounds of fresh shrimp.  He cleaned them for us and provided ice to get them back to the condo.  Fair, friendly and we didn\'t get sick!

544898660.name: Good food, but expensive shopping
544898660.author: a TripAdvisor user
544898660.reviewBody: There are good restuarants, the shopping center deals mainly in dollars and is expensive. Dont even try to make a deal with these vendors. Also the shopping is more clothes than anything.

544100725.name: Fun shopping and great views
544100725.author: a TripAdvisor user
544100725.reviewBody: Many shops to visit. Many restaurants and fresh fish markets. Waterfront many has many places to sit and watch the shrimp boats. With a little luck you will see Dolphins many sea birds. On a clear day you can see San Felipe. We come here every morning with coffee and donuts to sit at the sea wall and watch the wild life. there is an area with statues with history. Some times there are special programs to see there. This can be a very calming place for us to visit.

542723694.name: Just another tourist trap
542723694.author: a TripAdvisor user
542723694.reviewBody: I usually stay on the south end of town, You have several stores if you decide to get your ugly t shirt or key chain. There is always a butt for every chair just not my cup of tea. If they do not sell it in Costco I do not need it.

539828352.name: The small shops are all the same, souvenirs, but the Fish Markets are great
539828352.author: a TripAdvisor user
539828352.reviewBody: Rocky Fish has FRESH seafood and they are willing to make a deal with you, so you can always get a bargain. We can\'t leave town with stopping to fill our cooler with fresh shrimp.

539518939.name: Great Place to Shop!!!
539518939.author: a TripAdvisor user
539518939.reviewBody: We enjoyed the nice weather walking at the Old Port. You can really find some nice deals and yes don\'t pay the asking price!!! Just be careful with your purse or wallet, since you do have a lot of people walking around this area. It is a safe place to shop, but you always have to watch out for those thieves!!! Anyways, been going to Puerto Penasco for year\'s, never had any problems. Always a nice place to visit with friends and family.

535220431.name: Too crowded
535220431.author: a TripAdvisor user
535220431.reviewBody: ...and it wasn\u2019t even the busy season. I preferred the charming downtown. Very typical Mexico port town food scene- lots of people trying to get you into their restaurants that all served basically the same thing.

533604404.name: Nice surprise
533604404.author: a TripAdvisor user
533604404.reviewBody: It was a nice surprise to find this area for shopping and walking around town.  It was not crowded and easy to get around.  You can definitely bargain for the things you want.  Never pay the asking prices.

527080477.name: Vendories galore.
527080477.author: a TripAdvisor user
527080477.reviewBody: Your typical community vendorie shop in mexico. They love to barter and the shops offer typically the same things and if u need a size that shop doesn\'t have they will run and get it for u. A great time not too pushy just want your money\n

517457829.name: A little chaotic
517457829.author: a TripAdvisor user
517457829.reviewBody: People are all over you trying to sell you stuff and they don\'t give up, the stores are not that cheap,in fact some things were too expensive for the quality. You have to walk a lot in the heat and sweating like crazy. The only nice places there were The Point Restaurant and the Malec\u00f3n for pictures, they have a nice Pe\u00f1asco sign and the view to the sea from there is nice. With little kids I highly don\'t recomment it or be prepared to have lots of patience.

514313520.name: Worth checking out
514313520.author: a TripAdvisor user
514313520.reviewBody: Had all the standard knick knacks.  Alot of locals there. One thing that stood out was the spray paint artist, very impressive work.  Nice place to walk around and check things out.  Good police presence.

513407656.name: Bying fresh seafood in Rocky Point
513407656.author: a TripAdvisor user
513407656.reviewBody: We always go to Mr. Shrimp and have enjoyed all of the seafood we have purchased as well as our friendship with Gadalupe . He is a kind, hard working, honest man that been a joy.  I won\'t go anywhere else.  As he tells me "You have never gotten sick from anything you buy here".

513338043.name: Nothing unique but still fun
513338043.author: a TripAdvisor user
513338043.reviewBody: As one vendor asked us when we were walking by his shop "Need any more junk?"\nMy wife and I enjoy strolling through these market places when we travel, even though most of the \'junk\' is redundant. We went to the Malecon on two different days and had lunch after perusing the wares. I got a decent buy on a fairly good quality palm cowboy hat and my wife bought the obligatory T-shirts for the grandkids. I\'d say check it out if you go to Rocky Point.

510177215.name: Everyone wants to rip you off. Lots of attitude and bad looks if you\'re American.
510177215.author: a TripAdvisor user
510177215.reviewBody: Worst part of Rocky Point. I loved so many places we went, THIS WAS NOT ONE OF THEM. Shop keepers wanted 15-20 USD for little shot glasses and comparable trinkets. We stopped at one restaurant who added random items to our bill and told us one price, but listed different ones on the actual bill. We paid in all pesos and knew enough Spanish to communicate food and shop orders/prices. We got a lot of dirty looks and attitude from shop keepers and restaurants alike. I can recommend many companies and restaurants in Rocky Point, with friendly service and great local cuisine/art...but I would not recommend this little tourist trap and will never return to this shopping district.

507597658.name: Average
507597658.author: a TripAdvisor user
507597658.reviewBody: Not bad during the day. Shops and trinkets for the tourists around. When busy season is here, there are places to eat and drink. Nice little walk-way by the water and places to take pictures. Rough people come out at night, just be carful and mind yourself...

504052940.name: Good
504052940.author: a TripAdvisor user
504052940.reviewBody: Nice area to visit restaurants are present and look around you find some very good prices. So go out and adventure

504042604.name: A must see when you visit Puerto Penasco
504042604.author: a TripAdvisor user
504042604.reviewBody:
In this area you will find: bars, restaurants, gift shops, fish markets, street performers, dresses, T - shirts, hats, ponchos, sandals, toys, ice cream, and on the spot car washes for approx. $5.00.
The people here are friendly and many are bilingual.
Many of the restaurants are multi storied and you enjoy a meal or drink over looking the passing crowds.
It is best to come prepared with Pesos and a few places are real low on the exchange rate.
Ask for the price of drinks before ordering.
You walk the length of the Malecon both ways in a hour but people rarely do as there is so much to see.
The harbor and The Sea of Cortez, waves crashing over the sea wall in very high tides, dolphins, fishing boats, Sea Gulls, Pelicans, the Fish Markets, the statues and much more.
While many things stay the same all year round, a great many things change daily.

499969332.name: Great place to buy fresh seafood
499969332.author: a TripAdvisor user
499969332.reviewBody: Small market places where the fish is sold out of coolers-some of the freshest we\'ve had (melts in your mouth)-bring your fave herbs from home=best cioppino we\'ve had ever!!!!  Can walk along the "marina"-no peddlers/tourist traps!

497840614.name: Nice area to eat
497840614.author: a TripAdvisor user
497840614.reviewBody: Shopping just ok as you all know lots of sales people selling stuff but hey they are just trying to make a living and it\'s not a big deal but there are some great deals IF you negotiate. Also many good restaurants with awesome views of the Baja ocean and good food with great service. Best to park just a couple blocks any where off the strip. Avoid the free parking areas. More theft there. Better off on the streets. Many fun busy areas. Party on!!

496299602.name: Male on and shops
496299602.author: a TripAdvisor user
496299602.reviewBody: It was a nice time looking at the shops and things to buy, awesome views lots of fresh mariscos to purchase it was so fresh and I should of packed a cooler in the car.

490404867.name: Tourist trap. Pushy salesmen. Negiotate on prices!!! Lots of sex stuff, not a place for kids.
490404867.author: a TripAdvisor user
490404867.reviewBody:
Went here for souvenirs.

Lock your car, some rough people. Most booths have the same souvenirs. Lots of sex souvenirs, I would NOT bring kids here.

Negiotate on everything, most people will drop their prices 50%. Also, bring cash. Most sales people are extremely pushy, a few are ok. Parking gets rough, very crowded on weekend. Rodeo drive is much better shopping.

489000675.name: Tourist crap
489000675.author: a TripAdvisor user
489000675.reviewBody: Just lots of people yelling at you, touching you. Trying to sell their stuff or make you go into their restaurants.

488334230.name: Good,  but car broken into.
488334230.author: a TripAdvisor user
488334230.reviewBody: We parked in a dirt parking lot as you reach the main malecon area near the water.  The lot says fee parking and a ton of cars are parked there. We ate at a restaurant and shopped for trinkets. Went back after a few hours and found our car broken into.  Thankfully nothing of value taken and nobody was hurt.  Two other cars were broken into and they had purses and passports taken. Other than that it is hard to avoid since a bunch of restaurants and tours are in that area but we will probably be more reluctant to go spend money there now.

487508470.name: It\'s a place to avoid except for the restaurants
487508470.author: a TripAdvisor user
487508470.reviewBody: The Malecon here does not compare to say the Mazatlan Malecon. It is a crammed mixture of restaurants, fisheries (below), and tourist trinket stuff plus miscellaneous shops. I tend to go off the main drag, where there are smaller places to eat, quieter, and less congested. Parking is terrible, as is just getting through the Malecon by car. During festivals, etc. The Malecon plaza has good stand-food options, but ask to pay in pesos, never in dollars.

487438060.name: Florida Friends in MX
487438060.author: a TripAdvisor user
487438060.reviewBody: Great time in the Old Port...\nLots to see and many great places to stop for a cold one, The Satisfied Frog, Tekila Bar, Boo Bar, breakfast at Maria Bonitas at the Vina del Mar hotel. Just cruise the malecon. Fun shopping with a view!

487011769.name: Since there isn\'t much else in Puerto Penasco...
487011769.author: a TripAdvisor user
487011769.reviewBody: ... a stroll along the malecon is always part of the program. It\'s a nice place, especially at night when groups of musicians perform live music. The downside is the overly aggressive armada of storefront owners trying to lure you inside their hole-in-the-wall stores. I consider myself a very experienced Mexico traveler, so I\'m saying this as someone who is used to this kind of thing. But store owners are more aggressive here than elsewhere in Mexico, I\'ve found. Not aggressive in the sense that they make you feel uncomfortable, but more in a distracting, getting-on-your-nerves kind of way. And maybe I wouldn\'t mind as much if the stores were unique, but they\'re pretty much identical, with the same stuff at the same prices, and none of them carry what I consider a quality selection of Mexican goods. It\'s all cheap, touristy stuff.

484978406.name: The place to see
484978406.author: a TripAdvisor user
484978406.reviewBody: This is what there is in Puerto Penasco, other than the beaches. It was a fun place to hang out. In the off season, it\'s not crowded. The restaurants were good.

484506604.name: Malecon
484506604.author: a TripAdvisor user
484506604.reviewBody: Good shopping and a couple of good beach side restaurants.  Try Aquias Con Flavios for breakfast and lunch.  Very good Shrimp Cocktails and shrimp tacos.  You will not be disappointed.

484477545.name: Souvenirs etc.
484477545.author: a TripAdvisor user
484477545.reviewBody: The old port is a good place to walk around, check out souvenirs, or eat at a restaurant. It is by the beach and is referred to as the "Malecon". As other people have stated there are a lot of vendors there to get your business. If you are uninterested simply say "no thanks" and keep walking. Nice to walk around and check out the little knick-knacks.

483757333.name: Why does it have to be that way?
483757333.author: a TripAdvisor user
483757333.reviewBody:
If you like to be harassed by street vendors, menu holders, restaurant owners, fish sellers, this is your place, but definitely not mine.  Been coming here for 15 years and we avoid this place like the plague.  Not sure why they think this can be appealing to tourists of any kind but it must because they keep doing it.  

I especially love it when they say they have freshly caught shrimp for sale when the season (legal shrimp season is ONLY between Sep and Mar) is over.  What is your definition of fresh or was it caught illegally?  

Didn't see much for sale made by local people.  Yeah for Taiwan, China, Korea - - - 

The only times we enjoy the Old Port is when they have special events and close the street to vehicular traffic and musicians or other artists take over.  Then and only then we dare come here.

481090720.name: Always fun!
481090720.author: a TripAdvisor user
481090720.reviewBody: This is always a great place to find souvenirs, haggle on prices, and find a tasty taco. So many options! Pro tip: if you\'re looking for something in particular, make your way through all the shops to find the best one.

479749389.name: Great good and shops
479749389.author: a TripAdvisor user
479749389.reviewBody: Great shopping with fun bartering. Awesome fresh seafood restaurants all over the place. A must visit when I\'m the area.

476572455.name: Worth a walk about
476572455.author: a TripAdvisor user
476572455.reviewBody: Fun walk about, lots of little stores to buy trinkets. Fun bars and restaurants everywhere.... it is what one would expect to find in a tourist district... the areas one or two blocks off the beaten path were very interesting. If you want souvenirs, shrimp, or pharmacy products this is the place to be...

476260292.name: Great time
476260292.author: a TripAdvisor user
476260292.reviewBody: Old Port is an exciting and interesting area to roam.  The fish market has wonderful fresh fish, shrimp, clams and other interesting ocean stuff. The rest of the market place has really grown.  You can find all sorts of things, in the shops and in the street (many "helpers" will show you the best things, for "almost free").  So many great things to see and do.  And eat.  You will have a great time spending some time there.

473485120.name: We have always loved Old Port
473485120.author: a TripAdvisor user
473485120.reviewBody: It only gets better. There was more going on than ever before. The place is hopping. We still love Mary\'s seafood. It is our favorite for sure.

472826784.name: Lots of vendors, food and fun! Especially at night...
472826784.author: a TripAdvisor user
472826784.reviewBody: Go shopping each time i am here. Fun but yes they do ask and you barter. Eat at Asedero\'s when down in Rocky point. Great tacos!

472413366.name: Not great
472413366.author: a TripAdvisor user
472413366.reviewBody: I\'ve been coming to Puerto Pe\u00f1asco for decades. Restaurants in Old Port are hit or miss. Stores aren\'t too bad, but they mostly sell the same thing--tacky souvenirs and t-shirts. The streets in and around here can be really dirty. Garbage piles up in front of the stores sometimes. Lots of poverty. Last night I was offered cocaine. Air pollution from junky cars with emission problems can create allergies. Lots of traffic. \n\nI usually just stay at my resort, or the area right around it, and avoid Old Port. It\'s not glamorous in the least. Looks like a slum.

471370447.name: Half Crazy Half Amazing
471370447.author: a TripAdvisor user
471370447.reviewBody: The food in the fish market area is delicious everywhere.  Unfortunately, you will be accosted by vendors and restauranterus to enter their shops and venues.  Once through this noisy end of the Malecon, the walk toward the lighthouse on Whale Hill, is stunningly beautiful and peaceful.

470171356.name: Fun place to walk through.
470171356.author: a TripAdvisor user
470171356.reviewBody: The Old Port is an interesting place, full of many shops selling mostly the same stuff as all the others. The fish markets here a much cleaner than the others scattered about town. There are some nice restaurants and bars as well.

468383810.name: Fun shopping
468383810.author: a TripAdvisor user
468383810.reviewBody: A definite tourist trap, but fun and interesting. I have fun haggling with the shopkeepers, but be fair, l have been known to push too far and tick them off. Lots of shops and restaurants.

468344317.name: Old POrt
468344317.author: a TripAdvisor user
468344317.reviewBody: Had a great time visiting Old Port.  It has everything-from souvenirs to dining-all can be found here.  There are places for the younger crowd as well as places for the "mature" visitor.  Arrangements can also be made for other forms of excitement such as Jet skis, Banana boat rides, etc.

467813553.name: March 2017
467813553.author: a TripAdvisor user
467813553.reviewBody: Tourist area with lots of shops and restaurants where fantastic fresh fish meals can be enjoyed at bargain prices.

467012817.name: A must see
467012817.author: a TripAdvisor user
467012817.reviewBody: A lot of souvenir shops. And a few bars and restaurants. Located right next to  a beautiful ocean view. Great place to take pictures.

466668625.name: It\'s worth battling the traffic
466668625.author: a TripAdvisor user
466668625.reviewBody: The malecon is always good times.  There are many bars to suit many different tastes.  There are plenty of restaurants.  Fishmongers are offering the freshest seafood, including shrimp the size of Twinkie.  Above all else, the people watching is a blast.

466155145.name: Great place!
466155145.author: a TripAdvisor user
466155145.reviewBody: Leave your credit cards in your wallet and pay in pesos.  Found the prices great and the seafood even better. Locals are very friendly and fair if you treat them as you would like to be treated.

464748633.name: Try Lucky\'s $5 bloody Mary with free breakfast
464748633.author: a TripAdvisor user
464748633.reviewBody: The bloody mary is delicious and you get a full breakfast with it. Order another $5 bloody mary and get another free breakfast, but you won\'t be able to finish the second meal.

463895103.name: Fun for some
463895103.author: a TripAdvisor user
463895103.reviewBody: Crazy busy. Impossible to park close. Lots of small shops with everything except the one thing I was looking for. Excellent people watching

463254160.name: Something for everyone
463254160.author: a TripAdvisor user
463254160.reviewBody: Had a nice walk with our children. Everyone enjoyed looking at the arts and crafts, people dancing, shopping, eating and what not. You definitely get to experience the culture here. A must in my opinion

461506168.name: Old Port
461506168.author: a TripAdvisor user
461506168.reviewBody: We walked from our hotel to the old port, our choice. Lots of shops, gifts and restaurants. A lot of Mexican paddlers selling all kinds of things. Beautiful views of the water and was just great to sit and enjoy them. We chose not to be there during evening hours as we are not evening party individuals. Many great restaurants and fresh seafood. We purchased a few items. Not crowed the day we were down there.

459036065.name: Loved it so much
459036065.author: a TripAdvisor user
459036065.reviewBody: This is by far one of my top two places I\'ve ever traveled to I enjoy it so much and it\'s very safe and the food is amazing no matter where you go , and shopping is amazing !!!! Great spot to go for a night , week , month or even live

457114458.name: Great deals on local items and good eating
457114458.author: a TripAdvisor user
457114458.reviewBody: We were here in January so no crowds of tourists, easy parking, shop owners were willing to bargain and you could find a spot to sit and watch for dolphins/whales at any of the bars.  We ate at 3 different spots and all were great!

456529203.name: Good shopping and bar hopping
456529203.author: a TripAdvisor user
456529203.reviewBody: This town has many shops filled with things from local artisans and kitschy things for the home, as well as gift things for the typical tourist.  I paid on the average one third of their original asking price.  Be ready to haggleWhile we were there off season, it was still hopping in the afternoon.  Great place to buy fresh shrimp.  Make sure the scales are in zero when they weigh your shrimp!!

454861106.name: Avoid the crowds by visiting in January
454861106.author: a TripAdvisor user
454861106.reviewBody: Parking is easy to access. Restaurant owners are seeking customers but aren\'t pushy. It makes it nice to be able to visit with the locals then.

454147343.name: Typical tourist location
454147343.author: a TripAdvisor user
454147343.reviewBody: There are some fun days to people watch and spend money on generally useless items.  You can get some good deals and have the ability to barter.  Just look in multiple locations before purchasing for best deal

453452432.name: Just junk
453452432.author: a TripAdvisor user
453452432.reviewBody: Not sure exactly where this was but we saw nothing to stop for. Very impoverished town with nothing to spend money on - except the shrimp.  Gotta buy some of that!

450168107.name: Small area. Safe free parking
450168107.author: a TripAdvisor user
450168107.reviewBody: I wish the the cars didn\'t park along street, hard to walk with the side walks full of things to buy, hard to get around to next shop.

450030815.name: Souvenirs!
450030815.author: a TripAdvisor user
450030815.reviewBody: We drove here and spent the afternoon.  Stopped at Flavio\'s for lunch and paid with MasterCard since we are from the states. My husband and four kids had fun looking through all the shops.  You have to bargain with every store owner... the good news is that if one store owner won\'t give you the price you want, you are sure to find another store owner that will!  We love college football and found a lot of college football represented on their merchandise!  It was a very fun day!

449756481.name: Tiny working port with fresh fish daily
449756481.author: a TripAdvisor user
449756481.reviewBody: I love being able to drive down to the port and find fresh fish everyday.  You must bargain or you\'ll pay full US retail prices.  For example large prawns were about $7 a kilo but one day I wasn\'t paying attention and paid $12 a kilo. Ops.  Bad me.  \n\nIt\'s a good place to bring the kids and get a coco (coconut) to sip on during a hot day, or watch the pelicans as they wait for a tasty treat.

449516976.name: A must on every visit to get your seafood!
449516976.author: a TripAdvisor user
449516976.reviewBody: Stop by Old Port to get your fresh caught shrimp, clams and fish. You can also get pharmaceuticals that are too expensive in US. Don\'t forget to check out Satisfied Frog and Luckys Cantina. Luckys even has a free breakfast!

449389042.name: Great time at the Malecon
449389042.author: a TripAdvisor user
449389042.reviewBody: People are very friendly.  Lots of merchandise to see and buy while enjoying great views of the ocean.  Bars are great and lots of fun especially Shark Bite, Tekila Bar and Boo Bar!

448859946.name: Typical tourist shops.
448859946.author: a TripAdvisor user
448859946.reviewBody: Had lunch at Flavio\'s on the water. Seafood should have been great but wasn\'t. My review of our trip to Puerto Penasco is on Southern Arizona Guide.\n

448674075.name: Fun area with killer sunsets
448674075.author: a TripAdvisor user
448674075.reviewBody: I love staying in the Mexican areas when I visit Mexico: the street scenes, families, real life experiences. The Old Port historic area and Malecon do not disappoint.

448087896.name: tourist section of Rocky Point
448087896.author: a TripAdvisor user
448087896.reviewBody: this is a typical border town/tourist location, most prices are in USD and you\'ll get the usual Mexican trinkets. Lots of food choices, plenty of parking, and good views of the bay.

446934306.name: Must see
446934306.author: a TripAdvisor user
446934306.reviewBody: If you came to Mexico to shop, eat, drink then this is a must see. My wife and I spent Christmas Day walking around old port ate and got some drinks, well I did, she\'s 6 months pregnant. We speak limited Spanish and felt very safe. All the locals were here hanging out drinking and celebrating as well. It was a great experience on Christmas Day.

442612096.name: Mostly touristy souvenirs but I found tapetes!
442612096.author: a TripAdvisor user
442612096.reviewBody: Most of the shops in Old Port have the usual touristy souvenir items, but I found a shop on a side street with Oaxacan textiles. It made the trip to town worth it.

441448087.name: Full of life and energy.
441448087.author: a TripAdvisor user
441448087.reviewBody:
What a place! It is beautiful, has a character and its own landmarks but for me a bit too crazily busy and congested. It is full of flamboyant life. Peppered with souvenir shops and stores of every possible kind. It seems that every other building is housing a pharmacy. 
Parking here is tricky. Do not count on free parking as it is almost always full. Self appointed car watchers will offer to watch your vehicle.
It is definitely the heart of Puerto Penasco.
Take a perhaps a picture at the city sign with bright letters spelling the name. Or with the statue of fisherman.
The old plaza is slightly quieter and it is a pleasant place to sit and look at the actual port and the boats. Do some people watching.
Come  and visit - you will enjoy it. But it is so crowded...

441152437.name: Fun little shops and bars/restuarants!
441152437.author: a TripAdvisor user
441152437.reviewBody: Fun place to go anytime of the day. Lots of bars, shops and places to eat. Don\'t forget to buy the huge shrimp to take home!

438197636.name: Great getaway!
438197636.author: a TripAdvisor user
438197636.reviewBody: Love the food, taking our motorcycle down the Malecon such a great place to getaway. Shopping for souvenirs.

438095831.name: The heart of Puerto Penasco
438095831.author: a TripAdvisor user
438095831.reviewBody:
As is typical in Mexico, each port has a Malecon - literally translated as a pier or jetty. The Old Port in Penasco celebrates the street vendors with shop upon shop of trinkets to buy. There are, tucked away some better shops in the back of the stalls offering silver jewelry and onyx items made in the country. 

The real gem is the walk along the boardwalk by the ocean watching the shrimp boats and pelicans in amongst the waves. There are some great restaurants - Mary's for enormous platters of seafood and the Satisfied Frog for some of the best fried chicken you will eat. 

If you are up for some cooking in your hotel kitchen pick up the best fresh shrimp you will ever eat - the largest ones are the best! All the fish shops are across from the shops and fishermen will vie for your attention. All in all, lots of fun!

432649165.name: Old Port is great fun.
432649165.author: a TripAdvisor user
432649165.reviewBody: This is a great place to buy souvenirs and eat and drink.  Lots of fun to visit this area.  The seafood is amazing and I have never seen bigger and fresher shrimp for sale.

431644724.name: Fun
431644724.author: a TripAdvisor user
431644724.reviewBody: Good shopping! A lot of suff. Tip bring ice cooler for the shrimp lol and money close to per for fishing and parking is free

430749377.name: A must do in Mexico
430749377.author: a TripAdvisor user
430749377.reviewBody: I enjoy walking along the malecon and peaking into shops and buying fresh seafood that was caught that morning. Only complaint is too many stalls seem to see much of the same items.

428847726.name: Touristy shopping delights
428847726.author: a TripAdvisor user
428847726.reviewBody: A close knit group od stalls and restaurant/bars along the old seafront.  A bit of everything is available.

428581077.name: Crowded souvenir shopping with fresh fish
428581077.author: a TripAdvisor user
428581077.reviewBody: Hot and crowded souvenir shopping which only appeals to kids or adults with cold beers. \nThe fish market has lots of fresh fish, shrimp and clams, among other things.  Bring a cooler and stock up! The prices are good and the goods are fresh.

426386438.name: Certainly worth a visit to experience the Malecon in Puerto Penasco
426386438.author: a TripAdvisor user
426386438.reviewBody: When you visit the Old Port area in Puerto Penasco (Rocky Point), you MUST stroll through the updated Malecon. There are MANY bars, restaurants, shops and fish / seafood vendors. A bit tough to find parking unless you arrive early (before 11 am)(especially on a weekend or a holiday). Overlooking the Sea of Cortez is always a lovely part of the visit to the Old Port area.

422525038.name: Awesome Spot... Loved all the vendors
422525038.author: a TripAdvisor user
422525038.reviewBody: Loved the night life ambiance! Had a great time with live music and delicious food and drinks! Everyone should come and explore!

421676050.name: Gifts
421676050.author: a TripAdvisor user
421676050.reviewBody: There are many little stores to purchase all kinds of souvenirs, from pens to mugs to jewelry you can find many things.  They also have restaurants and bars.

421256366.name: Shopping
421256366.author: a TripAdvisor user
421256366.reviewBody: Old port has a lot of shopping places,  but a lot of the same stuff in different stores. The people are rather pushy when haggling &  trying to get you to purchase from their store. Rather expensive. But nice to walk through if you don\'t mind telling all the store folks, No Thank You.

420509131.name: Fun Time!
420509131.author: a TripAdvisor user
420509131.reviewBody: Old Port has many shops and many places to eat.  A lot of the shops have similar items, however you expect that down in Mexico.  There are several nice places to eat, and the atmosphere is upbeat and fun.  If you want to do a bit of cooking on your own later on, buy  a few pounds of the shrimp from the fisherman along the boardwalk!  Incredible shrimp at very reasonable prices!  Don\'t miss going down to Old Port, it\'s a fun few hours!

415816765.name: Shopping and Food
415816765.author: a TripAdvisor user
415816765.reviewBody: Sr Amigo is the place to go and eat and the Tekila bar at the end is great.  The store right before the end on the left with the purses and bags it the best.

415812924.name: Shops and more
415812924.author: a TripAdvisor user
415812924.reviewBody: Pretty good place to visit for a couple hours. Lots of shopping and plenty of restaurants. At night there\'s music and activities. Lots of people lots of kids. Highly recommend this place for The Experience

415515376.name: I\'m in love with old port!!
415515376.author: a TripAdvisor user
415515376.reviewBody: Every time I visit - I can lose 8 hours just hangin in the old port . The food , music , street performers , and shopping is all so wonderful .  Anything you need is in the old port.

415387939.name: Nice food
415387939.author: a TripAdvisor user
415387939.reviewBody: Good food and fresh seafood!! A lot options of restaurants.\nNice place to shopping and enjoy the sunset

414318527.name: tourist trap yes but you should go
414318527.author: a TripAdvisor user
414318527.reviewBody: traffic turns one way through there and parking can be hard to get (but it\'s always free, don\'t ever pay for it). great view of sandy beach and lots of restaurants and night life. great place to pick your seafood and then have a restaurant upstairs make it for you. then there\'s all the shopping too. don\'t forget to bargain.

413736153.name: Shopping,dining,drinking
413736153.author: a TripAdvisor user
413736153.reviewBody: Nice area right on the water. This is their slow season, so some of the bars/resturants were closed a couple days of the week. Dining was nice over looking the water.  Fresh seafood, good drinks. Shopping was ok. The shops were a little aggressive,  but not bad compared  to other parts of the world.  Mugs were actually cheaper here than Rodeo drive,  just shop around and bargain.  The vendors walking around are friendly, and not pushy. Fun place to hang out

412911031.name: Great food and souvenirs
412911031.author: a TripAdvisor user
412911031.reviewBody: Great place to pick up little knick nacks and a great selection of food. They also have a great picture spot with the word Pe\u00f1asco

410385325.name: Come for food, shopping and bars.
410385325.author: a TripAdvisor user
410385325.reviewBody: This is a one stop location. You will find great food,drinks, bars & shopping. While enjoying great seafood you will see the beach.

405902607.name: good to spend a day shopping
405902607.author: a TripAdvisor user
405902607.reviewBody: Spend an afternoon shopping around the various stores. Bargain for all items. We have purchased seafood at the locales and found that the scales were suspicious to say the least. Several good and inexpensive restaurants in the area.

405808127.name: Very nice fresh seafood and curios to buy.
405808127.author: a TripAdvisor user
405808127.reviewBody: Very fresh and many choices for you to shop , all sorts.  Even the most delicate seafood , same area we have super big selection of curios shops , to purshase sorviners, , security wise Is fine .

403910664.name: Your basic tourist trap
403910664.author: a TripAdvisor user
403910664.reviewBody:
Old Port is full of little shops stocked with cheap souvenirs. But you should go there at least once during your visit. 
This isn't the best place to shop the Mexican Pharmacies. Go into the city for those.
Getting Thrifty Ice cream is always a tradition when we visit Old Port. 
Go early in the day to buy fresh local seafood. There are some good restaurants but our favorite is a little taco cart known as El Chino. Just a couple blocks east of the main drag. Just drive around til you find him. Honestly it is worth the hunt to find this guy. If you are a germaphobe you might want something else. But we have never gotten sick and we eat there 2 or 3 times each trip. Just close your eyes and imagine you are in a clean, sanitary restaurant somewhere in the US and enjoy! It's all part of the adventure of Rocky Point.

403037986.name: Shopping Galore
403037986.author: a TripAdvisor user
403037986.reviewBody: The Old Port has everything you could possibly want. Shopping, ATV\'s, and cruises. Plus a ton of restaurants. Highly recommend it

402497211.name: Cindy
402497211.author: a TripAdvisor user
402497211.reviewBody: Nice view, we spend to afternoon there at times fishing.  It pretty private during the week.. we take the dogs so they can play in the water.

401048199.name: Typical tourist area
401048199.author: a TripAdvisor user
401048199.reviewBody: This area is about 4 blocks long and consists of the typical souvenir/junk shops, restaurants and bars.  There are several restaurants where you can get fresh seafood and can even select your fish.  The vendors will invite you in to eat or select a gift but they are polite.  On the south end is the malecon, a walkway next to the sea wall with palm trees and some attractive statues and art work.  The area comes alive at night as people and vendors come out to enjoy the cooler evening.

400221519.name: Happening!
400221519.author: a TripAdvisor user
400221519.reviewBody: Restaurants, bars (even Karaoke), local shopping, ice cream, unique galleries, coffee shop with sidewalk movies and the fish market. The malecon is always full of local and tourist life with nightly strolls among street musicians.

400161712.name: A great walk
400161712.author: a TripAdvisor user
400161712.reviewBody: People are very friendly and helpful. You can shop around and find lots of neat things. Lots of restaurants and shops to choose from.

396713141.name: Visit
396713141.author: a TripAdvisor user
396713141.reviewBody: Great place to find anything you need from food to medicine. Save and peaceful environment. Everyone is really helpful.

395543306.name: Waste of time unless you need viagra!
395543306.author: a TripAdvisor user
395543306.reviewBody: Every vendor has the same merchandise and several pharmacy\'s. A few restaurants. Cheap and ugly chachkis, phallic and bosom inspired coffee mugs and some cute t shirts. Some fish vendors, we bought some shrimp but honestly didn\'t think it was any better than what we get at my local grocery store.

394082998.name: Ok for walking
394082998.author: a TripAdvisor user
394082998.reviewBody: If you want to buy gifts or fresh sea food this is the place. Good place for walking and shopping and take pictures.

392745126.name: Haggle till you drop!
392745126.author: a TripAdvisor user
392745126.reviewBody: The market had many shops to get everything from hats and backpacks to clothes and toys.  The key here is to go to a couple of stores and compare prices for similar items, once you get the lowest price haggle down some more.  You will be able to get a great deal by haggling.  I bought a back pack for $9.00 down from $16 at another store.  You need to haggle and be willing to walk away if they do not come down on their prices.  We were able to get gifts for a great deal.

392729770.name: FATHER\'S DAY
392729770.author: a TripAdvisor user
392729770.reviewBody: Excellent, had a great time, met Mr Chino. Lost a $1500.00 pair of coach prescription glasses but, had a great time!

392691366.name: Fun sightseeing
392691366.author: a TripAdvisor user
392691366.reviewBody: It was nice to drive around town and visit Old Port.  It has great shopping, amazing restaurants.  Go early in the day as it gets crowded at night an dots of begging.

391804694.name: Nice place for gift items
391804694.author: a TripAdvisor user
391804694.reviewBody: It was a clean place and seems like it has been renovated in the last few years.  Bought few trinkets for the kids and few gifts for family and friends.

389543854.name: Grab Yo Grill
389543854.author: a TripAdvisor user
389543854.reviewBody:
Walked thru the old port to do some shopping and eventually some food.

The spot bus pretty busy...you better be ready to get ur haggle on or you will payment way to much....you must be prepared to even walk away to get a decent price.the shop owners are pretty aggressive as well.

There plenty of restaurants in the area...but finding a good one is hard.

389543766.name: Repetitive Shopping
389543766.author: a TripAdvisor user
389543766.reviewBody: Great for souvenirs but merchandise repeats through the shops. Good restaurants but shops are a bit overpriced. I did get a nice Sun hat $15 and purse for $10. Too many people yelling to come into shops, but was expected.

388146457.name: if you want the street vendor experience in Puerto Penasco... here it is!
388146457.author: a TripAdvisor user
388146457.reviewBody: Get your haggling hat on and got for it!  You can find all kinds of handmade curious and souvenirs along with several fish vendors for your dinner!  The stalls can be rather stuffy if the weather is hot/humid so pace yourself and grab some water (or cold beer).  Tip: don\'t buy right away. Walk the entire street and pick the places you want to return to.  You\'ll have a much better idea of prices and you wont\' have to carry the stuff all day!  Tip2:  I\'ve found that the mobile vendors are usually more flexible in price - but know your product nonetheless.  Have fun!

387644149.name: Great time
387644149.author: a TripAdvisor user
387644149.reviewBody: We had the best time ever shopping, eating and bar hopping in old town. The shrimp were marvellous. Everyone was very friendly and helpful if needed. We are planning another trip for Labor Day weekend.

387613986.name: If you want a souvenir this is the place
387613986.author: a TripAdvisor user
387613986.reviewBody: It\'s a nice old port with lots of souvenir places and pharmacies. If you want a souvenir, you can find it here ( prices are high though ) . A lot of restaurants and sea food.

385613774.name: Agressive shop keepers
385613774.author: a TripAdvisor user
385613774.reviewBody: If you,enjoy being yelled at, pulled & Acosted this place is for you. Every restaurant, curio shop have venders out side trying to sell you STUFF. It is all the same STUFF.  Go down to Rodeo Dr. Laid back shop keepers, the same stuff, but some really nice hand made treasures.

385099465.name: A lot packed into a small area!
385099465.author: a TripAdvisor user
385099465.reviewBody: The Old Port in Puerto Penasco has a lot to offer.  First, be mindful that there are a lot of locals who make their money by setting up "deals" with the tourists.  Immediately upon parking in the Old Port, a gentleman named Miguel asked us where we wanted to eat and began giving us directions to this place and that place.  He miraculously showed up as we were leaving as well.  Not understanding his role, we thought he worked for the restaurant he was directing us towards.  He took us up two flights of stairs to the outside sitting area.  After our meals, another gentleman came up and asked if our meals were good.  I mistook him for the manager.  He wanted to set up an appointment to see a time share.  Be aware!  The music was wonderful, the setting sun was splendid, and the food was good.  Shops are filled to the brim with merchandise that seems a bit repetitious.  Most of the shops do not take credit cards, so be sure to take cash.  My grandchildren liked aspects of the Old Port, but grew tired quickly.

384918661.name: Quaint place!
384918661.author: a TripAdvisor user
384918661.reviewBody: This is my hometown old port. it has been trough a lot of changes in the past goverments. this is mainly where the local people spend their saturday or sunday evening walking of ridding a bike. young people meet here to listen to music and have some drinks. the is the most popular place during holyweek.

384657721.name: Perfect Spot to Start our Vacation
384657721.author: a TripAdvisor user
384657721.reviewBody: After driving down from Phoenix in the 109F heat - finding the Old Port and grabbing a margarita as we sat seaside was perfect! We didn\'t do the shops right away, but after this initial visit we did. The vendors aren\'t pushy, but some of the attraction sellers on the Malecon are. There are some great seafood market stalls here too - clean and the products are fresh from the ocean that\'s just feet away. Overall it\'s a great place to explore when you\'re out in Puerto Penasco.

383556991.name: Great fun to look at their wares!
383556991.author: a TripAdvisor user
383556991.reviewBody: We always leave with awesome stuff from the Malecon! Dresses, toy guns, cigars, artwork, ect.\nBe prepared to sweat in the summer months. It\'s very humid on the water.\nBring cash, hardly any of the stores accept plastic!

381666850.name: Lots of noise, little signal
381666850.author: a TripAdvisor user
381666850.reviewBody: The Puerto Pe\u00f1asco Old Port was a good place to kill a couple hours and had a couple very enjoyable bars and cantinas, but was overall underwhelming. It is dominated by a market selling souvenirs and other trinkets with sellers hawking their wares the entire way. All the stores had the same items and most shared a back area airfoil had different entries.\n\nIf you were staying in a place with a kitchen, or had the ability to transport seafood safely it would be great. There were a couple vendors selling fresh-caught fish, shrimp, and oysters. But overall there isn\'t much going for the old port.

381260863.name: Typical Tourist Shopping Area, But Willing to Dicker
381260863.author: a TripAdvisor user
381260863.reviewBody: Old Port is a typical Mexican tourist shopping area with so many articles you just can\'t bear not to buy.  We picked up T-shirts, metal lawn ornament, a wooden Caterpillar excavator, and ladies hats.  Merchants were more than willing to dicker on prices and accepted the word "NO"  when you didn\'t want to buy. The sea food market was very popular although we did not buy any sea food.  But it did smell!  Our favorite restaurant in Old Port was The Point Restaurant. Overall it was fun to visit and shop for the day!

380422601.name: Old port (Malencon)
380422601.author: a TripAdvisor user
380422601.reviewBody: We spent most of the day strolling the streets and then had lunch. As stated in other reviews, the attentions of the sales people can be an irritation, but realize this is how it\'s done there. If you\'re the type that doesn\'t want to be bothered, don\'t engage in the first place. If you\'re this type then you\'ll be missing out on some genuinely warm and nice people. I got into the spirit and was soon wheeling and dealing and having a great time. I liked the atmosphere of the place and the vibe can\'t be beat. Will be returning asap.

378019103.name: Great Shops and Food
378019103.author: a TripAdvisor user
378019103.reviewBody: This is definitely a must when visiting Rocky Point. There are plenty of little shops and lots of fresh seafood options. There are quiet a few little bars to stop in and have a few drinks ocean side. We stop here and eat at the same restaurant every single time. They know us and are always welcoming.  When shopping, never accept their first offer on price! Plan to practice your haggling skills and be willing to walk away to get the best prices. We were there May 2016 and the weather was amazing! However, we have also gone in July before and it gets quiet hot mid-afternoon.  Go on a Sunday evening for a local family feel.

378018687.name: A Blend of MEXICO that tourists love
378018687.author: a TripAdvisor user
378018687.reviewBody: Lots of curios stores to shop, a fish market, watiers grabbing you to enter to their restaurant offering sea food, cold beer, micheladas and then a weel designed "explanada" to get the breeze of the ocean, if you go on week ends you will see many locals enjoying sunsets, tourist having fun. This place is unique.

377596980.name: Tequila Is My Lady!!!!
377596980.author: a TripAdvisor user
377596980.reviewBody: In the past twenty five years, Rocky Point has changed significantly!!! This once small and fabulous secluded resort has grown up.  Hotels, vendors selling trinkets are being replaced with high rises and made in China products!  Yes, great deals are available; more difficult to acquire.  Several great seafood restaurants.    Gorgeous women can be found at the night clubs w / Tequila pouring quickly!!

376827807.name: Fantastic shrimp!
376827807.author: a TripAdvisor user
376827807.reviewBody: Fun shopping.  We found a Bronco fish mobile for our son in Phoenix who is a big \nDenver Bronco fan.  Had a break with ice-cold beers and chips and salsa at Federicos Restaurant out on the back deck looking over the water.  Shopped some more and then had a delicious lunch at the Blue Marlin.  It is up a side street across from the church.  Food was great and so was the service.  But by far, the very best experience was buying huge, fresh shrimp at the fish market.  We bought 3 lbs and the seller cleaned them and removed the shells, but left the tails on.  One pound we made shrimp cocktails with.  The other two, we froze and brought back home.  We made a shrimp scampi and more shrimp cocktails.  We both agreed that was the very best shrimp we had ever had!  Next time we will bring a larger cooler!

376596798.name: tourist haunt there
376596798.author: a TripAdvisor user
376596798.reviewBody: The old port is a tourist haunt and souvenir market nice place to shop and walk around . You need to understand something about Mexico do not pay the 1st price quoted they love to hagger so enjoy

375751554.name: MEXICO AT ITS FINESTT
375751554.author: a TripAdvisor user
375751554.reviewBody: This used to be the fish market 45 years ago-now it\'s a vendor for every thing in this world-if you can fine it here it not made- clothing-drug stores-bars-restraints-strip-joints-massages--doctors--fishing  trips--shot bars-fun to bargin with the vendors offer them1/2 of what they are asking when they say no walk away YOU WELL GET IT

374360606.name: Must stop
374360606.author: a TripAdvisor user
374360606.reviewBody:
You can find good places to eat and drink.
Parking is a little tight.
Never had any issues with security.
You can do some shopping.
A must stop

374196006.name: Nice area with plenty to buy and drink.
374196006.author: a TripAdvisor user
374196006.reviewBody: This is a nice area with lots of shopping and lots of bars and restaurants. Prices are about the same from one shop to the next same with the bars and restaurants.

373859963.name: Great place to eat, walk and see the ocean.  Lots of shopping - a bit touristy but we expected it
373859963.author: a TripAdvisor user
373859963.reviewBody:
Nice little downtown area.  A bit crowded and might have to drive a bit to find parking.  Lots of shops selling silver, tee shirts and other trinkets.   We enjoyed wandering through the shops but there was quite a few assertive shop owners trying to get you to look in their shops.  We just said "no thanks" and kept moving.  

Bought some large, tasty, fresh shrimp we prepared for dinner at a very reasonable price.  One side of the market had quite a bit of seafood to choose from and it all looked like it had just been caught.  

Plenty of restaurants as well as a place to sit on a bench and take in the ocean views.   Definitely worth stopping to experience.

373827599.name: Typical Souvenirs
373827599.author: a TripAdvisor user
373827599.reviewBody: We were staying out at the beach in Los Conchos and came into town before we left to get halibut at the fish market which is very well priced. Otherwise it\'s just the usual souvenir shops and some bars. Stopped at one of the newer ones called Tekila Bar for a Margarita. Mexico towns like this don\'t much appeal to me anymore as the price of a drink is higher than I pay most places I usually go for happy hours. To me, it\'s just not worth it to get Mexican Insurance to come to the beach here. But maybe it\'s just that I have done it so many times over the years and enjoy traveling elsewhere these days.

372738233.name: Fun times with lots to see and eat and drink!
372738233.author: a TripAdvisor user
372738233.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking up and down the area full of shops bars and restaurants. We especially enjoyed the Satisfied Frog. Hands-down the very best salsa, and I am a salsa fanatic. The salsa here rivals that of hobby airs restaurant in Laguna Beach California. And that is saying a lot from me. With its old wood windows open up to let the breeze in and the easy relaxed atmosphere this restaurant at the very far south end is a must do. Their shrimp garlic pizza is to die for. We also enjoyed  restaurant The Point-!we had a delicious shrimp dish called shrimp Aguachiles. You sit on an outside patio that is literally over the water, it\'s just beautiful. There is the usual shopping for trinkets and little gifts for friends and family back home. It\'s a great place to spend an afternoon.

369976910.name: Fun!
369976910.author: a TripAdvisor user
369976910.reviewBody:
This was our first trip down to Puerto Penasco, and I'm so glad we went!!  How did I not know about this awesome, dog friendly place?!  
A lot of Mexican people can be off put by my large (formaly trained, and well behaved) dog, but many shop keepers allowed us to go in and look at things.  The walk along the port is fun and I like the various statues and art.  
We did have restaurant workers woo us, even with my dog, and enjoyed a lovely patio seat, private view of the ocean and a place called Pelicanos inside of Jose's Fish Market.
We don't speak Spanish, and the people there mostly speak English, so don't let that intimidate you.  We felt safe and enjoyed ourselves.  I only wish we had longer than a weekend, but we will return!

369969961.name: A fun place to visit
369969961.author: a TripAdvisor user
369969961.reviewBody: As an old Fishing port turned into shops and restuarants this is a nice place to stop at and check out. Don\'t forget to goto Lucky\'s for your free breakfast (which is huge) just by buying a $5 drink, which the bloody mary\'s are awesome! On the weekend there is music and locals having out as well.

369529173.name: Tourist trap
369529173.author: a TripAdvisor user
369529173.reviewBody: Used to be the original Penasco.  Seafood sales, local gathering spot, local restaurants.\nNow it is a tourist center where you can be hawked by salespeople when you drive by.\nStill there are some good restaurants there.

369220635.name: Nice Market place
369220635.author: a TripAdvisor user
369220635.reviewBody: If you are looking for souvenirs and enjoy a bit of hustle and negotiating, this is your place. Also has good food, lots of music, nice views. The pina coladas in a fresh pineapple is a must have.

368482114.name: Unfortunately, it makes you realize you are in Mexico
368482114.author: a TripAdvisor user
368482114.reviewBody:
We read that the Old Port has charm and history. We found it to be full of stores, some good restaurants like Don Julio, fish markets where you could buy fresh shrimp, clams, etc, but crowded and uncomfortable.

The major drawback is the street hustling that goes on continually. You can't park your car without someone trying to wash it for a tip, you can't walk by a restaurant without several waiters trying to talk you inside. You can't walk by a fish market of trinket store and not be set upon by someone pitching their products. It made walking down the sidewalk an unenjoyable experience. We couldn't wait to get back in our car. 

But the evening we went into town for dinner at Don Julios was good due to the excellent restaurant and we completely ignored all the hustling and even walked in the street to get away from it. Plus the car needed washing.

367205496.name: A must go if in PP...!
367205496.author: a TripAdvisor user
367205496.reviewBody: C\'mon...  You are in Mexico!  This is all part of the Mexico experience.  You can find some nice things there if you look hard enough!  Deals to be had.  Take a little side street for cigars...  the place has a humidor just to the right after you walk in.  If nothing else it\'s great for people watching!  Very friendly people, vendors...\nIf you are looking for seafood, fish, shrimp etc...  this is the place.  We bought 4 pounds of fresh shrimp and bbq\'d them up later and they were awesome.  Found $3 a pound for halibut.  Shrimp was $3, $4 and $5...   We bought 5 pounds and paid about $20 for the LARGE shrimp.  G

365531483.name: Short port with many restaurants and stores
365531483.author: a TripAdvisor user
365531483.reviewBody: Once you get there you\'ll easily be able to walk around it in less than an hour. Lots of places that sell Mariscos, all on the higher side price wise.

365524393.name: Nice visit
365524393.author: a TripAdvisor user
365524393.reviewBody: Quaint area with lots of shops, restaurants, great views of the water, and a few hidden gems for pottery and sculpture.  You\'ll need to walk off the main road a couple of blocks to find some of the local shops.  Fun day trek!

365510042.name: Nope, just nope
365510042.author: a TripAdvisor user
365510042.reviewBody: Drove around this place several times. No where to park, looked dirty, saw signs indicating you would need to pay for the bathroom. Vendors shoulder to shoulder, selling cheap junk.

363614535.name: fun little area to see when in Rocky point
363614535.author: a TripAdvisor user
363614535.reviewBody: Nice little shops,GREAT VIEWS from everywhere...Nice Friendly place..Have a drink and eat .WE WENT EARLY AND WATCHED THE AREA JUST WAKE UP. By the time we left it was getting very packed..If driving or taking a cab maybe park or get out about 2-3 blocks away and just walk to to the main area.\n

361839007.name: Shopping, food, spirits, and entertainment
361839007.author: a TripAdvisor user
361839007.reviewBody: A visit to the "Malecon" or Old Port area is a rite of passage on your visit to Puerto Penasco.  There are numerous shops (which can be a little high-pressure), restaurants, and Cantinas for your choice.  There is frequently live entertainment, especially on weekends and during spring-break, so it can get a little crowded and intense at times.

361019908.name: The centre of night life in Puerto Penasco/Rocky Point!
361019908.author: a TripAdvisor user
361019908.reviewBody: If you come for festive celebrations, Santa Semana or Rocky Point Motorcycle Rally in November, or for any other reason - Old Port is the place you want to be. Last week (Santa Semana 2016) it reminded me of NY - city that never sleeps! People were walking and dancing around at 3 am, live bands playing all kinds of music in bars and on the streets. Awesome experience, not much of a rest/sleep, but lots of fun.

357429807.name: Spring Break 2016
357429807.author: a TripAdvisor user
357429807.reviewBody: We always go to the Old Port or "Malecon" when we are in Puerto Penasco. Its always a pleasant touristy spot with a lot of souvenir shops and restaurants. During spring break its a totally different story. First thing I noticed was the trash in the streets. Piles and piles everywhere! Second were all the rowdy college kids. Scantily clad girls and drunk boys falling over themselves in the middle of the street. I mean yes its a lot of fun at night but stay away if you do not want to see that or have small children. There is also a ton of elotero carts to choose from where you can buy corn cocktails, on the cob, chips with salsa, etc. My favorite thing to do is rent an ATV and cruise the malecon and simply sightsee.

357093186.name: Great Shopping & Food! Bars & Festivities!
357093186.author: a TripAdvisor user
357093186.reviewBody: We stayed in the resort area but visited the Old Port a few times for great shopping and food. There was always a lot going on with bands and lively cantinas. They are doing some road construction so it is a pain to drive around now, but will be great when done. It is a 10 minute drive from the resort area and well worth the trip for souvenirs.

357053087.name: Spring Break
357053087.author: a TripAdvisor user
357053087.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking around and looking at the different items the shops had to offer. It is better to carry cash because a lot of the small shops don\'t have the credit card option.

357009280.name: An interesting experience
357009280.author: a TripAdvisor user
357009280.reviewBody: My wife and I went here for a vacation around spring break. This is one of the tourist areas that\'s good to visit. You can buy lots of souvenirs here and negotiate on the price which can be kinda fun. There\'s plenty of restaurants and many are very similar. All of them have pretty standard local seafood. There\'s a couple bars that are good. We went to tekila and it started to pick up around 10pm. Expect people trying to sell something to you every 10-20 feet and saying no a lot. It\'s just part of it.

356697666.name: Food and negotiations
356697666.author: a TripAdvisor user
356697666.reviewBody: Come here if you are in the mood for some food and free for all negotiating on everything.  You will be hit up as soon as you enter the area with anything and everything that can be sold to you.  I enjoy it while not everyone will.  This time we had great fresh coconut with lime and chile.  I never enjoyed coconut that much before.  Bought my daughter a luchador mask and myself a shell monster.  My son picked a Coca Cola truck made of wood.  Hit the pharmacia fo mother in law.  Took home 3 lbs of big shrimp for $20.  All in all a good visit.

355734983.name: Old Port a wonderful place to live and to just walk around everyday enjoying the locals.
355734983.author: a TripAdvisor user
355734983.reviewBody: I have lived here in the Old Port for a few years now. I love it down here as I don\'t really have to drive anywhere. I have all the shops and restaurant/bars right around the corner. Beautiful sunsets from the balcony, couldn\'t ask for more.

355418455.name: Fresh  FISH!
355418455.author: a TripAdvisor user
355418455.reviewBody: We took home pounds of fresh shrimp and in season asparagus this trip.  If you can\'t make Rodeo Drive for shopping, there is PLENTY of it to do here. The vendors really want your business.  Parking is difficult during busy hours.

355321091.name: Always fun!!
355321091.author: a TripAdvisor user
355321091.reviewBody: We go to Old Port every time we are in Rocky Point!! We love the charm of the area and always enjoy the local shops. The people are always friendly. The foods always fresh and delicious! A must visit when in Rocky Point!!

355297095.name: Nice market area, beware of fish sold
355297095.author: a TripAdvisor user
355297095.reviewBody: Shopping and eating tourist area. We enjoyed looking at the souvenirs and walking along the port. The merchants are happy to bargain. The restaurant menu looked good. We decided to buy fresh fish to bring home. Be careful, they tell you it\'s a day old caught, more like 2 weeks old. When we got it home, it smelled very fishy. Fresh fish caught has no smell. Next time, we will ask to open the bag to smell. We ended tossing $30 worth of seabass and red snapper.   Lesson learned on this.

354452321.name: Best smelling fish market EVER!
354452321.author: a TripAdvisor user
354452321.reviewBody: Food is fresh and well prepared even in the tiniest of restaurants. Thy compete to try to get you to come in but the menus and prices are similar. The El Captain restaurant does a 1/2 price special menu ever day until 4 and they have great views over the harbour

353860230.name: Hounded to death
353860230.author: a TripAdvisor user
353860230.reviewBody: We walked the shops and we were hounded to death by the shop owners. You have to say NO 100 times. Was not digging that. I realize this is a tourist trap with tons of shops but I hate how much pressure they use to get you to buy something. I couldn\'t wait to leave!

353099458.name: Shop and Eat
353099458.author: a TripAdvisor user
353099458.reviewBody: Typical Mexican tourist trap with souvenir shopping for the ladies.  Lots of Hawkers and irritating people trying to get your attention.  Nice walk with rocky beach in background.  Good selection of restaurants.

351728043.name: Definitely worth the visit - a blast from the past
351728043.author: a TripAdvisor user
351728043.reviewBody: Old Port maintains that feel and look of years gone by.  Definitely worth the visit, and the best place to buy shrimp.  A quaint and fun part of Puerto Penasco

351696939.name: A Fun Walk
351696939.author: a TripAdvisor user
351696939.reviewBody: Old Port is awesome to walk. You can see so much stuff. Bring your cash because there is so much to see and buy. There are so many little stores and the people are willing to bargain. They are really friendly. A fun place to walk day or night

350930300.name: Great Shopping & Restaurants
350930300.author: a TripAdvisor user
350930300.reviewBody: Love strolling around the Malecon during the early morning after breakfast.  Lucky\'s breakfast can\'t be beat!  The staff is friendly and fun!

350924749.name: rocky point good times
350924749.author: a TripAdvisor user
350924749.reviewBody: great place to go shopping, eating, drinking, relaxing enjoy the sunset , bring your happy face and put it on!!!!

350585579.name: Good Shopping
