350585579.author: a TripAdvisor user
350585579.reviewBody: A nice place to shopping for T-shirts etc. Also some good restaurants, except they all want you to go to there\'s. It gets old but they are polite. Your car will get cleaned up to so prepare for a tip.

349004255.name: Authentic
349004255.author: a TripAdvisor user
349004255.reviewBody: This is definitely a place that is reflective of Puerto Penasco, Mexico.  With shops and restaurants and vendors of all kinds, Old Port should be a "definite" must see when visiting the area.  The people are so nice and very helpful.  Bargain all you want, but be respectful, knowing this is how they make a living.

348522797.name: Its small but just wonderful!!!!!
348522797.author: a TripAdvisor user
348522797.reviewBody: Great fun stretch with good restaurants, fun shops and absolutely astounding fish merchants.  Have never seen such quality and good prices.  Wonderful!!!

346593236.name: Nice Clean Area
346593236.author: a TripAdvisor user
346593236.reviewBody: Lots of places to eat and shop for Mexican goods and souvenirs.  Good walking area.  In the evenings several Mariachi groups gather and play music.  I love this music.  My favorite all time is Guadalajara!  Also a good place to buy fresh shrimp.

345955226.name: Great Ocean Views
345955226.author: a TripAdvisor user
345955226.reviewBody: The usual Mexican tourista stuff.  Always too expensive but many of the restaurants in the viscinity are excellent...some not so.

345858013.name: Malecon
345858013.author: a TripAdvisor user
345858013.reviewBody: The Malecon was very nice, unfortunately because of the time of year we went it was pretty empty. However it was beautiful and I look forward to returning when its livelier.

344676514.name: Great Place Great Atmosphere
344676514.author: a TripAdvisor user
344676514.reviewBody: Went for late lunch with my wife. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Service was prompt, food was very well prepared and the presentation equally good. Have to try their Mexican breakfast buffet next, hear it\'s excellent. Love the open sitting areas too.

344016996.name: Everything that Rocky Point offers is here.
344016996.author: a TripAdvisor user
344016996.reviewBody: This is the center of attention for Rocky Point. Many restaurants, bars, fresh seafood food from the ocean and shops. Parking can be a challenge but be patient. The locals are aggressive in trying to get ones attention and business. This can be enjoyable morning noon or night. A must stop for any first time visitor.

343885570.name: ,Downtown tour
343885570.author: a TripAdvisor user
343885570.reviewBody: This is a very nice area, clean and with a lot of security, traffic control, only one way to avoid trafic problems, a lot of people walking around, all mixed, tourists and locals. A big number of restaurants of all kinds. Great cuisine, mexican, italian, american, sea food, snacks, etc.

342904862.name: Day Trip Fun
342904862.author: a TripAdvisor user
342904862.reviewBody: Headed to old port for a day away from our resort.  It was fun and there were lots of vendors selling everything you really don\'t need. Kids enjoyed the day and then we headed back to the resort.  Next time we will plan to have lunch at one of the restaurants .

342793592.name: A lot of junk
342793592.author: a TripAdvisor user
342793592.reviewBody: This experience in no way compares to shopping in Puerto Vallarta, if that is the experience you are looking for.  A lot of low end product with store clerks that won\'t get out of your way and let you look.  The area is dirty and not maintained well.  Very disappointing.  Not worth the time spent driving there.

340832950.name: Good shopping
340832950.author: a TripAdvisor user
340832950.reviewBody: Lots of different items for sale, prices reasonable.  It is a little off the beaten path, ask for help finding it if you have plans to go there.  There are quite a few shops, it has the flavor of a typical Mexican shopping area.

339967165.name: Great shopping and dining
339967165.author: a TripAdvisor user
339967165.reviewBody: This is a fun place to go on your trip. Lots of dining options and drinking options! A great place to go shopping or just taking in the atmosphere.

339742319.name: Great shopping
339742319.author: a TripAdvisor user
339742319.reviewBody: You can find anything in the Malecon.  It was fun to go down there and experience the "mall".  My kids enjoyed interacting with the shop keepers and learning things from them.\n

338456488.name: Heart of city
338456488.author: a TripAdvisor user
338456488.reviewBody: All the required sidewalk shops, similar tourist stuff at each, everythings starts at $25 or $15 but just look uninterested and price comes down.  Mary\'s has good shrimp cocktail...not full shrimp like in states, but pieces with lots of salsa type sauce...ok, but costly.  Great view of bay from upper level.  Tekila Bar is new and learning.  Nice views from upper outside deck. Nachos would have been better with grated cheese, but made mistake of ordering nacho cheese.....sauce seemed out of can...not so great.  Margarita\'s were good.  Pricey for what you get.  Malecon fish shops great place to get fresh shrimp to take home....huge and yummy, and they clean them for you if asked...go over again to be sure once you get them home.

338175192.name: Fun place
338175192.author: a TripAdvisor user
338175192.reviewBody: If you go to Puerto Penasco (or Rocky Point), you have to make a trip down to Old Port.  Lots of hustling happening - you will learn quickly that you have to say NO many times!  We got really large jumbo shrimp for $7.00 per pound.  However, be careful - some of their scales are not right.  We turned down one vendor\'s shrimp because his one pound looked more that 1/2 pound.  There is a beautiful plaza area with large statues overlooking the sea.

337944866.name: Bike Week - Nov 2015
337944866.author: a TripAdvisor user
337944866.reviewBody: The thousands of bikes, huge crowds, music, and food were simply amazing!  Added to our great times with family and friends!  :)

335222556.name: get ready to dicker
335222556.author: a TripAdvisor user
335222556.reviewBody: Abundant shops, restaurants and bars.  Our auto was washed as we toured and ate in this area.  Auto washing is common for a small gratuity.  I donated $2.00 and later realized I probably paid too much.  You cannot walk 5 feet in this area without being confronted by a sales pitch from an eager Mexican vendor.  Everyone wants your business and dollars.  If you want jewelry, clothing, dust collectors, rugs, hats, ice cream, food, drinks, fresh seafood to take home....this is the place.  Never pay asking price.  Don\'t be scared to walk away even if you want the article.  The sales people will lower the price immediately if you start to walk away.  We purchased items between 60 percent of asking price to as little as 10 percent of asking price.  Fun for an afternoon but tiring after awhile.  Drive slow in this area, 5 mph at best.  It is a miracle people don\'t get run over on an hourly basis.

334806789.name: Old port puerto penasco mexico
334806789.author: a TripAdvisor user
334806789.reviewBody: Very quaint and beautiful. Took the Eco fun sunset cruise and then a day tour of the old port and rocky point town. Many souvenir shops and restaurants. The water front provides outstanding views of the sea of Cortez as well as the marina area and shipyard. The fishing and shrimping fleet provided many photo opportunities.   The fisherman riding the large shrimp in the plaza is a great monument to those industries that was so important to the area.  We felt very safe touring the area.  We are not souvenir shoppers but was able to find a nice jewelry store for silver bracelets and other nice pieces. \n\nHighly recommend at least a half day in the old port area.

333340440.name: So much fun!
333340440.author: a TripAdvisor user
333340440.reviewBody: Good restaurants, good bars, good shopping...very nice place to stroll around...I found it to be very safe...

333264994.name: A great Place to shop for Fresh Fish
333264994.author: a TripAdvisor user
333264994.reviewBody: We visited the Malecon Daily to buy fresh fish.   There are many Vendors and the prices range from 3-6$ a pound for grouper, shrimp, flounder etc.  The only thing we bought that was not great were the Scallops all else were amazing. They will bag in Ice for you.

332984228.name: Must see
332984228.author: a TripAdvisor user
332984228.reviewBody: This is the high point of Puerto Penasco.  Lots of small stores to explore each with their own touch. The area is small enough to walk to all of them in a few days of exploring. You will want to come back more than once to sample the various restaurants as well.

331892627.name: Sunsets at their best!
331892627.author: a TripAdvisor user
331892627.reviewBody: Strolling the waterfront as the sun sets is absolutely beautiful! Take a moment to soak it all in and really enjoy the moment.

331000185.name: If you don\'t like to be aggressively hawked, don\'t even bother!
331000185.author: a TripAdvisor user
331000185.reviewBody: The shops are terrible at the Old Port. Every shop has the exact same junk. I cannot tolerate having the vendors aggressively hawk you as you walk by.  We were even offered illegal drugs.

330067855.name: Extremely expensive!
330067855.author: a TripAdvisor user
330067855.reviewBody: This place is as expensive as when I went to Paris  France! \nWill never go back because although people  is friendly, prices are high as they can be.

329851350.name: Great food and fresh fish shrimp!
329851350.author: a TripAdvisor user
329851350.reviewBody: Try Mary\'s Restaurant as the food is delicious!  We bought shrimp from the Two Brothers shrimp market and they peeled and deveined the shrimp for us for about $6 a pound for large shrimp.

329619545.name: Shop till you drop
329619545.author: a TripAdvisor user
329619545.reviewBody: This place has more shopping than all of rocky point. This area is also called the Fish Market or Malecon.

329438992.name: Too touristy!!
329438992.author: a TripAdvisor user
329438992.reviewBody: Had some good food at Mary\'s. Bought some decent souvenirs for family and got the heck back to the beach. Will probably go again next trip, but it\'s definitely not why I came.

328723535.name: Great fresh seafood and trinkets!
328723535.author: a TripAdvisor user
328723535.reviewBody: First time here but we were recommend by a local to eat at Mary\'s restaurant, everything was very delicious!  OMG we all loved it, it was so good!  We had a 2 person plate with shrimp and flounder and the kids had shrimp cocktails.  Very affordable also.  Trinkets are a mix of bootlegged items and clothing and traditional Mexican souvenirs.  We will be back if at least to buy fresh shrimp, fish and even to eat one of other restaurants.

328448953.name: Tourist bargaining and restaurants
328448953.author: a TripAdvisor user
328448953.reviewBody: This is a great place to try your negotiating skills as everyone has a "great deal" for you.  You just have to figure out much better the deal can get.  We bargained for a nice blown glass pitcher and set of glasses as well as trinkets for the kids as souvenirs. You often get a better deal bargaining one more than one item at a time.  We had a nice walk around the port before picking a restaurant.  There are also plenty of pharmacies if you are in town for that.  Expect to be hit up for change for washing your window or watching your car.  We had a nice time and took home shrimp to cook for dinner.

328392121.name: fun
328392121.author: a TripAdvisor user
328392121.reviewBody: They had a lot of drinks,great  food andplenty of little shops! everyone was so nice down there and welcomed us!

327621600.name: Great Views with Friendly People
327621600.author: a TripAdvisor user
327621600.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to gather in the evenings - frequently there is music and there are always vendors and shops.

320693379.name: A must for tourists!
320693379.author: a TripAdvisor user
320693379.reviewBody: Lots of fun to wander down the Malecon and browse the shops. The shopkeepers will hawk and try to bring you in, but "no, gracias" is an OK answer. Bargaining is acceptable, but remember to be respectful and acknowledge that their item is nice, it\'s just that the price is too high. There are some nice restaurants along the Malecon as well as fish and shrimp stalls to buy fresh catch!

320549286.name: Old port has a lot to offer
320549286.author: a TripAdvisor user
320549286.reviewBody: We have been going to "Old Port" for 30 years.  It has changed a lot in that time.  It is a great place to get the feel of the shrimp vendors, good small restaurants and lots of Mexican shopping.  It is a must if you go to Puerto Penasco..

319410267.name: Charming, Charming, Charming
319410267.author: a TripAdvisor user
319410267.reviewBody: Old Port is surprisingly real given it is a tourist destination. The shop keepers are friendly and engaging without a hard sell edge to them like so many others. A great stop if your in Puerto Penasco.

314155741.name: Went and checked it out
314155741.author: a TripAdvisor user
314155741.reviewBody: My husband and I took a taxi from our hotel, very nice taxi driver; we walked around, bought a few things and then a person with"credentials" approached us to see if we wanted to do a boat ride.  He made it sound so good we decided to do it.  Horrible experience, the only nice thing about it was the live band. Make sure you ask the hotel personnel to recommend the boat rides before you book one at the old port.

312240364.name: A must see and do... once
312240364.author: a TripAdvisor user
312240364.reviewBody: A very touristic place packed with souvenir stores and some very good restaurant. Do not miss the sunset from the Malecon or the stairway by the plaza in front of it. We were a family of two couples and two children and we felt completely save and relaxed.

309313166.name: Bit of everything in one spot
309313166.author: a TripAdvisor user
309313166.reviewBody: Great place to eat fresh seafood, walk around check out all the shops and get a drink! \nEverything you need in one spot. Great place to sit on an upper deck restaurant or bar and people watch

308816352.name: A Little Bit of Everything
308816352.author: a TripAdvisor user
308816352.reviewBody: You can get fresh seafood year round from the many vendors especially shrimp. They also have many souvenir stores or stands something for everyone. Many good choices for bars and restaurants are available also.

308574847.name: take pesos...have a dosXX and enjoy people watching at luckys
308574847.author: a TripAdvisor user
308574847.reviewBody: its cool to buy your t-shirts have a cold beer...the best was "luckys cantina..... the fish was the best we had...lots of time share people bugging you, but if you get them off you can enjoy bargaining for everything else...also if your thinking of going on a boat ride only go on echo or pirate...the others are overcrowded and very unsafe.

306810378.name: Relaxing day of sight seeing.
306810378.author: a TripAdvisor user
306810378.reviewBody: Good mix of restaurants, shops and entertainment. The sidewalks need to be kept cleaned. We felt safe throughout the area. The restaurants had great seating with views of the water. The shrimp shopping was plentiful.

304165917.name: Nice afternoon walk, small but fun, great place to take first timers
304165917.author: a TripAdvisor user
304165917.reviewBody: If you\'ve been to a Mexican market before you\'ll know what to expect.  Fun place to walk around, expect the same general trinkets you\'ll see with beach vendors, but with the bonus of restaurants and bars nearby.  Easy place to spend an hour or two

301521495.name: It\'s enjoyable
301521495.author: a TripAdvisor user
301521495.reviewBody: It has tons of little stores. They def repetitive though. There are lots of people trying to sell you lots of things. Tried a little restaurant that overlooked the water called Federico\'s and it was just okay. Nothing special.

298895560.name: Shopping and Dining
298895560.author: a TripAdvisor user
298895560.reviewBody: Lots of bargains, shopping, and haggling for the best price to be found! They also had restaurants, and views of the beach, as well as access to the marina.

297578450.name: Small but has all the needs
297578450.author: a TripAdvisor user
297578450.reviewBody: This is not a large area. Basically 3 blocks long. The food is awesome especially the shrimp. They do have $25.00 all you can drink all day, so if you are spending the day around it is well worth the money.

296079915.name: Must come to see the port while in town
296079915.author: a TripAdvisor user
296079915.reviewBody: We came and bought shrimp every morning. The traditional stores ate nearby. The port offers souvenir shopping for all things Mexico. Plenty of options for fine cuisine too.

295127837.name: Bleh!
295127837.author: a TripAdvisor user
295127837.reviewBody: Dirty tourist trap with cheap over-priced trinkets made in China. Vendors are pushy and will try to rob you blind.  GREAT restaurants though so if you\'re hungry, it\'s worth a visit.  Eat at Sr. Amigos and get the shrimp ceviche!

294712667.name: Fun place to eat lunch!
294712667.author: a TripAdvisor user
294712667.reviewBody: We stopped in Old Port after a morning on the dunes. We had a great lunch at Pedro\'s and then did some shopping! We did not go on the weekend but I am sure it would be amazing on a weekend evening!

294571651.name: Nice for pictures and to walk around
294571651.author: a TripAdvisor user
294571651.reviewBody: Good to walk around the stores and take pictures of el Malecon.  they have free parking and offer a lot of boat rides and party boats. YOu can  eat there or buy shrimp or sea food to cook at the hotel or home.

294134860.name: You find everything at the Malecon!
294134860.author: a TripAdvisor user
294134860.reviewBody: Love the Malecon, you can find everything there food, clothes, Pe\u00f1asco items, medicine, ice cream. My family just enjoys spending one afternoon of our trip there.

292337915.name: Better than would think
292337915.author: a TripAdvisor user
292337915.reviewBody: The artwork and sea side news are beautiful.\nLots of local wares--a bit touristy--and busy.\nPlenty of places to eat and drink or just enjoy a walk along the water.  Even saw seals playing and plenty of Pelicans diving for fish.  Even to just slowly drive thru is fun

292242573.name: not impressed
292242573.author: a TripAdvisor user
292242573.reviewBody: Vendors tried pulling my husband into shop after shop to sell him illegal drugs while we were walking around with our two kids.  I would have enjoyed a chance to wander about and browse hassle free.

290482716.name: enjoy the thrill of old and new
290482716.author: a TripAdvisor user
290482716.reviewBody: new and updated  areas to the Malecon are nice additions. new restaurant options off the visitor a great taste of local specialties. do a variety. many vendors to solve your touristy tastes as well

289887459.name: Quaint Mexican fishing village.
289887459.author: a TripAdvisor user
289887459.reviewBody: The old port is full of shrimping boat as some of the freshest seafood you will find anywhere very quaint very unique very old style is that at least once crystal blue water great sandy beaches

286857191.name: Small, dirty but still worth a visit!
286857191.author: a TripAdvisor user
286857191.reviewBody: If you are in Porto Penasco, you shouldn\'t miss the Old Port. You won\'t find anything special there but you could have a nice dinner or just a drink in one of many restaurants, buy some souvenirs etc. Of course, be ready to haggle for the price. Just a hint for Cigars lovers -  I purchased Cuban Cohiba 5 cigar box for 25$ (starting price was 50$).

286809317.name: Malecon
286809317.author: a TripAdvisor user
286809317.reviewBody: You have to visit the Malecon and eat at Flavios it was good. All the restaurants have a great view of the ocean

286022863.name: Locals and tourists, shrimp to serapes, with ocean breezes
286022863.author: a TripAdvisor user
286022863.reviewBody: The malecon is a large pedestrian area  along the waterfront.  Lots of ships, vendors of various types, nice place for a stroll after dinner.

285818411.name: Old Port- a little piece of Mexican Flavor
285818411.author: a TripAdvisor user
285818411.reviewBody: I wish I would have known more about the restaurants here before I came into the town.  The street vendors were fun and my kids learned how to haggle for what they wanted.

284928781.name: don\'t buy at first price
284928781.author: a TripAdvisor user
284928781.reviewBody: Lots of booths selling every type of souvenir imaginable.  They are willing to negotiate.  For example, a bag my daughter wanted was $40.  After negotiation we paid $20.  Every purchase we made was lowered when we started to leave without it.  The food there is great.  If you like shopping, you will love this place.

284913299.name: Shopping and resturants
284913299.author: a TripAdvisor user
284913299.reviewBody: Many options for shopping however once you have seen one shop you have basically seen them all. One the opposite side of the street you will see more restaurants and vendors with fresh shrimp and others options. Worth seeing if in area however we didn\'t spend more than an hour at the Port.

284853651.name: Old Port of a time
284853651.author: a TripAdvisor user
284853651.reviewBody: lots to see, shopping, fresh seafood to purchase. Lots restaurants to choose from.  Loved trying prepared mangos with chamoy and fresh pina coladas.  Be prepared to be approached be every shop keeper and restaurant to buy something and eat at their restaurant. You will learn your bargaining skills there. Never pay full price.

283972977.name: Small mexican beach boardwalk.
283972977.author: a TripAdvisor user
283972977.reviewBody: Just a bunch of vendors and the restaurants are not as good as those in the city but cater to tourist. This boardwalk is very small compared to other Mexican beaches.

282753456.name: Mexican Market and Restaurants
282753456.author: a TripAdvisor user
282753456.reviewBody: We enjoyed this area which has alot of vendors and restaurants.\nIf you are looking for the usual mexican jewelery, pottery, etc. you will find it here. Some good restaurants too. Easy to get to from anywhere in town. On the water and busy.

281694526.name: Fun side trip
281694526.author: a TripAdvisor user
281694526.reviewBody: Lots of trinket stores....nice places for seafood and cocktails...vendors aren\'t too pushy.  Remember to barter :-)

281382581.name: This is Mexico at it\'s best. Food, Shopping and a view of the surf and Ocean.
281382581.author: a TripAdvisor user
281382581.reviewBody: This is MEXICO at it\'s best.  Shopping, night life and Sea Food restaurants.  Fun Place!  Haggle for lower prices for tourist stuff, Eat the freshest Sea Food you will ever have, and see how the Mexican people enjoy there plaza\'s and public areas.  This is a great place to people watch.  The People are warm and friendly.  Eat and enjoy everything about Mexico.

281224821.name: Best place to spend a week in Puerto Penasco
281224821.author: a TripAdvisor user
281224821.reviewBody:
20+ bars/restaurants (seafood, Mexican, American, ice cream, coffee, etc.), 40+ stores (mostly gift shoppes, glassware, leather goods, LOTS of t-shirts), convenience store, gas station, fish markets.

Tips:  don't go during Easter Week because the entire town is jammed, the street(s) closed and many good restaurants are also closed.  Parking is limited, so use the free parking to the right as you enter the main port.

Shop as early as possible (9-11 am) for the best haggling and to avoid the stifling heat in summer.

They even have a BAR wagon (like a food wagon, but with liquor) or two.  Amazing.

Have fun!

281026430.name: Enjoyable place for food and drinks and shopping
281026430.author: a TripAdvisor user
281026430.reviewBody:
If you have never been to a fishing village before you are in for a treat. This place has lots of great restaurants and bars for an entertaining evening.

The first thing you want to do is see all the variety of fresh fish the fishermen have brought back from their catch.
The fisherman will weigh out whatever your desired weight of seafood is and charge you by the market price where you can take it to a restaurant to be cooked or you can take it back to the condo and make some fresh fish tacos.

280599738.name: On the water, food, drinks, market!
280599738.author: a TripAdvisor user
280599738.reviewBody: A fun place to grab a bite, get some drinks, listen to music and haggle with the merchants. The large market is the focus of Old Port but next up are the bars and restaurants. Oh, and the fish market, lots of fresh seafood!

278773252.name: busy streets
278773252.author: a TripAdvisor user
278773252.reviewBody: a parking spot was hard to find,but once you did there is lots of shopping and plenty of choices for food.

278726122.name: Fun for an hour or so
278726122.author: a TripAdvisor user
278726122.reviewBody: It was fun to go bargain hunting for about an hour. After awhile the constant in your face sales gets old.

278163485.name: Another great trip to Puerto Penasco
278163485.author: a TripAdvisor user
278163485.reviewBody: I have been visiting with family and friends to Penasco for about 9 years now. While it is a tourist destination if you get off the main road it still has some Mexico village feel. The Hotels along Sandy Beach are great. My preference has been The Sonoran Sun as all rooms are within a up close view and ear shot of the ocean ( Mar de Cortez). These hotels / condos offer all the comforts of home. The Malecon offer all of your typical Mexico features; good food, drinks, music and many shops to purchase your souvenirs. On a Saturday night in can get a little wild with 20+ bandas y mucho cerveza. There are many local families and state friends there to listen and watch the show. Que tengas un buen tiempo amigos !

277680184.name: Its is Fun for what it is a touristy spot but I still like it.
277680184.author: a TripAdvisor user
277680184.reviewBody: Old port hustles and bustles with the fish market and shops and resteraunts. Noisy and crowded and thats the charm.  Ill go back and have lunch or dinner.

277088435.name: Old Port
277088435.author: a TripAdvisor user
277088435.reviewBody: Stopped here to shop and have breakfast, which was excellent. Everything from key chains to decor to fresh seafood was for sale here. Vendors can be a bit pushy so just be kind but firm, I didn\'t have a problem haggling. Lovely views of ocean and at night live music. Slower pace during week compared to weekends. FYI if not using bar or restaurant restroom it will cost you 50 cents to use public restrooms.

276148236.name: Lots to see, good food
276148236.author: a TripAdvisor user
276148236.reviewBody: We ate at several restaurants in the Old Port and liked every one. We ate at the upper floor restaurants along the water, above the fish markets and had amazing fresh fish and shrimp tacos. Vendors try to sell you stuff as you walk through the streets, but they leave you alone if you give them a polite, "No, gracias".

275764804.name: Interesting shopping experience
275764804.author: a TripAdvisor user
275764804.reviewBody: The shops in Old Port all seem to sell basically the same items, and, as typical in Mexico, nothing is priced,  You need to negotiate for everything.  Very interesting walking around.

275372392.name: It\'s ok...
275372392.author: a TripAdvisor user
275372392.reviewBody: There\'s not a whole lot to do in PP, ultimately we always find ourselves in Old Port walking around. The shopping is all the same souvenirs, horrendously overpriced sold by very pushy sales people. I understand these folks have families to feed but I wish they didn\'t push so hard, it\'s uncomfortable. On the plus side, we love the restaurants and fresh seafood vendors in Old Port. Watching the sunset over the water at the waterfront park is amazing and my kids love playing with the local kids when we are there. I wish they offered more locally made arts and crafts in the shopping area.

274546807.name: so fun
274546807.author: a TripAdvisor user
274546807.reviewBody: Old Port was so fun! There was a ton of shopping to do and the exciting part was being able to talk with the locals and see how life is here for them. they sell really neat nick nacks so be sure to check it out!

274009190.name: More than T-Shirts and bars
274009190.author: a TripAdvisor user
274009190.reviewBody: You have to visit here (basically downtown) at least once while you\'re in Rocky Pt. It\'s the place for t-shirts and nightlfe although there are better "clubs" elsewhere. Pretty typical for a Mexican resort except for the fish markets. The real attraction is the central plaza with the statue honoring the Shrimpers who actually built the town. It\'s one of the few cultural things to see. If you want to shop go to "Rodeo Drive" on Cholla.

273464582.name: Great views, interesting vendors and lots of food choices
273464582.author: a TripAdvisor user
273464582.reviewBody: This is a great place to go while visiting Puerto Penasco. There is free parking on the east end....look for the arches. If you park in a regular parking spot (if you are lucky enough to find one) you will have to tip the guy holding your car hostage for washing it anyway so we opted for the free parking lot. You will be bombarded by time-share sellers coming out of the parking lot...they won\'t say that\'s the bottom line but will offer you free or discounted meals, etc. but ultimately they want you to buy a condo. A polite no seems to do the trick. That works with vendors too. There are some great architecture and statues down by the water and a myriad of restaurants and bars to choose from. This is definitely a must do for first time visitors to RP. Where else can you buy an Arizona Cardinals Day of the Dead skull?

273455945.name: A must stop
273455945.author: a TripAdvisor user
273455945.reviewBody: We always have at least one meal in the old port.  We aren\'t much for shopping but there is definitely a great variety of trinkets and clothes from mild to absurd to satisfy all tastes.  Worth a little stroll and possible sit down to take in all the goings on.

272322235.name: Old Port for Shopping and Eats
272322235.author: a TripAdvisor user
272322235.reviewBody: A walk through Old Port is a must for first-time visitors, and a never-ending place to explore for repeat visitors as well. Shopping is mostly of the tourist / souvenir variety, with the exception of a shop or two carrying fine, higher-end jewelry and d\u00e9cor. Interspersed among the many shops are bars and eateries which -- after many years of visiting Penasco -- I have not completed exploring. While I intend to try each restaurant, It is difficult to resist lunch with panoramic views at Casa Del Capitan (next to the lighthouse overlooking Old Port), followed by a drive down to Old Port for shopping and sightseeing.  While the Malecon (the seaside portion of Old Port) is the busiest and most diverse, I never miss a stop at "Mercedes" on the way out (on Jose Alcantara Blvd.) across from another fun restaurant, Friendly Dolphin.  Some of the nicest-quality d\u00e9cor, dinnerware, etc. can be found there. Old Port is a great place to feel the heart of Penasco.

272252269.name: "A Must See"
272252269.author: a TripAdvisor user
272252269.reviewBody: Lots of shops, restaurants, many fresh seafood vendors, nice architecture, statues and views.  A bit of a hard-sell by vendors but it\'s all in fun (almost free) and they\'re only trying to make a living.  It\'s a definite must to check out.

272246884.name: Shopping / Bargaining in Old Port
272246884.author: a TripAdvisor user
272246884.reviewBody:
There certainly are a LOT of vendors selling a huge variety of goods . . . jewelry, hats, mens and ladies clothing, pottery, blankets and MORE blankets .... then there are the sunglasses .... oh, and the sea food ... not only fresh, but the seafood restaurants ! 
Narrow sidewalks in places, with somewhat aggressive merchants,  but non threatening and no hands on contact. ( It is how many make their living so not much different than many American Farmer's Markets )
Most merchants are located on the Malecon ( Circunvalación y o Malecón ) but many are on the side streets and inland a few blocks. We felt totally safe on the Malecon as well as many blocks inland. 
There are public restrooms and a great city Plaza area right on the water to stop and relax for a while.
A fun experience while in Puerto Peñasco, for shopping as well as dining.

270470720.name: Always love Old Port (Malecon)
270470720.author: a TripAdvisor user
270470720.reviewBody: Lots of bars, lots of shopping, and you can buy your shrimp and fish to take back home!  The nicest people in Rocky Point, hard working and they will clean your windshield and help you back up when you are ready to leave.  Very much the tourist area of town, but still you can find decent restaurants (Viva Mexico taco restaurant is our fave).

270435259.name: Lots of Fun
270435259.author: a TripAdvisor user
270435259.reviewBody: Great bustling area, still nice to shop as the vendors are non-aggressive and fun.  Can barter and it is expected.  Plenty of places to eat and lots of good food.  There were hundreds of shops with beautiful merchandise.  I had a great time and lots of super photo opportunities.

268949700.name: Great Place--Rocky PT
268949700.author: a TripAdvisor user
268949700.reviewBody: As an avid traveler, Port Penasco/Rocky Point is a well kept secret!  Located on the Sea of Cortez--several hours by vehicle from Tucson. AZ.  First, be careful when driving through Mexico!! Second, the areas surrounding the beaches are not paved!  Highly recommend an off road or 4WD vehicle.  Great inexpensive restaurants, shops and liquor is quicker. Lodging is inexpensive...make reservations!!  Spring Break does get Wild with large crowds!  Beaches are clean, few trees and temperature can climb above 130F. Great visibility for scuba diving. Night Clubs are high energy and Tequila Flows like a water fall!  Definitely no disappointments!

267614721.name: Good to be back!
267614721.author: a TripAdvisor user
267614721.reviewBody:
It's been two years since we've been down here and what a change. Lots more activity, new restaurants.  We got some really good grouper and shrimp from Mr. Fish.  We cooked it and are it, so we had to come back for more to take home.

Ate at the Friendly Dolphin and it was very good.  Glad they give you chips and salsa now, even without ordering guacamole, although we did and with the addition of a little salt, it was good , too.

Had a nice Sunday breakfast buffet at Ramon's at the Sonoran Sea, where we were staying.  Excellent , with anything you could think of for breakfast.

We've been home only two days and I'm ready to go back.

Only bad thing, my husband got a ticket ( which included a trip to the police station) for running a stop sign in town in Sat night.  He was definitely guilty and they could have also charged him with 
speeding, which , thankfully, they did not.  Perhaps he has learned to watch for the little Alto signs and stop whether or not the locals do.

265840970.name: fun - what you would expect
265840970.author: a TripAdvisor user
265840970.reviewBody: Well it is exactly what it says - the old port area of town.  Lots of shows selling stuff and places to eat.  We did not eat here but visited a couple of times during our stay just to poke around in the shops and do something different than laying on the beach,  The prices are pretty fair - about what you would expect at tourist shops but the kids enjoyed it.  We purchased fish and shrimp here and it was all fresh and cooked up delicious.

265680017.name: Fun Shopping and Restaurants
265680017.author: a TripAdvisor user
265680017.reviewBody: If you go to Puerto Penasco, you have to go to Old Port!  There are lots of shops and good restaurants.  Just go with the flow!

264113463.name: Old Port visit
264113463.author: a TripAdvisor user
264113463.reviewBody: Want shrimp? You got it .Want souvenirs? You got it. A great walk on the Malecon. Very fun, be nice to the vendors. Park on the right at the bottom of the hill  the hill, just before you go to left, no charge.

262259183.name: Lots of shops and friendly vendors.  Good places to eat and lots of activities on the malecon.
262259183.author: a TripAdvisor user
262259183.reviewBody: We love the little children and some have very inventive ways to earn money.  There was a little band of 5 children, 2 drummers, a vocalist and the nino with a horn made with a plastic bucket and a hose.  Of course we rewarded them for their effort and entertainment.

262075135.name: Great Place for Pictures
262075135.author: a TripAdvisor user
262075135.reviewBody: wonderful views, nice historical statues, great places to eat. The old port is definitely worth going to on your visit

261938530.name: nice and interesting
261938530.author: a TripAdvisor user
261938530.reviewBody: transportation from hotel to this place should  be more convenient. I like to see taxis or hotel shuttle. maybe discount on 4 wheeler so guest can ride to the port easily and enjoyably

261773220.name: Old Port In Puerto Penasco
261773220.author: a TripAdvisor user
261773220.reviewBody: Embrace the eclectic! Great fish tacos, fishing charter, fun atmosphere, it was an awesome experience.

258670045.name: Don\'t buy fish from  3 Bouys at the Malecon
258670045.author: a TripAdvisor user
258670045.reviewBody: We Visited Puerto Penasco  March 4,5 and 6.  Went to 3 Bouys at the Malecon. Bought  18 pounds of shrimp.  Got home and weighed it. 6 pounds short. This has happened before. It never changes. One thing you can be sure about Puerto Penasco is that the fish venders at the Malecon will short you every time.  I will continue looking for a vendor  that is honest and report it here. \n    The rest of old port is awesome. The vendors are all just trying to make some money. You can negotiate a price on whatever you want. Restaurants are all  petty good too.  It\'s unfortunate the fish vendors ruin it  for everyone else. If they were honest,  more people would come there.

258145032.name: Beware when buying fish from some of the Markets!
258145032.author: a TripAdvisor user
258145032.reviewBody: Four couples spent four days in Puerto Penasco/Rocky Point.  Accommodations great, sandy beach very clean, restaurants good, haggling with vendors fun...........but really put off by the fish vendor that we made a large group purchase from.  MARCO, don\'t buy here,  Sold us some sea bass, not sure what it really was but extremely mushy when cooked.  Everyone had the exact same problem with the bass.  Yes, they packaged the purchases in ice in a cooler.............but weighed less when we returned home than what they sold it to us as.  Not sure if all of the vendors are the same, but is very disappointing, would not recommend the fish markets, unless you take your own scales, also you don\'t really know what you are getting???    Not sure if anyone there really cares, beware as you are in Mexico.

258119876.name: A WORK IN PROGRESS
258119876.author: a TripAdvisor user
258119876.reviewBody: They are trying to improve this area.  It has always been a bit shabby,  but there is evidence of change for the better.  The Malecon (waterfront walk) area is quite nice and there are some good restaurants, not mention the fresh seafood markets all along the main waterfront street.  When we were there in Feb., 2015, the roads were all being torn up and repaved, making a mess of traffic.  Hopefully, they will have some it done by Spring break or else there will be gridlock around the port.  The typical tourist shops with hawkers in you face are plentiful.  It is our opinion that there are no really special shops in this area. It is what it is.  And we had fun going there and spending the day.

257906514.name: What you would expect...
257906514.author: a TripAdvisor user
257906514.reviewBody: ...of a very touristy area.  There are many restaurants, beautiful views, and lots of shops.  Prepare yourself for the locals who hussle you for parking, windshield washing, and getting you into their shops.  That being said, it is tolerable and there are some good buys after a little bargaining.

257734626.name: Love old port, best shopping and scenic dining in Rocky Point!
257734626.author: a TripAdvisor user
257734626.reviewBody:
We visit Old Port everytime we visit RP. Its the place to go for shopping and has a variety of restaurants available. Parking is less than easy to find most the time and its easy to get trapped waiting to back out so be aware of that.

There is a nice scenic area with benches on the edge of the water that is a wonderful place to take pictures and relax. 

There are many merchants that wander around here as well as countless shops, and yes the shop owners to try very hard to get you into their shops. Again, something typical of the Mexico experience but should be noted for people who are not expecting this.

We went back multiple times during our stay and will continue to be back every time we visit. Its a wonderful and charming part of town I hope they never change.

257452426.name: Typical port town.
257452426.author: a TripAdvisor user
257452426.reviewBody: Kinda cool/kinda litschy, somewhat touristy, but worth a visit even for an afternoon.  Poke around some of the metal work and pottery shops.

254329000.name: Old Port
254329000.author: a TripAdvisor user
254329000.reviewBody: Old Port is a place you have to visit at least once.  Good shopping, great restaurants and don\'t get vexed over the haggling vendors.  Remember they\'re all good-natured and friendly.  Just smile, say Gracias, No, and move on.

253989324.name: Best shrimp and snapper I can remember
253989324.author: a TripAdvisor user
253989324.reviewBody: Visit the fish markets and the restaurants above them. Very good prices and fresh each day. They all sell the same items and prices very little. I shopped at MR. Fish and was very happy with his prices and excellent quality

252983394.name: They hawk a lot but \'just say no.\'
252983394.author: a TripAdvisor user
252983394.reviewBody: Very find restaurants and values.  Just don\'t over buy.  I purchased many Green Bay Packer items, including a back pack and an end table. Don Jose Tequila was  very reasonable.  Two fer\'s were tremendous.  I certainly recommend El Capitan\'s on the top of Rocky Point.

252401874.name: cool place to see
252401874.author: a TripAdvisor user
252401874.reviewBody: this is the old town area.. it was typical of most Mexican old town spaces.. I liked the malecon for a lovely evening walk after dinner, some interesting sculptures as well.

251324547.name: Good place to visit if you can handle some of the hassle
251324547.author: a TripAdvisor user
251324547.reviewBody:
Love the area. Has some hidden gems when it comes to food and you might just find something to pick up as sueviners to bring back home. 

The down side is some of the hassle. If you don't like saying no constantly then avoid this area. As you will be asked to look and buy stuff, or come in and eat. 

Good area just can be a bit of a hassle sometimes.

249460211.name: Small but fun
249460211.author: a TripAdvisor user
249460211.reviewBody: Not a huge market area but the fish is FRESH. Not much besides fish and Mexican curios and a lovely boardwalk overlooking the rocks.

248177643.name: Wish we had more time
248177643.author: a TripAdvisor user
248177643.reviewBody: I had never even heard of Puerto Penasco before seeing the signs as we were driving to Organ Pipe Monument . Since we started our day so early we finished in the park by mid afternoon . Traveling into Mexico hadn\'t entered my mind , but since it was so close we all agreed to drive down . This was a first for all of us . Even though the road is dull we were excited . \n Somehow we ended up at the Old Port . I\'m so glad we did . I\'m sure the beach resorts are beautiful , but we wanted to see the real Mexico , even if it is aimed at the tourists . We only had a short visit but the plaza area was wonderful . We got a taste and would love to come back for more someday . We didn\'t have time to eat , we just walked around quickly and took pictures . \n Maybe because it wasn\'t planned , but it was one of the highlights of the trip .

248142467.name: Love Old Port
248142467.author: a TripAdvisor user
248142467.reviewBody: The city sinks more and more money into old port, making it a better and better each year I go.  I love it down there but never buy from the vendors, they all charge way too much and always say it is due to larger rent.  Trust me, you can get what ever you want somewhere else, much cheaper.  Shopping here  is for the touristy new comers.

247463962.name: Best of old and new
247463962.author: a TripAdvisor user
247463962.reviewBody: The Manecon or main street, is quite charming. Great restaurants, shop keepers are friendly, fish market is awesome and the public area has been redone in recent years. Clean, new but still a great reflection of Mexico.

247020391.name: A delightful way to spend an afternoon
247020391.author: a TripAdvisor user
247020391.reviewBody: It took a bit of searching to find the entrance, but was very worth it.  A great place to buy shrimp directly from the shrimp boats.  There are several excellent, seemingly trustworthy vendors.  We bought sensational shrimp twice there - once to eat and once to bring home (in a cooler with lots of ice).  Prices are negotiable for the shops, but reasonable.  Would go again.  Plenty of free parking now in a big lot.

246202814.name: Must Visit When in Rocky Point.
246202814.author: a TripAdvisor user
246202814.reviewBody: The old port has always been an attraction in Rocky Point, but over the last few years they have really improved it.  There are a plethora of shops and restaurants / bars. Parking can sometimes be a bear, as a rule of thumb you can park on the road if you park in the direction of traffic.  Make sure to leave valuables out of your car.  If you buy anything at any of the shops, be aware that prices are negotiable.  You can often times get as much as 50% off their asking price.  If you are staying in a house or condo and have a kitchen, be sure to buy some of the fresh seafood that they are selling.  It is always good quality and fresh. This is a very safe area, there are city police patrolling it constantly.

244823929.name: The Malecon
244823929.author: a TripAdvisor user
244823929.reviewBody:
OK every city is Mexico has one of these location for the tourists.
It's a fun place at night with plenty to location around to have drinks, dinner and more fun.
During the day you can find everything you want to take home here. LOL
As always on stuff to buy and take home never pay what they originally ask.
You can buy great hats for $10 each or less or you can do what I do. Buy 4 for $16 -$18 -$20 depending on quality.

You can also enjoy a great lunch and drinks with sea views.
Try the Avocado Surprise which is 4 haves of avocado filled with shrimp and slaw.
Worth the trip down there just for this. Sorry no pictures as I eat too quickly.

244803870.name: Alkie\'s heaven
244803870.author: a TripAdvisor user
244803870.reviewBody: I suppose that this was once a "tipico" charming old Malecon, but drunk Americans have pretty much ruined it. Seems to be an alcohol-fueled tourist trap.

244328376.name: Fun, Fun, Fun
244328376.author: a TripAdvisor user
244328376.reviewBody: The Old Port is a blast.  Merchants, booze, and seafood galore.  Took advantage of Lucky\'s $25 all you can drink special.  Wow!

243348520.name: Shopping, Eating, Drinking and More
243348520.author: a TripAdvisor user
243348520.reviewBody: This place has a little bit of everything and we stop in regularly in each visit to the area.  Don\'t be afraid to barter a bit.

243088909.name: get a real taste of being a tourist in Mexico
243088909.author: a TripAdvisor user
243088909.reviewBody: The selections are out of this world, prices are negotiable. Shrimp/fish/scallopa selection at its best! I accidentally tripped over a ceramic turtle which was not harmed, yet the store owner pestered me well past his store and down the street to pay for damages - I was upset as the object was placed where such an incident could happen and yet the safety of others was not considered. We had to get firm with the individual before he would leave us alone- sounds like a tourist trap to me, so be careful! The other shops were much better, no pressure.

242621319.name: Restuarant and bars are plentiful decently priced.
242621319.author: a TripAdvisor user
242621319.reviewBody: Found the best price on a fish platter at Pelicans. Fed the four of us with four of us guys with some to spare. make sure to ask for the mango sauce for the fish. Barter with the guys downstairs for the price.

241877423.name: Not a good representation of Mexico
241877423.author: a TripAdvisor user
241877423.reviewBody:
I so enjoy Mexico.
The people, the food, the culture and the music.
But when you get to epicenters of tourist central it shows the worst of any culture.
This part is beautiful IF you can ignore all the touts trying to sell you cheap trinkets.
The bars have great views and are fun places to enjoy a few drinks with buddies.
But the food is not anywhere authentic and they charge American prices.  

I love the area but the old port are is now so commercial that I have no interest to spend any time here.

Puerto Penasco has so much to offer; this is not on that list.

241785990.name: Beach Paradise
241785990.author: a TripAdvisor user
241785990.reviewBody:
it was near the Sea of Cortez, in a nice area, and lovely surroundings.
They aren't a lot of restaurants around to eat ate.  You do need a car to get around,

240164901.name: Fun Place to Shop and Dine!
240164901.author: a TripAdvisor user
240164901.reviewBody: We have spent a lot of time in the Old Port area. There are plenty of shops and the fish market is a good place to buy shrimp. Plenty of good places to eat. Parking is sometimes a challenge on the main street, but you can always park on a side street or on the next street over. If you park directly in front of the fish stalls, you\'re only supposed to park there for 30 minutes and guys will wash your windows and expect a tip. The Old Port area is a good place to have lunch and spend some time shopping. There are public restrooms on the east end (I believe it costs 50 cents or something like that).

239412618.name: Always a blast
239412618.author: a TripAdvisor user
239412618.reviewBody: We never get tired of walking around, finding something we dont need, buying fish, having some beers or lunch. Its Mexico so of course the shop owners try to lure you in but its fun. Highly recommend you visit the Shop called Mercedes. Amazing glass ware and ceramics. No haggling so thats nice too. Just off the malecon and across from the Friendly Dolphin restaurant. Note- we have never felt uncomfortable there, even at night and even in off season

237735464.name: Lots to buy and eat
237735464.author: a TripAdvisor user
237735464.reviewBody: we found it easier to take a cab than to try and find parking at the old port. These shops were the best stocked with trinkets and bobbles. So many little places to eat that you will find one you like.

236112587.name: Good to visit, but very busy.
236112587.author: a TripAdvisor user
236112587.reviewBody: Every time that I have gone to Old Port, it has been pretty packed. It is very slow driving through this area, but parking is usually readily available. There are tons of different things to buy here- lots of souvenirs, restaurants, and fresh seafood. It does get to be a little hard to look around in the crowds, and under the intense attention of sellers.

234291109.name: Like in an old movie...
234291109.author: a TripAdvisor user
234291109.reviewBody:
You know, when you watch an old movie, and you see the little old port, buzzing with activities and fishmongers, frozen in the years gone by and you think: Oh, it must have been nice to walk there? That's the Old Port in Puerto Penasco for you. 
Lots of shopping (not the best quality) and fish merchants, bars, restaurants. It's advisable to park your car as soon as possible because there won't be much parking available in the busiest streets.
We visited the Plaza Colisio with its little amphitheater, somehow it reminded me of Arcosanti (AZ) with the concrete architecture. A few monumental statues, especially the fisherman sitting on a giant prawn, quite interesting. And then, the blue, blue, blue ocean...
One thing to keep in mind: there are public bathrooms, but one needs to pay a fee of $0.50. 
US dollars accepted everywhere.

232109499.name: Old Port
232109499.author: a TripAdvisor user
232109499.reviewBody: This is the place to spend some time looking at things to buy, getting a great lunch, and buying fresh shrimp to take back to the condo for grilling.

231393496.name: Always fun for shopping and people watching!
231393496.author: a TripAdvisor user
231393496.reviewBody: The vendors are friendly although admittedly a bit pushy but never rude. It always fun to stroll down the streets to look at what\'s for sale and people watch. A good deal can be had with a little haggling and checking around. The locals are always good natured and will engage in a good conversation.

228014198.name: Busy!
228014198.author: a TripAdvisor user
228014198.reviewBody: Too many things to see and buy.. Great atmosphere it seemed like a shopping fiesta\nDidn\'t care for the pushy sales people

227911044.name: shop til you drop
227911044.author: a TripAdvisor user
227911044.reviewBody: there are many vendors and shops that carry a variety of trinkets, beach cover-ups, t-shirts, hats, souvenirs\' and a large selection of restaurants.  If seafood or Mexican food is your thing you are sure to find something you like. Be prepared to negotiate a price for your purchases, my rule of thumb is to offer 1/4 of asking price and be willing to pay 1/2 of original price.  Most vendors speak English and are very friendly.  You can also get a tattoo here too. \nShrimp season begins around Sept 15th, the prices for fresh Shrimp are great.  Shrimp come in 3 sizes.. the large is like a small Lobster tail.. $7-8 a pound cleaned...

222538586.name: Great Place to shop!
222538586.author: a TripAdvisor user
222538586.reviewBody: This was fun!  All the shops were hot but they were fun to barter with.  Take your time and find your best bargains.   Many places to also eat and to buy seafood things too!

220368078.name: Rustic place with a nice view
220368078.author: a TripAdvisor user
220368078.reviewBody: Walk around the malecon with the family, after lunch. I did not felt pressured to buy anything. Just wanted to take some pictures and take notes about the details on the buildings of this old port but there is not too many. There\'s plenty of restaurants to choose from and local vendors selling one of a kind type souvenirs, clothing, backpacks and many other things. Nice area to walk and enjoy the view of the sea!

219794803.name: Nice atmosphere
219794803.author: a TripAdvisor user
219794803.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking around the Malecon and wandering into a few of the shops. The merchants there are really willing to make a bargain, and you can get some great souvenirs here for nearly half the price that you would pay on the beach. Nice place for a day\'s stroll.

214743991.name: great walking
214743991.author: a TripAdvisor user
214743991.reviewBody: like that every sea food restaurant is within walking distance unfortunately if you buy sea food to take home most of the places have their scales rig you do not actually get what you pay for it is a shame to have this type of problem but scales are not regulated like in the estates. other than that great food all over

213363784.name: Fun in OLd Port
213363784.author: a TripAdvisor user
213363784.reviewBody: Old Port is a very interesting place. It\'s fun to shop and see the sights. Lots of cool trinkets and items for sale. On the south side of the street you have the fish and shrimp markets. You will get a wiff of rotting fish but keep going. There was one little shrimp store in the middle, right across from the triple decker bar with the palapas. The new owner is Manuel, great food and you can sit on the little blue wooden table over looking the sea.

213363757.name: old port mercedes rusticos and jewelry store behind church
213363757.author: a TripAdvisor user
213363757.reviewBody: you can\'t beat mercedes rusticos for a little bit of everything!, crosses, furniture, glassware, pewter, prints of rocky point, cards of rockypoint and mexico, xmas ornaments, day of the dead items, copper sinks, statues, it goes on and on a must stop for everyone.\nand the jewelry is fabulous at the store behind the church, and oh, you can have mexican frames made for your pictures at luis and gaby\'s frame shop, ask mercedes where it is around the corner. have a great trip like i do each time i visit. \'

213186521.name: Typical Mexican tourist spot
213186521.author: a TripAdvisor user
213186521.reviewBody: We walked through the Old Port area of Puerto Penasco several times during our 3 day weekend. It is what it is, a typical Mexican tourist spot with shop after shop of the same cheesy merchandise, restaurants, and cantinas. In the evenings, mariachi and assorted bands play in the sea front plaza of El Malecon, but they only play with randomness - you never know which group is going to play or when. They just sort of stand around drinking beer and then we they feel like it, they strike up a song. \nAlmost all of the stores carry the same stuff: knick-knacks  & souvenirs, jewlery, t-shirts, back packs and ceramics. A few places carry knock-off Michael Kors or Coach bags, but they are far over-priced. You can negotiate with the shopkeepers, in fact, you SHOULD negotiate with them, because the 1st price they give is usually double of what they will accept. A couple of them way overshot the price  and then immediately started going down, but they tend to make me not even want to negotiate if I feel they are taking advantage of me. One of my daughters was able to buy a cute U of A backpack for about $13 and the other got a very pretty pareo for $15, but it did take quite a bit of shopping around and haggling to get those prices. The best shop we found was right of the main drag, right behind the Portofino restaurant (across from my favorite restaurant, the Blue Marlin). The lady who runs that particular store was pleasant, not pushy, and easy to negotiate with.

213158070.name: A Fun Place to Stroll & Eat Fresh Seafood
213158070.author: a TripAdvisor user
213158070.reviewBody:
We usually stay in the newer area of Sandy Beach when we're in Rocky Pt. but lately have been going into the Old Port -- and always go to Kaffe House for breakfast.

On our last visit we were in the mood for fresh shrimp so went to the Old Port at lunch time, where the street is lined with fresh fish in front of all the restaurants. We decided to try as many places as possible to get our fresh fish fill! 

Of the 3 we went to, only 1 was a thumbs down. The other 2 were fantastic. One was a very tiny place directly on the water where we had bacon wrapped shrimp stuffed with spicy cream cheese. The other was across the street from the water on the third floor, where we had a huge platter of Little Nick clams in butter & garlic for $6! The flavor and value was incredible. Beware that, oddly enough, all 3 of these places served watered down sub-par margaritas. I thought that was strange.

It was fun walking along the street with a nice breeze from the water. Another thing to beware of is that although you can haggle pricing with the vendors they will still over-charge you. For example, we bought a small bottle of Turtle sun cream for a friend that we haggled down to $9 from $12. Then on our way home we stopped at a pharmacy to pick up a bottle for ourselves and it was $6 for a bottle double the size of our previous purchase!

It was a fun day and we plan on doing it again next time we're there...especially for that platter of clams. But this time we'll have a beer with it :)

212849015.name: Beware of the travellling Timeshare salesman.
212849015.author: a TripAdvisor user
212849015.reviewBody: Lots of shops asking for your business, not a particularly interesting venue.  Considering location could have more to offer.  Set up for people who want to get drunk and act stupid mostly.

209638342.name: great shopping , good food compare places
209638342.author: a TripAdvisor user
209638342.reviewBody: avoid anyone selling time share unless you 6 hrs to spend at a timeshare presentation . The locations are not close to Old Port.\nIf you decide to do a timeshare get the guy to write down several prizes or rewards to compensate you for your time

207934295.name: Fresh fish in the Old Port
207934295.author: a TripAdvisor user
207934295.reviewBody: Fresh fish prices were very reasonable, and we brought back a nice selection packed in ice in our cooler.

205552353.name: 3 Boys Shrimp - Shorted
205552353.author: a TripAdvisor user
205552353.reviewBody: On our recent trip to Puerto Penasco, we bought 7 pounds of large shrimp at "3 Boys".  The bags looked small when they were weighing them, but we didn\'t question it.  When we got home, I weighed each bag and they were about 11 ounces each - WAY less than we payed for.  I could have bought wild Mexican-caught shrimp cheaper at Costco.

203199269.name: Old Fashioned "Old Port"
203199269.author: a TripAdvisor user
203199269.reviewBody: Old Port has many small restaurants.  The best is "Aqui es con Flavio".  Beautiful view of the ocean, good service and good food.  Many small interesting shops and walking along the "boardwalk".  A fun place to be but good for families.

203173343.name: Music
203173343.author: a TripAdvisor user
203173343.reviewBody: Lots of brass bands playing on the malecon. Beautiful sunsets. People of all ages out strolling on the malecon

201917166.name: Very nice place for an evening stroll
201917166.author: a TripAdvisor user
201917166.reviewBody: Beautiful little market area, some restaurants, little shops, nice view of the beach on the other side. Some places to buy fresh sea food. Overall very nice.

200157176.name: Fish Market and buying shrimp
200157176.author: a TripAdvisor user
200157176.reviewBody: We visited Old Port and looked for fresh fish and shrimp to take back home. Our dilemma was that we spent almost all cash since very few places take credit card. To our delight we found JOSE\nFish Market and we purchased 5 lbs of sea bass and 4 lbs of shrimp.What a SCAM .Upon returning home we found that we were short on each about 2lbs.Beware... most likely all of them set their scales to their advantage. Next time trip to local grocery store will be cheaper. Other then that we enjoyed our little vacation.

196769334.name: Old Port at Rocky Point
196769334.author: a TripAdvisor user
196769334.reviewBody: Great place to find fresh shrimp and fish.  Try Breakfast at Lucky\'s.  $5 for a Bloody Mary and then the breakfast is FREE.  Breakfast included 2 eggs,, hashbrowns, beans of course, bacon and sausage.  Couldn\'t beat it for the price as you overlook the sea.

196026615.name: Old Port, or the Fish Market, or Malecon
196026615.author: a TripAdvisor user
196026615.reviewBody: We love this place so much that we bought a condo in the heart of it! There are great restaurants, coffee shops, Ice Cream parlors and lots of great stores and shops. We always feel safe and have made lots of good friends.

195939562.name: Small, old, but quaint
195939562.author: a TripAdvisor user
195939562.reviewBody: Watch the odor when the tide goes down, but the show of pelicans and seagulls eating and flying around is just indescribable.

195451758.name: Fun shopping and good eats
195451758.author: a TripAdvisor user
195451758.reviewBody: Check out Lucky\'s Cantina - good breakfast deal! Great views for watching dolphins and whales.\n\nAlso good seafood markets on the malecon, make sure you watch the packaging and the water content!

190636637.name: Buying seafood
190636637.author: a TripAdvisor user
190636637.reviewBody: We bought fresh seafood from 3 Boys at the Malecon.  It was delicious.  But they did short us.  Before we left, we bought shrimp and scallops.  When we got them home, I repackaged them and noticed how much water was in the bags.  After draining the water, we were more than one pound short of seafood.  We bought 8 lbs and got only 7 lbs.  We watched them weight it, so I\'m thinking they added a lot of ice to make up for the lost weight.  Live and learn.  I hope this helps if you go to buy some.  Make sure they don\'t add a lot of ice.  Because being cheated just ruins all the fun.

189746311.name: Great place to just walk and enjoy the sights
189746311.author: a TripAdvisor user
189746311.reviewBody: Went to four restaurants at the Old Port during our 6 day stay. Enjoyed the fantastic views of the ocean. Watching a pelican dive straight down from 50 feet into the ocean is breathtaking. Food was great. Lots of shops and vendors to experience the flavor of Mexico. Bargaining is fun.

189602788.name: Pleasantly Surprised
189602788.author: a TripAdvisor user
189602788.reviewBody: We were skeptical that RP would have much to offer, but really had an enjoyable 10 days . The fish market is terrific. The little restaurants on the first floor best the more expensive ones down the block and upstairs.

186916757.name: One of the BEST Melecon\'s in Mexico
186916757.author: a TripAdvisor user
186916757.reviewBody: I have walked long Malecon in Mazatalan with all the closed up shops,  I have been at the beautiful (crowded) harbor in Las Cabo\'s, I experiences the nice Malecon in Puerto Villarta, but Puerto Penasco has the best layout and organized area of all of them. The little Shrimp Town has done a great job in the planning of this area. They even have various entertainment their to catch the eye of anyone looking to culture. If you enjoy Mexico, you will love Puerto Penasco and all it charm. Remember, this is just being discovered now, so it is still the GREAT UNKNOWN. One can walk the area and discover quaint shops that are hidden in the streets surrounding the Malecon or just visit one of the many dinning areas.

186760353.name: Thanksgiven Holiday
186760353.author: a TripAdvisor user
186760353.reviewBody: Love the resort and have stayed there in the past. It was good the Zumba  boom box was not going. It is most annoying while trying to enjoy watching a beautiful sunset with an adult beverage on the terrace. If she at least got some music in English and lowered the sound  and did not face the box to the condos but the sea it would help. Nonetheless sunset is not the best time for this racquet. We have friends who own in the building and their comments about it have gone unheard so perhaps other guests enjoy a loud noisy sunset. We will be back perhaps in the more off season as it seems the Zumba classes are less or non existing. Max Blue is a great restaurant as well as Don Julio\'s.

186743125.name: LOVE shopping the Malecon
186743125.author: a TripAdvisor user
186743125.reviewBody: Try all of the restaurants that face the water.  Great food, always terrific service and beautiful views.  Make sure to go to Del Capitan to watch the sunset.

185798571.name: Old Port, Known Locally as The Malecon
185798571.author: a TripAdvisor user
185798571.reviewBody: A must place to visit when in Rocky Point! Great shopping, stunning views of the ships in port, Sandy Beach, and the Gulf of California from any of the upstairs restaurants. Stop in for a delicious meal of fresh fish, or simply for a few margaritas at the Boo Bar. The staff is very friendly and there\'s generally a good group of tourists having a ball up there. The shrimp stalls offer shrimp and other fresh fish that\'s been loaded into their coolers immediately upon coming out of the sea. As they say, "Our fish slept in the sea last night." You won\'t be able to eat shrimp anywhere else after being spoiled by these! Take a short respite from shopping at the Thrifty Ice Cream shop located on the main drag. Being a local here, I get tired of fighting off the vendors but they\'re just doing their jobs, so be sure to negotiate before buying!

181752411.name: Historic and beautiful!!!!!
181752411.author: a TripAdvisor user
181752411.reviewBody: The view from there is awsomw, you can walk and imagine the life there when it was just a fisherman village

181323129.name: Quaint Town
181323129.author: a TripAdvisor user
181323129.reviewBody: Felt very safe and the vendors hassle you but not any more than anywhere else.  To me, its a perfect size as it has enough stores to find different things but just as you get to seeing the same things, it\'s done.  Lots of places to eat right on the water.

181050061.name: Good folks and good shrimp.
181050061.author: a TripAdvisor user
181050061.reviewBody: I love the marketplace... bargaining/negotiating with the dealers there is fun. There is one guy that will take offense if you turn his deal down, but don\'t fret... you can buy the same stuff for the price you want to pay 2 doors down.

181018885.name: Copali Vanilla
181018885.author: a TripAdvisor user
181018885.reviewBody: When I go to Mexico there are only 2 things that I want to purchase and take home; Vanilla and Coffee.\n\nYou can find Copali Vanilla in Old Port (not on the sea side). There is a sign on the sidewalk saying Copali Vanilla so look for it and walk to the left back of this little shopping area. There is an older gentleman which sells this brand. The guy in the first store on the left sells the vanilla with the rooster on it. I have had this brand and it is OK but Copali is a notch up. (The best vanilla IMHO is from the vanilla store in Puerto Vallarta.)

180956995.name: old port
180956995.author: a TripAdvisor user
180956995.reviewBody: a perfect place to wonder in shops for trinkets, food, clothes, dishes, a must visit place, very relaxing, perfect ocean breezes

180750434.name: Avoid buying shrimp or fish from Armando\'s
180750434.author: a TripAdvisor user
180750434.reviewBody: We have been buying shrimp for  9 years at the Malecon in Rocky Point.  This year our regular fish vendor was not there so we bought from Armando\'s because he offered the lowest price.  When we got home I weighed what was supposed to be 8 pounds of shrimp and found he gave us only 5 pounds.  Also, 2 pounds of fish turned out to be only 1 pound.  We were cheated out of $20 by this guy.  We watched him weigh it on his scale, but obviously his scale was rigged.  Next time I am bringing my own scale and will never go to Armando\'s again.  \n\nThis is the first time we have ever had a problem in 9 years.  DO NOT BUY SHRIMP OR FISH FROM ARMANDO\'S!

180737646.name: Best place for 1st-time turistas to sample Old Mexico
180737646.author: a TripAdvisor user
180737646.reviewBody:
For first time visitors to Rocky Point, the Old Port area is the best place to sample a typical tourist environment.  Its quite safe, very colorful and offers a variety of attractions such as shopping, dining, sightseeing, night cruises and other diversions.  Most everyone speaks English however they are always glad to offer Americanos (and Canadians) a "Mucho gusto" and help with your Español.  My main advice is to simply slow down, take your time and enjoy your visit.

Parking and access is a bit challenging but patience pays off.  There is considerable free parking at the far end of the shopping area.  "The Monk" (That's my TripAdvisor handle) advises you park a block or two back from the main shopping drag known as The Malecon or sea-walk and make your way down there on foot.  Parking near the old Catholic Church is usually easy to find.  Be sure to try a fresh shrimp cocktail or taco.  The stores and vendors all offer basically the same goods but are always open to bartering. Prices are lower as you go back from the seafront.  If you have time, try to arrange a scenic sunset harbor tour.  Keep an open mind and don't let the initial crowds scare you off.

Bottom line, the Puerto Viejo or Old Port is a colorful and secure area to experience what its like to be a tourist in Old Mexico.  Take your time, check out the restaurants and follow the advice of veteran tourists and American "old hands' familiar with local customs.

180503827.name: Local Hangout
180503827.author: a TripAdvisor user
180503827.reviewBody: The old port is full of restaurants and shops...The locals come here at night especially on the weekends..There is free live music and street performance by the water on the weekends.  Parking is limited but if you eat at a restaurant in the area they will let you park there while you walk around..

180046393.name: Nice to visit for dinner
180046393.author: a TripAdvisor user
180046393.reviewBody: The Old Port is a semi charming area. Several good restaurants, especially for the money if you\'re comparing to the US. Be prepared for the standard hawking of flowers and mariachis and aggressive waiters trying to get you in to their places. Nice view of the water from several of the restaurants. It would be a nicer place if they made it car free to the endless stream of large and loud pickups and SUVs would go away. Be prepared for some noise if you plan stay close to the area

175490311.name: Great time in Mexic
175490311.author: a TripAdvisor user
175490311.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend a morning and then eat some lunch.  This is an area with a bunch of little shops that all sell the same stuff, really bad Mexican souvenir stuff.  Nothing of real value.  I did see one cool art store here though.  You can negotiate big time so never pay full price.  There are also a few restaurants here.  This area is very busy with American tourist and we felt very safe here.  You can buy beer on the street and walk around with it.  This is also a great place to buy fresh shrimp and fish.  In a few of the fish selling places behind them are a few restaurants (so small they don\'t have names) just about 5 tables in the gravel with a tarp for shade.  Over looking the bay.  These places have great food and great prices.

169651441.name: Fun Place to walk around
169651441.author: a TripAdvisor user
169651441.reviewBody: This area has a lot of shops, bars and great restaurants. They also sell fresh fish and the famous shrimp the town is known for.

165944378.name: Great Bargains
165944378.author: a TripAdvisor user
165944378.reviewBody: My girls and I just did some great shopping here last weekend. Prices seemed reasonable and they bought some nice silver jewellery. Very busy and very hot this time of year but the Pina Coladas in the pineapples were yum. Will be back to shop some more when next in Rocky Point.

165470667.name: Barter, Walk Away & Then Come Back
165470667.author: a TripAdvisor user
165470667.reviewBody: You can get a pretty good deal now as merchants WANT to make deals but the best way is to barter, start to walk away and if they don\'t give you a good deal, come back and tell them the guy down the street will give it to me for (fill in the blanks). You\'ll get a great bargain!

165114331.name: Always good
165114331.author: a TripAdvisor user
165114331.reviewBody: Good food, extensive menu, strolling mariaches, very friendly staff good view of the beach and hotels along it.

165094975.name: Always an experience
165094975.author: a TripAdvisor user
165094975.reviewBody:
Love to walk the Malecón and visit the many shops along the way.  

As you come to the end of Puerto Peñasco - Sonoyta Hwy 8 and prepare to turn onto Malcon Kino, you can turn right into a large parking lot. You'll get a high pressure pitch from the time shares and fishing boats, but it's easy to walk away.  

Plenty of good restaurants on the main street along the Malecón.  Have always loved Mary's and their Avocado Surprise.  Now I'm told El Perico Marinero, right next door, rivals Mary's wonderful food.  I guess I'll give it a try next time. 

Bartering is the way of the day in the many curio shops.  Everything imaginable, and plenty of smut.  

Three Boys fish market is a great place to buy excenllent shrimp. Cleaned and packed on ice for you. Good prices and trustworthy people.

Watch out for the price of vanilla. $5, $10, $25 dollars a bottle?? You can buy the same stuff at the Super Ley very inexpensively. There is one shop that, if you notice the ingredients, they use a sharpie to black out the word "agua" in the ingredients list.  They'll tell you it was an error.  "Pure vanilla" ... right...  Do a little research and find out about "pure vanilla" and what you think you are buying from the street vendors... ;)

Of course, you can always make the vendors day, buy meals for a week for him and his family.  Nothing wrong with that...

164959464.name: Excelent for pick a boat anf go to fish.
164959464.author: a TripAdvisor user
164959464.reviewBody: Looking for Gustavo or Pedro, this guys is decent and honest, never give money in advance to any body. Arrive early around 7.00 in the morning. The fish is excellent with this guys.. The old port is not good for take a bath, only for kayak or boat.

164955935.name: Where everything\'s at!
164955935.author: a TripAdvisor user
164955935.reviewBody: The Malecon, fish market, and restaurants/bars are located here.  The prices are higher than those on the other side of the marina, but they are cleaner and nicer.

162638169.name: Shop and eat til you drop.
162638169.author: a TripAdvisor user
162638169.reviewBody: Known also as the Malecon, the Old Port is situated next to the Sea of Cortez and offers shops, shops and more shops. There are restaurants to please any type of visitor. We really like Mary\'s. Old Port is also the place to buy fresh fish and shrimp from the local vendors. It\'s a must for visitors and is usually quite crowded on weekends.

162354546.name: Old Port
162354546.author: a TripAdvisor user
162354546.reviewBody: Long time traveler to Rocky Point and have seen many, many changes. This is Mexico and I love to shop for bargains there. There is nothing I need and can easily walk away; however, be prepared to be followed. I have a house full of d\u00e9cor and a jewelry box full of trinkets that remind me of Mexico and keep me happy until my next trip . . . where I will be back again searching for things that are "Almost Free!"

161934906.name: Excellent cheap fresh food!
161934906.author: a TripAdvisor user
161934906.reviewBody: We tried Restaurant Perico Marinero in Old Port on the main street.  It is next to Mary\'s and is upstairs.  Manuel will guide you when you are choosing how you would like your fish prepared.  The cook used to work at Mary\'s; this is why Mary\'s food has declined in quality & Perico Marinero\'s has risen!!  The food & presentation are excellent.  You must eat here!  Fish dinner is only $9.  Fish tacos $1.50.  Shrimp and carne asada tacos only $1 each!\n\nEat here and ask for Manuel.

161279931.name: Fun, great food, fresh seafood and great shopping!
161279931.author: a TripAdvisor user
