161279931.reviewBody: Love steamed clams and this is the best place to get them. Shrimp fresh daily........shopping is fun and lots to look at...........

159916960.name: Never heard "Almost Free" before
159916960.author: a TripAdvisor user
159916960.reviewBody: Old Port has lots to do, eat, drink and shop. Although all the shops have the same old cheep stuff, fake purses, tee shirts and sunglasses the best thing to shop for is the fresh seafood at the fish markets! We stopped at Three Boys fish shop and pick up some amazing shrimp and Sea Bass. The were so nice, they cleaned the shrimp and shelled it too. Then they packed everything in a cooler. We had lunch in Sr. Amigos. I had never eaten there before but was pleasantly surprised. We bought some vanilla and a beautiful Mexican platter. All in all it a great way to spend a windy day in Rocky Point.

159490038.name: Fun & relaxing !
159490038.author: a TripAdvisor user
159490038.reviewBody: We had a great time in Rocky Point.Best places to eat,go to the Pancho\'s in the Fish Market,they will cook your seafood to order,delicious.Also,Mary\'s is a great place for shrimp cocktail and tacos.el Hermano is a great place for breakfast,lunch & dinner,cheaper prices,the sopes are to die for,everything is fresh,they also serve a few american dishes,but I prefer mexican.

159455973.name: Puerto Penasco
159455973.author: a TripAdvisor user
159455973.reviewBody: I have been going there for many years.  Now there are so many great places to eat, I never know where to go.  Just read a review today of Brother Pizza.  After reading it, I wonder how I missed it.  I still like my taco place on the sidestreet in old Port.  Never can get the name right.  Pueblo Bonita on the beach is a great place to eat and enjoy the view.  They never rush you.  Going down in a couple of weeks and I am going to try one new restuarant.

157053742.name: Fun town with awesome seafood!
157053742.author: a TripAdvisor user
157053742.reviewBody: Great fresh seafood at the fish markets!  Amazing quality shrimp, clams and oysters.  Good shopping for the typical tourist items.  Our favorite bar was "Lucky\'s", and they serve amazing Margaritas and have a very friendly staff.  We felt comfortable bringing our kids there - ages 7, 10 & 15.  Beautiful views of Cholla Bay and the Sea of Cortez.  Be sure to check it out!

155261596.name: Great food nice view!
155261596.author: a TripAdvisor user
155261596.reviewBody: This is the place to get seafood, it seemed to have reasonable prices depending on where you went, and great selection. It is really safe since the police patrol often and are very polite. Watch out for people trying to hock time shares.

155086226.name: Exciting
155086226.author: a TripAdvisor user
155086226.reviewBody: Definetly loved all the shopping, and bars.\nDisliked the Persistent amount of people asking for money handouts or trying to sell you items

154969686.name: Love it!
154969686.author: a TripAdvisor user
154969686.reviewBody:
I love this little area it's the "Happening" place for Rocky point.
The restaraunts have delicious food.
And the shops have a lot of super cute stuff.
It's not "cheap" as some people would expect Mexico to be.
But the food is very very reasonable.
Don't miss this spot!

154303850.name: Beautiful beach view!
154303850.author: a TripAdvisor user
154303850.reviewBody: The Malecon has a beatiful view but it\'s also very rocky (hence Rocky Point!) and super windy! Dress in layers!  There are really good deals at the shops and food from the restaurants that you sit on roof tops. Bottom or street level restaurants were not that great.

152010527.name: Great seafood and restaurants
152010527.author: a TripAdvisor user
152010527.reviewBody: Clean well groomed area, with great restaurants and great fresh seafood to buy and cook in your condo

149810721.name: Seafood Delight!
149810721.author: a TripAdvisor user
149810721.reviewBody: I come here often and I always enjoy the great food and prices. The best place to eat seafood is "Aqui es con Flavio" it is great Mexican style seafood and probably the most affordable as well. Service is good. Also the shops have nice Mexican "Curios" and on the weekends at night you will find locals gathering hearing live music seaside on the benches/monuments. The music of choice is Banda which sounds like a polka with more horns and percussions and vocals. Lots of things to eat, buy, hear, and all seaside!

149292247.name: The Malecon
149292247.author: a TripAdvisor user
149292247.reviewBody: Great shrimp, cheap prescriptions and trinkets for the grandkids.  What more could you want?  Oh yea - great bars with views of the Sea of Cortez.\n

145832277.name: Just a fun place to hang out!
145832277.author: a TripAdvisor user
145832277.reviewBody: Old Port is, and has been, what makes Rocky Point a fun place to go for years.  The shops, the shrimp vendors and the rooftop restaurants provide many hours of recreation for the visitor!   Go with an open mind, and be prepared to bargain!

145326030.name: Walking in Old Port
145326030.author: a TripAdvisor user
145326030.reviewBody: We loved everything especially bar hopping...stop at Mexico Beach Bum for sure.  Then walk up and down the Malecon and stop in to sample some drinks and food at all the other restaurants.  Too much fun.

141257028.name: Excellent deals!
141257028.author: a TripAdvisor user
141257028.reviewBody: If you are shopping for something in mind, the shop owners are reasonable.  They can drop prices and compromise.  Shrimp...$6.00 per lb!

140726519.name: Amazing town
140726519.author: a TripAdvisor user
140726519.reviewBody: My family and I ate at Flavio, which had amazing views and delicious food!  After eating we took a stoll down the town, did some shopping, and bought ice cream.

139441936.name: Best Place in Penasco for seafood & cold cerveza
139441936.author: a TripAdvisor user
139441936.reviewBody: The old port is the place to go in Penasco for fresh seafood and a cold beer. There are many restaurants such as BOO Bar & Moon Shots most upstairs with seafood vendors below where you can buy shrimp,fish,clams,scallops, etc. There is shopping all around for the usual Mexican trinkets, jewelry, and pottery.

137782599.name: Night life in August
137782599.author: a TripAdvisor user
137782599.reviewBody: I\'ve been in PP for 6 days now, and on Saturday went to Old Puerto around 8:30PM to find somewhere fun, hoping to listen to jazz or Mexican live music.\nWe drove around and most restaurants were either closed or pretty empty. The ocean front sidewalk and plaza were completely dark nevertheless there were families and couples strolling around in the dark!

136443716.name: Street vendors pushy
136443716.author: a TripAdvisor user
136443716.reviewBody: They will not leave you alone and there are way too many of them selling the same items. Also, I wish there were posted prces. I think everything is based on what they think they can get out of you.

134244585.name: Nothing too spectacular
134244585.author: a TripAdvisor user
134244585.reviewBody: Close parking nearby.  Several decent restaurants to chose from.  Spent about 30 minutes walking around.  Probably wouldn\'t go to the Old Port again if I were to visit Puerto Penasco.

133507966.name: Like to shop?
133507966.author: a TripAdvisor user
133507966.reviewBody: Love Old Port with the fish market where you can buy fresh fish and shrimp. It is an experience you don\'t get here in the US. Good view of the bay, good restaurants and plenty of places to buy thos Oh, so needed, souveniers.

132957739.name: THE PLACE TO EXPERIENCE FOOD & VENDORS
132957739.author: a TripAdvisor user
132957739.reviewBody: Shops with everything you need, want, or don\'t want.......... Music, families hanging in the Governor\'s Plaza, superb restaurants. \nA MUST SEE IN PP

132651567.name: Tourist trap, cheap goods from China,
132651567.author: a TripAdvisor user
132651567.reviewBody: Sellers so aggressive, if you saw something you liked, they put something else in front of you and blocked you from what you were trying to see to sell you something else.

131749742.name: Wonderful spot for an evening strall
131749742.author: a TripAdvisor user
131749742.reviewBody: Loved it . the view is majestic and the kids loved the mariache on the promenade.

131225162.name: Old Port is a one trick pony
131225162.author: a TripAdvisor user
131225162.reviewBody: Used to be a great place to buy shrimp and take it back to the beach for a cookout.  That was years ago.  Now, there are way too many vendors vying for your attention and dollars.  It can get a little annoying.  Do yourself a favor and go to old port to walk around, have a couple of beers and maybe buy a souvenir.  I haven\'t found a good restaurant here yet, but that doesn\'t mean there aren\'t any, I am sure you might find something.  We usually eat away from Old Port and have had much better luck.\nThere is a really cool shop on the way out of Old Port, called Mercedes.  They have a very interesting store with all sorts of pottery, dishes, glasses etc.

130910381.name: Buy some stuff!
130910381.author: a TripAdvisor user
130910381.reviewBody: Lots of shopping for trinkets and fun things. Everyone will make a deal. Just ask.

130880509.name: Upgrade completed at last
130880509.author: a TripAdvisor user
130880509.reviewBody: It took almost 2 years to complete but the Old Port today is an outstanding place to visit, have fun shopping, get fine food and just kick back and enjoy Mexico.

130305026.name: So Much Nicer!!
130305026.author: a TripAdvisor user
130305026.reviewBody: There has been a lot of money put into the Old Port area and it is so nice now!! A gorgeous little area to view Sandy Beach with public artwork and restrooms. Not nearly as many fish stalls as the past, but a lot of more cool restaurants with stunning views and little curio shops. A must see when visiting Puerto Penasco!

128526226.name: Mexico Magic
128526226.author: a TripAdvisor user
128526226.reviewBody: Four-hour drive from Phoenix or Tucson for a SAFE and fun Mexico trip.  Stay in a luxury resort on Sandy Beach or (recommended) rent a condo or house in Las Palamas (gated community on the beach).  OR, drive 15 min further to Cholla Bay for a more authentic (cheaper and safe) experience.  We went with grandkids ages 4-6 and they loved it.  GREAT beaches in Penasco area but avoid hotels in old town Penasco ("spring break" atmosphere).  Fun clam digging and hunting sand dollars in Cholla Bay.  Restaurants outside the resorts are reasonably priced, safe, and good.  Grocery shopping is fun.  Super fresh shrimp is sold on street corners and at the pier. LOTS of souvenirs.   The aquarium (near Las Palamas) is a joke but the kids loved it.

128486652.name: BOOZ & SHOPS
128486652.author: a TripAdvisor user
128486652.reviewBody: u can find anything & everything u want to party down !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

128359267.name: Updated
128359267.author: a TripAdvisor user
128359267.reviewBody: Love all the improvements that have been made in Old Port.  There is more parking and with the help of a couple of gentlemen directing and assisting for tips only, the traffic flows well.\nBe sure to stop at Marco\'s Fish for scallops, shrimp and flounder!

127163512.name: Love the Malecon
127163512.author: a TripAdvisor user
127163512.reviewBody: Love the benches and looking at the views, the water and the sunsets.

126676983.name: Old Port is where the action is
126676983.author: a TripAdvisor user
126676983.reviewBody: Any trip to RP must include some time in the Old Port area.  It\'s fun to walk around and see what is the vendors are selling.  Great bar scene, amazing ocean views from many bars and restaurants.  Food is ok - we go for the view more than the food.

126416154.name: Friendly, good  food, fun place,with views!
126416154.author: a TripAdvisor user
126416154.reviewBody: Construction on the street but it should be done by now.people were friendly food was good, shopping fun!

126255351.name: You can get food and a lot of stuff.
126255351.author: a TripAdvisor user
126255351.reviewBody: It\'s not terribly charming, and it\'s not terribly cheap.  Better bargains are on "Rodeo Drive".

125862169.name: looks nice but...
125862169.author: a TripAdvisor user
125862169.reviewBody: They have really upgraded the look of the old port area. There is a nice town square and benches to watch the sunset. However, the shops are really sad, not much selection and the venders are quite aggressive.

124969511.name: Don\'t miss Mary\'s resturant
124969511.author: a TripAdvisor user
124969511.reviewBody: Great service, the location upstairs sitting with a slight breeze watching the shrimp boats & ocean make this a great spot to relax. Did I mention the best Bloddy Mary around!

124235278.name: Good Food and View
124235278.author: a TripAdvisor user
124235278.reviewBody:
This place has lot of shops and restaurants. There is also a very good promenade. Must visit in Puerto Penasco.
I think the shops are not cheaper. A beer mug costs $10 after bargain
Lot of restaurants. Again, they are also bit costly
However, the place is very good and good for bit of shopping and food

123659605.name: Limited to a small strip along the waterfront
123659605.author: a TripAdvisor user
123659605.reviewBody: Although the basic shopping area and restraunts for tourists is limited it is nice but go 1/2 block back and rough dirt roads and we found it a place good for 3 or so hours max.

122838134.name: Obviously the focal point of the town.
122838134.author: a TripAdvisor user
122838134.reviewBody: A collection of bars, restaurants, curio shops, fish market and an absolutely beautiful Malecon. Take time to park and walk the Malecon as this is a local favorite on the weekends.

122789193.name: Nice place to wonder around in
122789193.author: a TripAdvisor user
122789193.reviewBody: Enough small outdoor shops to purchase souvenirs at and quite a few reasonalably priced restaurants to eat at.

121359198.name: Places to eat
121359198.author: a TripAdvisor user
121359198.reviewBody: Many great places to eat and watch the ocean.  I always buy fishe to take home.

121262766.name: An Evening on The Sea of Cortez
121262766.author: a TripAdvisor user
121262766.reviewBody:
The moon slid slowly, almost parallel to the horizon, a tiny gold crescent, eventually falling out of sight below the distant black horizon. Few lights showed across a dark sea punctuated by an occasional flash of white surf. A cool steady breeze coming off the sea rustled gently in the palms overhead and called for a jacket to keep warm. 

A green light appeared, waving in an arc, soon recognized as the top of sail boat mast that bobbed stationary in the sea a few hundred meters from the sea wall. After a pause, the boat coasted silently by, a dark wraith on an otherwise empty sea, eventually showing it's heels and a white light on the mast, disappearing into the harbor. A bright flashing blue light appeared out of the harbor moving slowly up the beach passing the long row of lighted high rise condos, disappearing over the horizon to the south west.

 Music floated around, La Bamba in a full throated version from a group of four entertaining a couple, a solitary accordian calling for a customer, and the ratat tat tat of drums in the distance. The background filled in by the soft swish, swish, swish of the surf, murmers of nearby people and the occasional shout or laughter of a child. An annoying motorcycle passed by twice, an advertisement blaring from a powerful amplifyer. A loud clatter and thump punctuated as loads of broken concrete were scooped into large trucks as work on removing the old pavement near the escuela continued into the night hours.

 A young lady swept by "would you like a flower" with the recognizable florish of the flower vendors. Two mujeres moved on to an adjacent bench and their fragrance came on the breeze, sweet and cloying. A cat wandered by, hesitated then hopped on to the sea wall, curled up companionably close. A couple walked by trailed by an impossibly small chihuahua. The cat alerted, flicked it's ears and stared intently at what, under other circumstances might have been la cena.

 An October evening by the Sea of Cortez on the Malecon, Puerto Penasco, Sonora Mexico. A wonderful weekend escape from Phoenix or Tucson.

121145541.name: Nothing special
121145541.author: a TripAdvisor user
121145541.reviewBody: Just typical high pressure sales of Mexican tourist items.

119647560.name: Great Shrimp
119647560.author: a TripAdvisor user
119647560.reviewBody: Buy some fresh shrimp from Oct-March to take home in a cooler.  It is delicious.

117941123.name: Just another thing to do
117941123.author: a TripAdvisor user
117941123.reviewBody: There is not a lot to Rocky Point.  So going to the Malecon (boardwalk) is a good place to go for wall to wall resturants and gift shops.  Most of the resturants are on the water so they have great views of the ocean, fishing boats. etc. For a geat meal go to Flavios
